lic_profile: Serving authentic southern Italian soul food, 7 Numbers Eglinton has an eclectic, warm and casual atmosphere.  The menu selections are bright and robust, loaded with flavour, prepared nightly by Mama Rosa from guarded family recipes many generations old. With an open kitchen, the food and chefs are the stars of the show.

reviews.text: Driving through the highway and found this wonderful place.  Super friendly staff. So glad I discovered it.  A great alternative to the fast food restaurants in the area.

My husband and I have been coming to Seven Numbers for years. The staff is always friendly, and Tom in particular always goes out of his way to make sure we’re having a great night out. The food is fantastic: although the lasagna, meatballs, and duck are probably our favourite, there hasn’t been a dish that has not been delicious. Seven Numbers serves Italian comfort food like nonna would make. It’s is a great spot for either a group gathering or a date night. Our family from Casserta had a great time when we brought them this past week. So it’s also Italian approved :)
Great food great service, be aware they are closed Monday night
Lovely place with excellent Italian food, the owners are fantastic and really work hard to make you feel welcome.  A little fancier then most fare in the area,  good for a semi-formal date night.
One of my favorite local restaurants.  Always consistently delicious with top notch service.
Mamma's meatballs are one of the many reasons to hit this location. Owner  is a reason to visit Danforth location, always entertaining if you sit at the bar...
This is a cute little Italian restaurant in North York. But unlike most Italian restaurants in North York this place does not have pizza, they have couple...

Chef Michael Da Silva prepares a variety of traditional and contemporary dishes with primarily Portuguese and Spanish influences. White tablecloths, rustic bronze walls and cozy booths provide a fine yet casual ambience. Adega's pastry kitchen and port wine selections offer the perfect finish to the Adega experience.

reviews.text: Found this gem when looking for dinner date restaurants near Eaton Centre. I visited this restaurant with my fiance and as soon as we entered the restaurant, we immediately felt welcomed. The host was really friendly and nice. We made reservation online and had put in request for a more private table. So we were given a table in the corner which was exactly what we wanted. We ordered Grilled Portuguese Sardines, linguine with tiger shrimp and saffron seafood risotto. The food was phenomenal, the seafood risotto was particularly delicious. They also have really good desert options. We got the recommended Dark Lindt chocolate mousse cake, and it was definitely one of the best mousse cakes we had. The restaurant has nice romantic ambience, with great food and service. Great place for a romantic dinner date!

Had dinner here with coworkers and clients. The service was excellent and the food solid.  

Always feel free to reach out to me on Twitter @joerazz
The rissoto was yum. Nice and a creamy! I also really liked just how friendly and attentive the servers were. the top floor is also a perfect venue for an even for about 30 people.

Excellent Mediterranean inspired cuisine. You definitely pay for great quality of food and service. The appetizers are a bit overpriced for the amount that you get but they are delicious. Of the main courses I have tried the squid and the salmon and they are both incredible. Highly recommended

Want great Portuguese??

Look no further. Best grilled octopus in Toronto. Cozy, classy, great service, great food, this place has been in business for a very long time. I've been coming here for a decade and it's been so consistent. Same menus since then. There's a wine cellar downstairs for private parties. 

Amazing olive oil for dipping bread, just so good. 

Ask for the booth for special occasions.
I came here the other day with a couple girlfriends spontaneously for a friends birthday. It was a Tuesday evening and the restaurant was relatively quiet....

Nice spot for date night, not too stuffy not trendy good service good food and not insanely loud like some restos can get when crowded. 

Reasonable prices...

This is a fuddy-duddy place that has been here forever, yet, still serves good food. 

The waiters are very seasoned, they've seen it all. They provide a...

Casual and chic with modern Danish furnishings paired with acrylic tabletops in a multitude of vibrant colours and a contemporary installation of Frank Stella's work. AGO Bistro's contemporary global bistro cuisine showcases seasonal flavours featuring local seasonal fare and quality fresh ingredients.

reviews.text: We had an awesome lunch as always before going into the AGO. The service was as always outstanding. The food was great, they have a great kitchen staff. The server was more than helpful, she did a marvelous job

Okay, the food was scrumptious and flawless. The drinks were fascinating and also flawlessly mixed. Great. 

But also, staff went out of their way to help us and meet our dietary needs, suggesting the perfect celiac-friendly dish (probably the best dish at the table) and were generally friendly and genuine without being annoying. What a fantastic way to follow a gallery visit.

Private function space called the Red Room was perfect for my company launch with 75 guests. Staff was superb. Did not try to oversell me on anything and service was outstanding. Top end venue with personal service that makes your guests feel really special!
Very friendly staff that provide great service. I had their burger, which was a tasty option for lunch
Always amazing food and cocktails, great place to sit after the gallery
Loved the Happy Hour at the bar here! I visited the bistro before the Yayoi Exhibition and was impressed how they changed their bar menu to Japanese...

lic_profile: A quaint, neighbourhood restaurant, Aiolio is located in the heart of Cliffside Village not far from the Scarborough Bluffs. The menu features dishes from the South of France, such as confit de canard, and classics from Italy with a touch of Mediterranean flavour, all using local and regional ingredients. Friendly service and personal attention by the chef and staff set the stage for a wonderful meal in this charming bistro.

Absolutely amazing food. Great atmosphere. Service is quick and friendly.

lic_profile: Most appropriately named, music lovers and food enthusiasts have made Alleycatz a popular dining and party destination. A menu with Mediterranean flair, a varied martini line-up and after dinner entertainment in the form of salsa, bachata, and live bands playing blues & top 40's dance music. Warm and convivial in red oak and exposed brick, Alleycatz sets a comfortable and fun environment for their guests.

reviews.text: The music was good. The crowd was about 45 to 60 for the most part. I don't like washroom attendants, I can squeeze my own soap and get my own paper towel. There was no attendant when I arrived about 915 pm but the second time I used the washroom later there was an attendant. I didn't have cash and got a grumpy look from the attendant, whose help I did not need, otherwise I would have rated a 5.

Came here for my friend's birthday with a group of 10. Called ahead and made a reservation the day before and they gave us the option of having a fixed menu OR the regular menu even though they preferred fixed menus for large groups. We told them we would rather get the regular menu and they were fine with it. End up going there the next day and we're given the option of fixed menu. Spoke to the owner and he was being a dick. The food was SO not worth it for what you pay for. I got the "orgasmic penne" and it was so bland. Totally not impressed with the service and the food. Never coming here again and I would not recommend this place to anyone for that matter.

The food is delicious and the atmosphere is very nice with great music. My boyfriend and I had a great time and our server was one of the best I've had in a while. He was the only one working and still managed to give us excellent service. If you like dancing this is also a perfect spot!
The food was amazing! The server was working by himself and he managed to make everyone happy! He did a great job! The band is good too! Definitely going to come back soon

Fun place for all ages. Live band, DJ, good food, good drinks, big screen TV. The people are really diverse, from different backgrounds, between 25 to 50+. Music is also very mixed. No cover charge before 9pm. Theme nights, all week long. A must-visit place at least once. Desserts looked great too.The bar has little hooks for jackets which is a bonus in winter.
Came in with a Groupon today.  Customer service was great and we really enjoyed the food. I really liked the atmosphere and our food came out at a...

lic_profile: Amano Pasta, a new underground restaurant at Toronto’s Union Station is an open concept, handmade pasta bar inspired by Italian heritage, but not defined by it. Chef Michael Angeloni combines classic Italian cooking techniques taught to him by his nonna, with locally sourced, often unexpected ingredients. While the dishes are Italian, many of the ingredients (like black sesame, jalapeño, and tahini) are not. Amano offers classic Italian eats like Fat Tubes Rigatoni Bolognese with local Ontario beef and pork, with the focal point of the menu being a section Chef Angeloni has dubbed ‘Not Your Nonna’sPasta’. Amano’s wine list includes Italian classics but is rounded off with Canadian offerings, which either focus on Italian wine making techniques or grapes themselves.
lic_lunchmenu: Choice of crema, dulche de leche, chocolate hazelnut

reviews.text: It seems odd that such a great pasta restaurant is located in the building where I commute back and forth to work each day... but Amano is simply fantastic.  There is a great variety of pastas and the menu changes regularly. Service is great and attentive. I've been twice for dinner already and will definitely be back. Plus the convenience factor for those who need to hop on a go train is unbeatable.

The atmosphere was amazing and fun. The pasta selection was really good. My pasta was the one of the seasonal dish (yellow ribbon). There was so much flavor. 

The apps are great especially the smoked pig! 

Note: it gets pretty busy during lunch hours. Be prepared to wait for your food
Staff really took care of us.  Food was excellent. The start of cocktail. Sparkling red wine was really really good.  Chef's choice appetizer, great selection on it

Love their pasta! Their squash salad app is also very tasty. I like how they provide 2 categories for pasta - traditional vs. "not your nonna's pasta" - Great location too for commuters and anyone passing by as tourists heading to Aquarium, CN Tower, Blue Jays game.

Food was amazing. I tried their pasta with cauliflower, it was delicious. The pasta is made fresh and this is why it is so tasty. The staff is very friendly and can help you with your order. The atmosphere is great. All in all, this is a great place for lunch and to hang out with friends
The restaurant is located by the York street entrances to Union station, in the underground, just outside (north) of the GO train concourse. There is a...
Three stars mainly for the food. Let me explain, I went with a friend on Thursday evening around 8:30. The restaurant was dead except for a table of three...

You have two choices: $29 or $39.  The latter includes a shared appetizer...

reviews.text: So in love with the design of this venue! Our team at VintageBASH had so much fun decorating this venue for a wedding last month. The place itself is already very beautiful so it was much easier for us to do the decor.... the ceiling, the setup.. oh my! Love it. The staff were great, and friendly too!

We attended a Wedding Reception at your Restaurant May 20th 2018. We were all very pleased. The service from start to finish was wonderful. The food was top notch. Our complements to all the staff. My grandson and his new bride picked a Wonderful Beautiful Restaurant for their Wedding Venue. Thank you to all who helped make their day a Wonderful Day to Remember..

I don't think I've ever left a negative review before for a restaurant before. I was there Thursday evening with about 20 of my colleagues for a work function.  The restaurant itself was pretty cute, in a trendy location.  I understand it's difficult to get out 20+ meals at the same time. That's a ton of work, and we would never complain about waiting for food, etc. That part was actually fine, everyone got everything in good time meal-wise. The food was decent, nothing really mind-blowing, except the dessert. Oh my goodness, the desdesserts were AMAZING. The gentleman filling up the water was awesome, I don't think my water was even close to empty once. However, the other staff treated us like we were an inconvenience. I was glared at by the staff, ignored often, and really just felt that they really did not want us there. I always pride myself on my manners and patience, I work in customer service, too. I totally get how brutal it can be. I made sure I was extra polite and patient, but I actually was super uncomfortable with how hostile the staff were towards us.I can honestly say I've never received stink eye like I did from the staff at Archeo.  I wish we went somewhere else that night.

Wonderful casual Italian restaurant, great place to share a pizza, excellent food and very reasonably priced. Just opposite the lakefront, so you can walk over and get some decent views of toronto skyline in the distance. Parking available in road, opposite the restaurant
Great venue for a wedding!!! Stuart and his crew were phenomenal! Couldn't have asked for a better venue for my sister's venue
Very sophisticated place, onde of the best italian food ever tried! The pasta with fungi was amazing! Very good place to celebrate a special occasion with...

The PIADINI flatbread...

lic_profile: Aria offers genuine Italian fine dining in a contemporary urban setting. Aria is owned by Guido Saldini and Elena Morelli the proprietors of Noce Restaurant which has helped set the standard for Italian cuisine in Toronto for almost 20 years.  "Aria" means "air" in Italian but also references the most Italian of art forms - opera.  Both themes are evident inside Aria which boasts a dramatic 35 foot ceiling and is situated adjacent to the Air Canada Centre and Maple Leaf Square. Aria has dining capacity for 130 people and can accommodate private parties in a variety of formats.

reviews.text:
Wonderful experience.  I stopped in just to grab a beer before the Raptors game.  I couldn’t resist trying the food.  The scallops are a show stopper, not filling in the slightest but still worth every penny at $25.00.  I wish you could order a whole plate of them,  but the mussel & clam spaghetti main was a fine substitute.  
Friendly & Welcomely wait staff, quick service & a manager (possibly Owner) who checks up on your service regularly.
I can’t recommend this restaurant enough.

I had the most terrible experience at this restaurant a few months ago. I came here on a girls night out and we were extremely excited to try this restaurant out as we had heard great things about it. 

The waitress Nadja and her Manager were extremely unprofessional. My friend had ordered the seafood pasta and upon tasting it, realized how bland and disgusting it was. My friend nicely informed the waitress about this and the waitress proceeded to argue with my friend, saying that she wouldn't have suggested this entree in the first place. I was very surprised to hear the waitress discredit the menu and start arguing with my friend.

After this incident we asked to speak to her manager and it took about a hour for both of them to clear our table. In this time, we could see every staff member rolling their eyes and clearly speaking about us. 

Save your money and time and go somewhere else. I hate to leave bad reviews but this was the worst experience ever. The food was bland and not worth the price. There are many other great Italian restaurants in Toronto!

Amazing food and service, in the heart of downtown. Upscale experience with upscale pricing. Perfect for customer meetings or a special date. And amazing location to the air Canada centre for a game after.
Fresh and delicious food.  Great location.  Amazing staff.
One of my favourite spots downtown. Always have extremely simple and delicious Italian dishes. Great place for a nice dinner but a bit on the pricier side
Aria is pure class! Booking was very easy and they understood I had an event to attend and were very aware of giving us the Aria experience and getting us...
Attentive, professional service, and convenient for a pre-game meal. Bonus: in the cold winter months you can get here from union station without having to...

reviews.text: One of my family's go-to Korean spots (I'm Korean). We had our wedding rehearsal downstairs and then had dinner on the main floor. The catering/group meal options were amazing - better than the regular menu IMO. For regular dining, the quality is still very good and they have a lot of options, but it's a bit pricier than other smaller restaurants in the area. But it's also a nicer space than the smaller joints. I find that it's a great place to introduce people to Korean food, and great for families. There's ramp access a lot of space, which is perfect for my toddler & infant & stroller.

Walked in from the street without a reservation and immediately got a table. Service was quick and friendly, deals on every day with some drinks promos Sunday-Thursday. Food was tailored as needed and really delicious as well as reasonably priced. Would happily recommend to anyone!

Been to many Korean bbq places before in Toronto, but I have to say Arisu exceeded my expectations. The quality of the meat was excellent as well as the side dishes that were served. Reasonably priced for good quality and service. They frequently check up on you to change the grill as well as refill water, unlike other places where you always have to ask. The staff was very welcoming and made it a great experience.
Best restaurant that I've been to. The three course meal was very filling and quality was very high. The food was worth every dollar

Nice and quiet atmosphere. The food was good at very affordable price. Waitresses were pleasant, helpful and friendly but had a slight feeling that they wanted us to leave right after we finish our food. Anyways the experience was great. I’ll definitely come to eat there again.

I'll be honest: I'm not the biggest fan of Korean Barbecue. What, you want me to cook my own food? I could just do that at home!

My unreasonable bias...

I ended up getting a combo that came with udon noodles, Pork Katsu and salmon roll.

lic_profile: Auberge du Pommier has been serving discerning Toronto diners since 1987. Constructed around the rustic vestiges of two 1860's woodcutters' cottages, this exquisite French Restaurant offers modern five star cuisine, professional and personal service and a 500 label wine selection. Guests can enjoy lunch or dinner in the beautiful dining room or on the bright, floral terrace.

reviews.text:
The atmosphere is always a perfect blend of fresh and cozy. The moment you arrive you feel like you've been transported from an urban business centre to a small cottage in the French countryside. Auberge du Pommier has become one of my favourite go-to spots for special luncheons. 

We called ahead to see if the restaurant could accommodate a vegan diet. The waitstaff was incredibly on point, asking if there were any other dietary restrictions. The chef created a dish just for me based on my feedback. It was absolutely incredible.

Long overdue review.  My husband and I have been coming here for years and the service is consistently amazing.  It was my daughters birthday last week and we can here for dinner. They were so accommodating to us. We brought our own cake, we had our own little spot to the side. The staff so so attentive and kind as always. We truly appreciate the service and we will continue to come back.
Very delicious! Service was excellent! Food was exquisite and wonderful. I went with my wife, sister, and nephew. Atmosphere was beautiful. I would definitely go dine here again.

Amazing food and service. The restaurant venue is so rustic and chic. Quality and presentation of the food is rarely met anywhere else. I wish I had pictures of the tuna fish I had it was perfect. Valentine our waiter made sure we were satisfied and content with everything. 5 stars!
I love this place.  Great service.  Exquisite food.  Fabulous wine list.  Beautiful surroundings.  Quiet - you can actually talk.  It's pricey but worth it.
It's good to know that no matter how much time passes, I can always return to Auberge and it still has the same impeccable service, speed, and quality that...
Great front of house/table service and romantic setting, but unfortunately found the food to be mediocre.  There was lots of veining in our foie gras...

Been there a while ago. Think I'll still write down something. 

As of food I think this place is good. But I do think a full set of dining experience would...

reviews.text:
The food is delicious there, and their portions are very large! Ordered 3 dishes for 4 people. 
It was a hot day and inside the restaurant was a little hot though they have fans everywhere.

We were walking around trying to find good food at affordable prices, and this was perfect! Fresh, tasty, and handmade food with perfect service. If we come back to Toronto we will likely come here as it was our best restaurant experience on our visit to Toronto.
Friendly staff. Tasty food. Good size portions. For two people, I would order a couple of appetizers and a main to share.
They are really great with accommodating large groups and children. The staff are friendly and the food is awesome.
Robert and Al are amazing and attentive owners.  Food is excellent and menu meets all your needs.  Maria is a wonderful server, great place to meet a group of friends and make new ones.
Aviv is one of my favorite restaurants in the Annex. Amazing food with friendly staff. The have specials every day of the week (Half-priced bottles of wine...
I love this small restaurant. Decoration is really interesting and unique. Most importantly, They offer the best pizza in town. It is as good as those one i...

Wow. This is the stuff.  This is the hidden gem of an area that is rather lack luster.  

Aviv is hidden away in a somewhat regrettably run-down area near...

reviews.text: Decent restaurant. We tried their crab and avocado parfait and cauliflower soup as a starter. The parfait was perfect. The soup was on the heavier side. The salmon entree was well cooked. The vegetable sides that came with the salmon were inedible. Finally, finished it off with apple pie cheesecake. Again, too rich and heavy for my liking. The rating would have been higher if not for the server. His face fell when we refused to order drinks. He must have decided that his time would be better spent looking after patrons who were spending more $$ by ordering drinks, that he only came to our table every half an hour or so. No refilling of water. Every course took a long time to come. No apologies. Lastly, he handed us the debit machine asking us to input the subtotal numbers ourselves. That tells me a bit about the attitude that is held in there.

It has very nice decor, and when you walk in, it seems very nice. However, after taking our order the waitress completely disappeared. There were literally 15 people in the entire place. The steak we ordered was cooked wrong, and honestly inedible. My 6 yr old daughter had mini burgers that were borderline burnt. I couldn’t find the waitress at all. She was constantly missing for long periods of time. The table beside us was angry about it as well. I ended up sitting there alone for 15 minutes to pay the bill because my wife and daughter couldn’t stand it anymore and wanted to go back to the room.

Ridiculous reviews undervaluing this restaurant punching way above the expectation. Each flavour in our starters and entree was clearly distinguishable and well matched. Good wines by the glass too, and just got better in the desserts. We did not have mains, but may come back!!

Azure offers an intimate and refined venue for casual conversations over drinks. The drinks menu is neither too expansive, nor too limited. The cheese platter I ordered was simple, but marvelous. I did, however, feel that the prices were unnecessarily steep. That said, I enjoyed my experience and am likely to return. The quality of the service made up for any minor complaints I had.

Food was okay. Ordered crab parfait and the crab was a little fishy - wouldn’t recommend. Also had beef tenderloin which was over-cooked and did not have any blue cheese. Don’t think I’d come back but it was decent enough. had a very attentive server.
I had lunch with some colleagues and found he overall experience fairly average, food was probably a little below average while the service and wine...
Considering the prices I would expect a server to know how to cut wine seal, pop cork and pour wine properly! Dishes were not cleaned off in sufficient time...
Nice place in the intercontinental hotel. Food is very good, but very pricey. Good serving staff.

lic_profile: Housed in a historical building, Bangkok Garden is one of the first restaurants to introduce traditional Thai cuisine and culture to Toronto over 30 years ago, and is acclaimed as one of North America's premier Thai restaurants. One of only four Toronto restaurants to be awarded the Thai Select Premium designation from the Thai government, recognizing authenticity of food and outstanding service, Bangkok Garden serves food based on the Thai principle of balancing the five tastes: sweet, hot, sour, salty and bitter, including fiery stir fry and flavourful curries. The bar offers a large selection of exotic cocktails, international beers and an extensive wine list.

reviews.text: This is my second time visiting Bangkok Garden. The atmosphere is absolutely stunning. I love the water, the decorations and the lighting. However, the food is less than stellar. I had the glass noodles and they were absolutely way too salty, too oily and the chicken tasted like it had been previously frozen. I quickly became bloated from the food and could not finish my meal. We also ordered the calamari for appetizers and they were very rubbery and difficult to eat. Our server was beyond disappointing. He made little to no effort to talk to us (We were the only ones eating here too!). When we asked for the bill split for two people he did the math in his head and ended up overcharging us. Luckily we could do the math and corrected him. I don't think we will be returning for a while. It was just not worth the price. Too bad as the atmosphere is lovely.

This place has a very good Chinese food. The pace looks very clean and had a wonderful design. Lots of mirrors.

I had vegetable tofu, great chicken wings and various salads. All was great.

The service was nice too and wait staff quickly accommodated our party.

A+++

The place is absolutely beautiful! Our server was super sweet and made a few jokes! I liked her. Haha. I told our server that I have an allergy to peanuts and that I am aware of the no guarantee, to please use caution. She very much did and the food was delicious. They don’t skimp out either, everyone had to pack up their dinner for leftovers! I have no complaints about it. Easy to get to, paid parking with the hotel which is fine, and great staff. I will definitely come back.
This was an excellent restaurant.  Had some steak and loved the spicy flavour.  Will definitely go back next time.  Also tried friends chicken and excellent taste but less spicy.  Excellent ambiance.

I went to this restaurant with friends on December 31, 2017. It was my first time there and I loved it. The staff were very friendly and the service was about the best I have experienced. Once seated I took a good look around. Simply beautiful. Clearly a great deal of thought and work went into creating such a wonderful space. As I sat there I began to notice the wonderful aromas of the different dishes which served to tease and excite. It is a great space to sit and enjoy with great friends. I ordered the Chicken Coconut Soup, Cashew Chicken with Rice and for dessert a Chocolate Mousse. The various courses were served to all guests at the same time (something that I feel is important and sadly often lacking in many restaurants these days). We all got to enjoy and share each course together. The food was fantastic. In fact I can say it was the best Thai food I have ever had.  What a pleasant dining experience and night out. What a great find in downtown Toronto. I highly recommend this restaurant and will definitely return again and again.

Came here for Winterlicious dinner last night and once again was extremely satisfied with the quality of the food, the service, and beautiful venue. 

Btw...
I was here as part of the Elm Wood Spa exotic escape package for two. The restaurant is beautiful with its two tiered main dining area but I must say that...
I ordered from the restaurant via Foodora tonight.  While the meal was good, the menu does not indicate that orders include rice, so I ordered some.  I am...

lic_profile: Bannock’s honest approach to food is rooted in familiar, wholesome ingredients that represent Canada’s rich regional and cultural diversity, delivered in an innovative and playful way. Everyday classics are revitalized as the chefs pay homage to traditional Canadian comfort foods, putting cultural favourites front and centre. Bannock’s menu is reflected in its eclectic and approachably Canadian architecture, featuring antique pine and hemlock reclaimed from the waters of Lake Ontario.
lic_lunchmenu: peameal, dill pickle mayo, tomato jam, taro root

reviews.text: When I'm at the Eaton Centre, this is my go to place. Great menu, lovely salads and you have to try the mushroom soup! It is definitely the best one I've ever tasted! Good service, it can be slow when it's busy, but overall very friendly staff. They are also accommodating with dietary needs. Highly recommend this restaurant.

Amazing staff and customer service. The food was great. After telling them I was vegan they did everything they could to accommodate and make sure I had a great experience. The atmosphere is nice and cozy and it's perfect for a special occasion. I would highly recommend this restaurant!

This was one of the most amazing experiences ever. The food was absolutely amazing. Its decorated cute and is quaint. The staff was fabulous and unbelievably helpful and friendly. I would highly recommend this place to anyone who enjoys delicious food. Many of the items on the menu are award winners. The drink menu is amazing.

We loved it!!!! It is pretty hard to find places with great food, but this one has it. We went for the brunch and the 4 of us had 4 different dishes. They were all amazing. At the and felt full but well and my tastebuds were happy! The staff is awesome and discrete. The place has a great, cool vibe. Can't wait to go back!

This used to be my go to lunch spot downtown. I always order the turkey burger and sub the bun for Bannock bread. They changed the baker or the bread, because it wasn't as thick or fluffy as it used to be. But it was still a good turkey burger, still would recommend subbing the bun and try their daily juices. One of my favourites is the one with cactus juice, it has a bright pink colour to it.
Had the sticky ribs and their turkey burger. Apparently the waiter had mention that the turkey burger was voted as toronto's best turkey burger. Agreed the...
Walking into the restaurant, you can either have to-go or sit down at the restaurant to eat. Came here for lunch. There was no line-up and getting seated...
Well i were quite disappointed about the restaurant. The quality of the food is not bad but it is quite overprice. We order duck fat poutine as appetizer....

reviews.text: I had heard about this restaurant for years from friends in Iran of all places actually. I live in New York City and was visiting Toronto last weekend and so I made sure to go here. IT WAS AMAZING. The music, the decor, the ambiance. I fell in love with the family who runs the place. This is much more than a restaurant. Also, the food was sooooooo good. Make sure you order the beef tenderloin with pomegranate molasses and the smoked eggplant - our server was someone named Tina. She was so lovely and genuinely cared about our night; I actually thought she was the owner. I would highly recommend this place!

Fantastic experience all around, had a fantastic dinner with my husband.  Smoky eggplant(can't remember name) and this mouth watering pomegranate and walnut kabob which was amazing!  I can't remember what my cocktail was but was so refreshing it had basil and vodka.  My husband really enjoyed his woodhouse IPA x 3*so I decided to have another basil drink. :)

Best Kebabs in town!
We started our lunch with the tomato & cucumber salad which was very fresh and tasty. We ordered the rice with barberries, chicken kebab and ground beef which were both moist and well seasoned. I love that they serve their kebabs with fresh tarragon & mint! Great and friendly service.

I have been coming here for the past 9 years and am so glad to see this family still here on this stretch of Queen. I understand they just celebrated their 13th year anniversary and that says a lot for the restaurant industry. I read some of the reviews on here and am astounded at some of the things people have written. Yes, their food is more expensive but there is a reason for that. You can go and get kabob at other places for $11.99 but you are getting exactly what you are paying for. Here's a tip: Make sure you try their side ribs with pomegranate molasses - they are lip smacking and finger licking good and their cocktails are divine. I love the familial vibe and every table seems to know one another. I highly recommend this place.

Had an awesome dinner at Banu yesterday evening.  The beef tenderloin was so flavourful.  Great attention to detail from beginning to end.  Service was warm and friendly.  My go to place on Queen West.
Love this place    Great food, warm service.   I would recommend to all, having the torsh, spinach yogurt, laboo salad and an Emerald Isle!!  Best meal
The food is way too overpriced for the portion you get. The rice was salty and my friend found a piece of hair in his koobideh dish.
Went out for a tea w/ a friend. Tea was ok but a little  bit pricey $5.00. Cool and bright inside.

lic_profile: Bar Buca is an Italian-style neighbourhood bar/cafe with a focus on small, authentic seasonal Italian dishes for eat-in or take-away. Whether seated on Bar Buca's intimate patio or casual, vibrant dining room with a view of the open kitchen, guests will appreciate the mix of industrial aesthetics with classic materials. The combination of inspired design, innovative drink list and menu, makes Bar Buca a favourite within the King West community.

reviews.text: A go to place for some amazing drinks. The cocktails are very vibrant with some subtle and strong flavors. The food morning look like small portions but can fill you up in a hurry. Order responsibly. The staff are friendly and the waiting staff have a kick-ass apron. It's made of leather and weighs a ton. Hard work! Will visit again. Not too noisy, good place for a conversation.

Delicious food, and truly exceptional service. I brought my mother here while she was visiting from out of town. Our server, I believe her name was Laura, was wonderful. Very welcoming, always willing to answer questions about the menu, and made for a lovely evening. The food was so tasty!! Each course was brought out with perfect timing so we could enjoy our different selections without feeling rushed or having too long a break between. Would definitely love to come back!
Great food to munch on with very good drinks.... It's a small place with an open kitchen and high top tables..... Go for the happy hour!

Exceptional restaurant. Prices are fair and the quality of ingredients is incredible. Staff are friendly and you feel like you are experiencing true Italian cuisine. The wine selection is on point. Not sure what wine to order? Just ask and explain what you enjoy and they will pair it perfectly and stick within your budget. Lots of places do this, but at Bar Buca it felt genuine and really added to the experience. Lots of Italian spots in the city and this is one of the best!
I went here during happy hour which was $10 and included a drink and small plate. It was a great value and food tasted delicious! I also had a cappuccino which was one of the best I have ever had.

At the very least you must go for take out coffee. Their Americanco is to die for, especially if you put the coffee sugar in your drink.

The brunch is...
Atmosphere: small little spot beside the entrance of a condo building, kinda easy to miss. Tall chair table and bar seatings, not spacious, might be sharing...
Came here for brunch on Sunday and it was way off the mark. While the ambiance is nice, it was moderately loud and you may be asked to share a table with...

reviews.text: Prettiest decors you'll see in a Bavarian style restaurant. I had the seasonal risotto which was spicy sausage with spinach and oh my god it was delicious!!! Definitely try if it's still available! My coworkers had the Wiener schnitzel and the Cornish hen and both were very happy with their meals :)
The CUTEST place ever. I'm obsessed with the decor. We ordered a charcuterie board and I got a beet and goat cheese salad. Both amazing and staff was friendly!

Delicious food. Great service. Accomodated our friend who brought her own food to eat as she has multiple allergies. The dining room off to side allowed us to have our Holiday lunch for work there. Perfect as we are a small group. Most places need larger groups.
Great place for a professional lunch or a nice dinner. Food is delicious with plenty of selection.
Great food, wide selection for everyone. The staff were super helpful and informative.
Barnsteiner's is a frequent participant in Toronto's Winterlicious and Summerlicious events. I'm guessing this is one of the reasons why their ratings are...
This is a great restaurant. I decided to try it for lunch with a friend after a long walk and it definitely hit the spot. We ordered the lemon sole, a daily...
Came for dinner during winterlicious, did the Prix fixe menu. For app we had the flat bread with arugula salad and pear with I believe was goat cheese. The...

reviews.text: Beautiful layout! Very helpful and pleasant staff. Great beer! Yummy food! Didn’t have to wait and loved the choice of music. Nice selection of liquor as well.

I went to lunch at the Batch with my work colleagues. The ambiance was very nice but the quality of service and food need some improvement. The orders were mixed up plus the burger bun was cold to the touch. The chef visited our table and acknowledged the same. 

Great beer selection overall.

A cool environment with a fun bar/games area downstairs. Enjoyed their Batch brew. Ordered a chicken sandwich and was disappointed when it came and was dark meat, however assistant manager, Nate, came over to ask us how our things were and kindly offered to switch the meal for something else. He was extremely nice about the whole thing. I ended up with the fish which was great! Would recommend.

Very nice venue for a private party. The staff are very friendly and helpful in trying to make your event what you want. Nothing seems too much trouble. If you are ordering canapés be sure to check the size of the portion. Better still, have a pre-tasting time before you finally place your order. Loved the venue and the food is great for a casual event.

Came at 6 pm on Thursday - it was VERY busy, which is normal in Downtown. We were waiting for 15 minutes to be seated at the table I reserved in advance - the hostess was everywhere but not in the front.
Also took a long time (around 30 mnts) to bring us the salad and something similar to Shepherd's pie. The food is good and overall experience about this place is positive.

Amazing local brewery with a nice atmosphere for talking and relaxing. Cozy, yet open, contemporary, hip.

We tried the Pale Ale 7, IPA, and Cream Ale. All...

Our second visit was not great. The oysters that day were not fresh. The server was very nice and took it off our bill.

On, our third visit on a Wednesday,...
went here the first night in Toronto with colleagues. Was late when we got there so getting a table and good service was easy. Staff were excellent and...

lic_profile: Beaumont Kitchen is a comfortable all-day dining lounge located inside Saks Fifth Avenue at CF Sherway Gardens. Amidst its sleek design, rich textures and whimsical accents, the space features plush loungers and banquettes, formal dining tables and relaxed bar seating, making it ideal for long lunches, midday snacking, casual dinners and special occasions. Owning a deep understanding of and respect for food, Beaumont Kitchen’s chefs source interesting, quality ingredients from nearby purveyors, and trust in the ingredients’ natural flavours and beauty to shine with minimal preparation.

reviews.text:
We had been here once before a while back and it was pretty decent. 

Last week we were here shopping and needed to get some dinner in before we went home....

Pros:
- Decor: The decor in the restaurant is really nice! Very modern and picture worthy.  
- Spacious: The seating is very generous and you don't feel...
Loved this restaurant. If you enjoy brunch in Montreal, then you know what this place is like! It's great. Such a great vibe, great staff, good food and...

Food was really good. Our server was super friendly. They were so under staffed for the weekend, the service was incredibly slow. Luckily it was one of those days that we needed a lot of time to chat and digest our food :)

Honestly, I didn't think I would like it. I though it'd be a pretentious place since it's at Saks but in honesty the wait staff was very friendly and welcoming. They always asked if anything was needed and had a warm smile on their faces.

My wife order the burger as did I while my mother-in-law ordered the roasted beet appetizer and baby spinach salad. Everything was delicious and we were all pleased with our orders.

The burger that I order was small compared to some other places but it was thick and very juicy. Yes, it can be considered "pricey" but considering where you are it's not too bad. The burger was simple but tasty and perhaps one of the top ones I've ever had. It was moist and flavourful with a little pink in the middle... give it a try, you won't regret it.

Our waitress, Madison, was extremely nice and we never felt rushed to leave even though our meal was over and our billed paid. She even gave my mother-in-law a free dessert for her birthday even though she didn't want to order one because she was stuff. It even had Happy Birthday written in chocolate. Seriously, Madison was awesome. Thanks for a great night!
Been here a few times. Always loved the food. Calamari tacos are the best!

The food was quite good. I really enjoyed the squash salad and crispy haddock (both from Winterlicious). A little disappointed with the PB chocolate pudding, I thought there could've been more flavour variety to it. We also waited quite a long time for our appetizers to come out after ordering. It was a Tuesday night and not very busy, so I'm not sure why it took so long. I would go again.

I expected better of this place, dinner was just OK. They failed at making a MAnhattan, so I knew it would be down hill from there. The service was great however. But menu, in general nothing to write home about. However, I may come back to try their brunch.

lic_profile: Located in the heart of Little Italy, family owned and operated Bella Vista brings together all the traditions and authenticity of Italian cuisine into a contemporary, yet relaxed dining atmosphere.  Comfortable seating, soft colours, and a bar that illuminates a warm glow create an inviting atmosphere. Combine that with friendly staff and authentic Italian cuisine, and what you get is a unique dining experience, each and every time.

reviews.text: The service was awesome... I've seen some places where the serving staff aren't as friendly during the Winterlious/Summerlicious events but our server was...

Slow and inept service, weak drinks, and bland, minimal-effort food.

Understaffed. The frazzled (and apparently new) server had to ask us to repeat our...
I give this place a solid 3.5/5. The service was attentive and the staff were friendly. We came here for winterlicious and I would say the best dish was the...

Slow and inept service, weak drinks, and bland, minimal-effort food.

Understaffed. The frazzled (and apparently new) server had to ask us to repeat our food and drink orders multiple times, apologizing often. The server actually refused to take our food orders when we ordered drinks. We had to ask for utensils. It took an hour after we were seated to receive our entrees.

The martinis and cocktails may or may not have had any alcohol in them. The pasta seemed indistinguishable from dry grocery-store pasta and canned sauce. Disgraceful.

We were overcharged for an item on our bill and had to point out the correct price on the menu to the server.

Super romantic, perfect for a date night. Awesome food! Always an incredible experience, cannot recommend enough. From the delicious antipasto to the generously portioned entrees to the indulgent desserts, it's definitely a place to fall in love with!

VERY slow service. The first waiter stopped looking at us because he was super busy and didn’t have excuses to give anymore “i will be back in 2min” after 4 times...
Second waiter was very kind but the food took forever to come, they said they were understaffed but it was the italy festival, they should be better prepared
It’s been over an hour and I still not have my food.  Very slow service.

Went last night with a group of 7. We were the only table there the whole night. Service was very slow and prettymuch everything ordered was sent back. Salad soggy, veal wasn't even edible, Yonkies were under cooked. 

We were a regular at this place for several years, you would think being the only group for the evening we would be pampered. 

It felt like they served us food that was old and just trying to clear inventory before they close the doors.

lic_profile: A Japanese steakhouse experience in the heart of Toronto, Benihana lets you enjoy the excitement of teppan cooking right at your table.  Instead of using conventional kitchens, Benihana's highly skilled chefs present and prepare the freshest beef, seafood and produce at a 'hibachi' table (a flat 4'x 3' grill), around which, up to eight guests are seated. A fast-paced performance of chopping and juggling creates an exciting teppanyaki-style dining experience for guests of all ages.

reviews.text: Your typical Japanese Steakhouse. Yeah, it's cool that they cook in front of you but the chef could have been more interactive with his guests. I've seen...

An overpriced establishment with mediocre food. The show was great and all but service wise, not so great. 

The only good thing about this location and...

I came here for Winterlicious 2018. 

Overall the food was very disappointing. Even with the discount we felt like we wasted our money. 

Sashimi Appetizer...

Great food, atmosphere, and show. Our table had chef Michael and he was great. Very funny and incredibly talented. The servers were also friendly and always made sure we were well taken care of.

The best part was how vigilant they were about food allergies or special requests. One of our group couldn't have meat and they made sure her food was not only done on a separate part of the pan but also at a different time so there would be no cross contamination. I was really impressed and we all had a great time.
Great food. The steak was cooked exactly to order and just melted in my mouth. However, slightly on the pricier side considering what you're getting. Still, a very nice experience.

The lone star is for the experience of seeing the little cooking show. Everything else was very disappointing. The meal itself was very mediocre, especially for the price. It's a very overpriced stir fry that didn't taste all that much better then a fast food stir fry. Still would have given it 2 stars, but my family had extreme gastrointestinal upset all night. It pretty much ruined our family fun night out in the city. My kids and I were really looking forward to this experience. Just don't understand how this restaurant is so popular.

This was a really amazing experience! My boyfriend and I went to celebrate Valentine's day and to be honest weren't expecting much. Most teppinyaki places you go to are more focused on the flash than the quality of the food. I was so impressed that the chef was able to make such amazing food and still wow the table! That garlic butter tho!!

One word Horrible. I am a local and have lived in downtown forever but never ended up trying this place. One of my friend from Whales insisted that I should give it a try, so me and my husband came in one day after work hopping for a relaxing nice Friday dinner. Did not happen. We came in the server was really nice. We were however dotted with an entire table of screaming children with mom and dad who were reluctant to say anything. It was an absolute scream fest. We hoped that food should be good given it’s part of Fairmont. NO it’s not. The quality and the taste of food is terrible. The chef seemed to constantly rush us through out our meal and the server was always in a hurry for an empty restaurant. I have traveled enough and eat out regularly therefore would expect an $100 to $150 food to taste better than a $20. But sadly a $20 Japanese restaurant is better. I was really rooting for this place but it was just a sad disappointment. If you are a tourist and have never tried it, try but otherwise you can do better.

reviews.text:
Highly Recommend Biagio.

This restaurant has to serve the BEST food in the city. It's my husband and i's absolute favorite. We hosted a small celebration...
Wonderful restaurant! I came here with a coworker during a business conference. The ambiance was beautiful, food was perfect & we had exceptional service....
Authentic Italian food with impeccable service in one of my favourite neighbourhoods. Great for date nice , a family dibber or celebration. You can also...
Food was average and service was a complete fail. Server did not come back till finished to ask if all well. The ambiance is old and very dated. Would not recommend.
Exceptional ambiance and food and service.  One of the best restaurants in Toronto. Incredible lunch dinner or private events and beautiful patio when weather is pleasant.

Really nice old school feel to the place. The original owner combs the dining room and is very engaged in the service. The waiters we had were so friendly. We had our three year old with us and they made every effort to make her as happy as possible. The food  was delicious and the wine list is extensive. Though it was our first time there it seemed the majority of the customers were regulars which added to the charm. Overall a great experience and we will return for the ice cream at the very least.
Authentic Italian cuisine with genuine service. I highly recommend this experience.

Summary: SLOW, bad appetizers, but good steak and kind employees.

For a corporate holiday party, we arrived at 5 pm for drinks. In the beginning they only had one type of drink, but eventually we were able to order different kinds of drinks. 

Dinner was scheduled to start at 7 pm, but we weren't served until 7:30 pm. The pasta looked and tasted like it was made by children ... just penne and plain sauce. Eventually at 9 pm, we got steak, and it was great. 

The employees were very kind.

Great staff and great food! 
We came one afternoon, a party of 7, and it was pleasantly empty! The staff was great and we were seated right away. Each day...
I would come back for the beer since they have a huge selection of fixed and seasonal draughts. It's a good place to relax after work with some coworkers in...
Came here on a Thursday night to hang out with my cousins. We ordered 2 rounds of fresh oysters which was a special on that day for $1, a couple rounds of...

145 beers to start with is the first thing that stands out.. to support that they have great wine selection and great cocktails. Food is unique and exciting. Duck wings are incredible with a light flavorful dry rub. Outside patio on a nice sunny day definitely makes the experience so much more worth going here. I'd check them out again when i visit Toronto

Polite staff, great service. As you can imagine, a huge selection of domestic and imported beers. Awesome place to hang out with your friends and leave feeling great.

Upscale hang out place. Only downside is that it’s very expensive. And the dining chairs are very short and small.

Great selection of beer and very delicious food. I would have given full five stars but their patio seats are terrible. Too deep and heavy.  They're designed to withstand heavy winds or as a theft deterrent. Impractical for patio guests. They're difficult to get in or get out from your table.

What can be said Cold beer and a patio
Good Service Food is also good
Great place to spend some time and have fun. Food is just okay.! Expect waiting times on weekends! Ambience is superb.

reviews.text: This is by far, one of the greatest restaurants in downtown GTA. I walked in, and was waited on by a group of very friendly staff who were extremely...

Splendid. Amazing. Magnificent. Need I say more? 
Well, yes I actually do! 

My partner and I came here for the prix fixe offerings. Three course meal for...
Service was non existent, some hipster waiter with a holier than thou attitude.  Food was actually ok but took ages to arrive and I had to grapple the guy...

I can’t believe I waited this long to post a review. However my experience was amazing. I went before a Raptors game. The waiter noticed my Raptors gear and insisted that he would make our dinner a priority (he really didn’t need to) but he did. The atmosphere was very relaxed and charming. I ordered the steak Medium and guess what... it arrived medium. The price is fairly steep but for a good reason. We left stuffed, satisfied, and well catered to. Bathrooms were classy, dining room was clean, bar area was nice. Going back for sure!
AMAZING food here! I suggest the prix fix menu as you get great value! The cocktails are amazing as well. Their chocolate cake is actually to die for, it is the best dessert I’ve had in my life.

Still a classy upmarket outfit. The ambient noise can be quite high if it is very busy but tolerable. Good, intelligent and informed service; reasonable wine list and varied menu. Corkage if you bring your own wine I believe is about $25.

We started with the smelts which were hot and crispy with lashings of mayonnaise. The Caesar salad is cool with an easy dressing. The bread-and-butter on the side is just too tempting.
Our main dishes were the lamb with noodles, the noodles are almost irrelevant the lamb is wonderful and melt in the mouth. The Cornish hen was plentiful and very crispy – we had french fries to accompany it which were excellent.
Just had my engagement dinner here and it was beyond excellent... From service to food to decor to ambiance 11 out of ten.... If you haven't been there you must go!
Excellent dinner on a Sunday evening with prix fixe and half priced wine.  Service is spectacular and the food delicious.

reviews.text:
Came here on a Tuesday as a date night.  

Ambiance( 4 stars)
A cosy place, we were there when it was pretty empty so did not feel the discomfort other...
My boyfriend and I came here for Winterlicious. After seeing all the good reviews it had on yelp, we decided to give it a shot. While the service offered by...
1st time at Bloom Restaurant via Winterlicious. The items on the Licious menu I chose were all pretty good albeit portions are on the small side. The...

The food and service are amazing. We had the prix fixe which was a great deal. Had the cod cakes, enchiladas, cold soup and a pork chop. All amazing and served with a smile (vegetarian enchiladas were particularly good and I'm not vegetarian). Desserts weren't nearly as amazing, but we left full and happy. Mixed drinks were good.

The atmosphere is eclectic with lots of art on the wall and varied music. I really like one of restaurants that are different and serve great food. I'll be back.

We have a four month old daughter and have only been out for dinner a handful of times since she was born. This was the first meal in that time that was memorable and review-worthy. The chicken croquettes were to die for, and the Paella was delicious and well worth the wait. The staff were warm and welcoming and had organized a special corner for us with the stroller. The pitcher of sangria definitely helped this new mom enjoy the night out. Will be back!

We went here for lunch and the food and service was amazing! You could tell they use fresh ingredients and really cared about the quality of food they serve. We had a great start to our meal with a vegan chipotle-spiced squash soup and the vegetarian enchiladas were really tasty. The cassava fries were SO GOOD - perfectly crispy on the outside and fluffy on the inside mmmm. I'm still thinking about them. Even the side salad, which is often overlooked, was fresh and delicious. I would 100% eat here again and highly recommend it :)

The service is ok, nothing fancy. The food is mediocre. Their soup is marked as 1$ on menu, surprise comes when you have the bill, its actually 10$ each, when asked, owner's explanation was "we made a mistake, we know about the typo but didn't fix it. you can't get a soup for a dollar". I personally have no issue with a soup for 10$, but owner knows the typo in advance and not fixing it is a SCAM to me. I have seen plenty of restaurants having price error on their menu, every single one of them either fixed it by hand or told me when I place my order. 
Btw, their cuban style steak sucks, its well done and has a dreadful taste. 
I will not recommend and will never return.
Fantastic Pisco sours and succulent dishes coupled with brilliant service.

lic_profile: On the quiet eastern front of Yorkville, set back behind a brick façade, Blu is an Italian restaurant featuring authenticly classic yet contemporary cuisine.  Executive Chef Massimo Callovini originally from Trento, Italy and Chef de Cuisine, Eric Bucher from California, created a menu where traditional Italian flavours are presented with a contemporary fresh Californian influence.  Impeccably served in an upscale dining room with warmly lit stone walls, grand mirrors, and cozy leather seating, and enhanced by soothing live music Friday and Saturday, dinner is a truly memorable experience.

reviews.text: Perfect date spot.  The food was incredible and the service was excellent without being overbearing.  They read the tables very well between the servers and...
We came here for a work party and it was wonderful. They have very private rooms/areas for this function and the service was amazing. The ambience was...
I celebrated my two year anniversary here. I ordered the beef carpaccio, braise octopus, beef tenderloin and aglio eolio linguine. I have to say, all the...

Nice restaurant overall with a cozy atmosphere. Attentive service. Food was good but didn't blow me away, especially considering the price. Would recommend trying this place out but it probably won't become part of my rotation.

Best restaurant ever! If you want to go to a fancy restaurant but you don't want to break the bank, this is the place to go.
The food is amazing! I would specifically drive to Toronto just to go to this restaurant again.
Chef Eric is amazing and he truly loves his craft.  Everything was wonderful and my wife and have made this our go to location for Downtown Toronto.  Keep up the great work!

Very surprised with the atmosphere and decor used in this restaurant considering it seems hidden! Very nice live music at a nice volume & service being very nice & very informative when I had questions, I was impressed. Additionally and most importantly, food was delicious and arrived perfectly on time! Celebrated my anniversary here and they surprised us with a complimentary dessert!!

Nice atmosphere in a " waiting to be posh again " area of Yorkville.
Good service supports excellent food. We had the baked salmon and haddock ; perfectly prepared.
A bit on the slightly overpriced side so Blu may not become a regular spot for my budget but if $ is no problem, the overall experience is worth the price.

reviews.text:
If you like Mr Soulvaki but wished there was more meat and other additions, you will love this place as I have.

The price is such a good deal for food that...
I went today at lunch and noticed this place is now open. It's in the path under the Sheraton, close to where Noodle King is. They had some reasonably...
Food quality is pretty good, value for the small portion you get us bunk tho.  See attached photo. Each of those tiny dishes cost $10 each.  The ravioli "meal" had 2 ravioli pieces.  Bravo BNB.

Went there for brrakfast yesterday. Hostesses were not over friendly. Wanted breakfast menu was told we were 1 mintue late. I have been to other resturants where depanding out you wanted would allow it. I just wanted a eggs benny. We were seated and said there for over 10 minutes before the waiter came over. They were not busy. He was just clearing tables. Finally order and waited forever for a coffee.  Our meal didn't come for over 30 minutes. I got the all day breakfast. Toast was burnt, eggs cold to name a few things wrong. For what this cost us. I would expect better. Service was so slow.

Terrible experience. Don't even think about expecting anything decent. I had the grilled vegetable sandwich. Absolutely no flavour at all. The panini was not toasted, more like microwaved. Vegetables soggy and the goat cheese was bland. Fries might as well have been from Costco, and not the good ones. Don't know what they were trying for but they achieved an atrocity. I literally had to get a ginger graval in me to settle things down. Super expensive for a stomach upset. Don't bother. It isn't even the old Trader Vic's. So many decent places around downtown. Should have known better.

Hostess was rude telling us to sit at the bar, she grunted when we asked for a table despite restaurant being empty. Server was good, smiling and getting our order in a timely manner. Not only was the glass dirty, but it was also dusty. Asked for a clean one and server apologized and got another. Unfortunately, the new one was in a similar situation as the first.

Horrible experience! Group of 10 went for dinner. Empty restaurant, but only half of us had water and the other half only had cutlery. The food took forever, and it was either over cooked or undercooked, they got two orders completely wrong, and the bill was almost $400. Not doing that again!

reviews.text: A cosy and welcoming French bistro on Baldwin Street, serving up a great prix fixe menu for 25$ during lunch hours. They accommodate large groups as well....
Really good prices if you go on cocktail hour. We sat a 3pm. The waiter was very friendly, as well as a fast service. The food was tasty, but I would have...

I'm very sad writing this updated review and knocking off two stars, especially after my tremendous visits last year. 

I went to Bodega once again this...
An excellent spot on Baldwin with a nice patio space. Food was really good, we enjoyed it. Service was good too. The brunch stake was really yummy!

I had a burger and a cider on their patio and I found the service friendly, attentive but understanding of respecting how little my friend or I wanted to be interrupted. The food was good and the prices in the middle, for the drink, main meal and tip I spent about 32 dollars.

Lovely restaurant on Baldwin Street, with a nice patio. Service was great, and their prixe fix menu can't be beat, it's a great value! Daily wine, beer and drinks specials too. I had the soup du jour (mushroom), the lamb burger and finished with the raspberry and lime tart. Everything was delicious.

Came here back in August 2016 with a party of 4 on a Friday evening around 8:30pm hoping for a quick meal after visiting someone at Mount Sinai. We chose here mainly because it looked somewhat busy and they have a nice-sized patio. I was a bit discouraged seeing the low rating on Yelp, but thought we would give it a try anyways. To begin, the waiter tried to be helpful but couldn't really answer some of our questions about the menu. After we ordered it took at least 30-45 min to get our food, and the food itself was very mediocre and very overpriced. $22 for a simple Cobb salad with sparse ingredients is ridiculous, though the chicken was well-cooked. We also ordered the calamari appetizer which was rubbery and didn't taste fresh. The best part of the meal was the side of fries, as they were crispy and decadent. There was a loud wedding inside the restaurant, and many of the guests were hanging around outside, blocking the doorway that the staff use to bring out food from the kitchen, shouting and swearing. Overall, definitely wouldn't go back. There are much better places in Baldwin Village (Kinton probably being the best, but a better choice when it's cold outside).
Loved this place . Lamb burger was insanely good and the servers were true gentleman. Best option on that street

reviews.text: This place is new but a gem! We came across this place while we were walking the distillery district on Saturday evening. It was pretty late, think they...

The location here is prime. It closes after the district so that very much encouraged us to check it out since we wanted to stay a little longer.

The food...

This one was a little hard for me to rate. 
Can I say 3.75? Well that's the average after a debate with my lunch mates. 

The ambiance was very lovely and...
Great food and atmosphere. Very experienced Japanese chef. Fresh seafood offerings. Historic distillery district. Best to phone ahead for reservations.
Really nice food, staff is amazing and quick, good value for the money

Great place with cozy vibes and very friendly staff.
The food was also very delicious.
Bf and I had a great  time dining here. Their food tastes so light and fresh. Although definitely on the pricey side, their sushi selection was great we really enjoyed it.

Visited several years ago and still talk about my meal here. Horse sashimi was revolutionary to me and the torched nigiri are like butter in your mouth. They also offered sesame ice cream at the time which was lovely.

lic_profile: A sophisticated, cosmopolitan destination, Brassaii Restaurant and Lounge is nestled amidst a romantic cobblestone palazzo courtyard and charming outdoor patio in the heart of Toronto's King Street West neighbourhood. Brassaii offers a tantalizing menu inspired by Mediterranean fare and crafted by Executive Chef Marcus Monteiro.

reviews.text: Located in king street a very happening place.   Not recommended for just dinner as menu is very limited.  The ambience is awesome and it conveys into a...
The notorious "Le Brunch" held once a month on a Sunday afternoon. You may have seen it on insta, your friends may have talked about it. If you haven't...

WHAT TO TRY?!

Their brunch!

If you're looking for a brunch place AND can take reservation, this is not a bad restaurant to check out. The menu is very...

First and last time eating here. Came in at about 9:30pm. Waited 15 minutes for a glass of water. Didn’t receive a drink menu until 10 minutes after that. Ordered food when the water came to our table. 10 minutes later the waiter informed me they no longer had what I wanted and suggested something else. Our food arrived at 11:10pm after waiting for over an hour and a half. I’ve never sent a plate of food back to a kitchen before this but it was actually inedible. Not sure how you mess up a simple spaghetti with sauce. All I could taste was garlic and the noodles tasted burnt. My friends meal was covered in salt. 

Will never eat here again. Horrible slow service and even worse food.

Great spot and the food was surprisingly good, got the beef set meal and they cooked it perfectly. Music was great too, good variety from 90s to now and crowd was pretty good. Would definitely go back. Only problem is parking in that area and the King St. Project, be prepared for traffic.

Friends and I visited here for an after party. This place is tucked back off of King. It was  a great location for us as our airbnb was a block away! We did enjoy Brassaii, the layout was nice, as you walk thought the bar, it almost seemed like a different place which was nice. The drinks were very expensive. Yes it's Toronto, however I have been to some swanky places in NYC and payed less for a drink and/or bottle. We did have a good time and enjoying the atmosphere.

Service was good but the food I ordered was shrimp and pasta 🍝 that tasted under cooked unfortunately. I was shocked that I had oysters added on my pasta since it wasn’t even mentioned on the menu. I have to be careful with shell fish and definitely wasn’t warned :/

I only ever really come here for Le Brunch, the third sunday if the month. This was my third time. As always it was a good time ! I had the chicken and waffles and the chicken was a bit too sweet, so I didn’t eat the waffle with it, but it was still so delicious. After that we had a bottle during the party bit of the brunch. If you sit in the front area, which is less packed, you have room to dance and have a good time. The minute you end up in the back, it’s too packed with people who don’t dance and only post up to look cool, I guess hahah. Next time I’ll definitely get a patio table and have my fun outside !!

reviews.text: This is a neighbourhood gem. So nice to be able to walk in and have a great meal when you don't feel like cooking. Service is always friendly, food quite...
Nice atmosphere. I didn't love our waitress, rushing us to order. No cocktail list. Main courses did not come out all together so we sat and waited. I had...

Worst service I've experienced in some time! The waiter was rude, ignored us and was petulant. Too many stellar establishments in TO to go back.

Be careful...
Medium to medium high priced restaurant. Interesting variations on standards served by knowledgeable staff including good choices of wine. Celiacs will find good food here with some choice available.

I had an amazing time with friends at Brownes Bistro the other day. The atmosphere is warm and welcoming while the service is immaculate. The food, outstanding. I had the 10oz steak, medium rare and they cooked it perfectly and I'm a sucker for grill lines on my steak. I'm very picky when it comes to menu and presentation which they have a wide variety of options for your taste buds.This is a very classy, calm, beautiful place at a good location. I enjoyed my dinner and so did everyone. I will definitely come back soon.

Excellent menu and excellent food. The lamb sausage and lentils and mash were Fab. And my wife said the rack of lamb was cooked to perfection. Choc brownie dessert out of this world. Wonderful service from our waiter, Stefan. A Restaurant with life but not noisy.
We shall return. Incidentally, it is wheel chair accessible.
Peter

Reserved a table for two for Valentines day many days in advance, yet we were forced to wait in line with 10 other people ahead of us for close to 45 minutes... clearly the owner is friends with the airlines that likes to oversell seats...this alone, regardless of food, warrants a 1 star rating... beware!
Went for Winterlicious. Excellent meal. Wonderful service. Wish this place was in my neighbourhood.

reviews.text: I just love the Brownstone! My wedding shower was held here early in June, and they did an amazing job. We did a brunch/lunch party with prosecco, and the...
My husband and I have mostly come for brunch through the years and quite enjoyed it.  Well, until now.  First off, the place used to be PACKED at brunch....
I love this place but the new girl they have there is awful. She does not know hot to socialize with people, she's extremely rude, and is just...

Okay.  This place needs more love.  The kitchen here is on fleek.  Large sized portions with friendly service and fair prices.  I think this spot needs more exposure.  Seriously.  The breakfast here was surprisingly good.

I didn't expect it to be as delicious but it was quaint and friendly and the food was just right. Great portion size and even my parents who are vegetarian enjoyed it. We were looking for a cozy spot to end our vacation and we found the perfect one.

The first time the two of us came here was a Saturday night around 10 pm for food and drinks. Only one other table besides us in the restaurant. We ordered drinks and food. The drinks came but we waited over and hour and our food never showed up so we asked the waitress and she completely forgot to enter our order. (however in the mean time no one ever came to ask if we wanted another drink.) Long story short we said don't worry about the food we have to go anyways so they gave us our drinks on the house. Today we decided to try them for breakfast and give them another chance. The food was absolutely horrible. About 4 home fries 1 piece of bread and bacon that was burnt to a crisp and looked to be a few days old.. I would avoid this place at all cost. We really tried to give them the benefit of the doubt .

My wife, 2 children and I went here on a Sunday afternoon and had an excellent experience. My wife ordered the quesadilla, I ordered the burger and our daughter had their French toast. All of our food was amazing and we had great service. Would definitely recommend eating here and we will be revisiting again in the future.

I always enjoy eating at Brownstone Bistro.  The food is good, portions are generous and service is fast and helpful.  I enjoy that they always seat you in the best spot they have available at the time.  Very fair prices to sit and see spectacular views up and down Yonge street. And the view inside is an eclectic and interesting mix.  I enjoyed the new room divider between bar and restaurant area. A great idea to use open shelving with interesting objects as a room divider.

their  72 hour beef short ribs is melt in your mouth deliciousness!
Their mushroom truffle risotto has ruined me for...

Going to Bymark is enjoyable and this visit was not any different. I enjoyed dining at Bymark.

Bymark's atmosphere is unique, classy (normally) and...
This is my second time going to Bymark. Tried winterlicious lunch sat at the booth with a really nice dome shaped roof. Beautiful ambience and loved the...

Went to an LCBO wine tasting event at this location. Service was excellent and the staff were top notch. For a large group they were very quick in serving the food and attending to the guest's needs. The food was very tasty. If you are looking for a classy place to eat in the financial district of Toronto, this is a good place to visit.
Service started a bit slow but that’s understandable given the lunch rush. Literally the best burger I’ve had in my life. Well worth the price.

Great services! Food would be great if served faster. I went with groups  (of 8 and 30 people on each occasion), and because the food are waited to served together to the whole group, my plate was no longer warm... Appetizers are amazing, but entrees are slightly too salty, and desserts are average.
This is a lovely restaurant. The food and the service are both exceptional. The atmosphere is low-key, quiet, and romantic.

Amazing. Had a wonderful lunch. Light, tasty and creative

Highly recommend it
