reviews.text: Coming from San Diego, CA where it's always sunny and rooftops are daily things I already kind of knew what to expect going in. However, I was pleasantly...
Some friends and I came here on a Friday evening for drinks and food. We really enjoyed it. I thought the food and drinks we ordered were all very good and...
Had a lunch get together for our team at work and some them of wanted to try CCC as we had been unsuccessful in the past to get a larger reservation. We...

Awesome place! I've found it due to recommendation of Google, and I fell in love with this place. Both interior and exterior are extremely comfy, staff is always good-looking and professional. Prices are not the cheapest one, but as for such a place and + Toronto — it's understandable. 
To add more, there is an option to go to the roof, with cozy bar and DJ, magnificent view (specially in summer time), try it out! 
I would recommend this one to visit if you are visiting Toronto, as this will give you a taste of luxury and nice feeling of comfort :) 

P.S. If you are looking for a room entrance, there is an elevator inside, or just ask a waiter or a hostess

While we were made to wait for 15 minutes to claim our table (despite having made a reservation), Cactus was well worth it. With a beautiful interior, lively atmosphere, broad variety of drinks, and tasty food, I left the restaurant more than content. The Hendricks gin and tonic I had was just as expected. My Rob’s flatbread, however, was delicious. The pesto, grape tomatoes, and cheese mingled wonderfully in a dish that felt light and yet thoroughly satisfying. My friends enjoyed their respective dishes including the poke ball and spaghetti as well. The latte I finished my meal with was very generous in its size. It was also smooth and creamy, if not outstanding. All in all, I had a pleasant experience at Cactus and would recommend it for a moderately upscale experience in a gorgeous environment. I would strongly recommend making a reservation; the wait times can be outrageous.

I love cactus for any occasion! There are three levels. You can sit outside or on the bar on the first level. The second level is a regular dining area and the third level is a patio in the summer and the roof closes in the winter. There is also a DJ on the third level. The menu on the patio is reduced and there are some dishes that are different. On the first and second floor I would order hunter's chicken and chocolate lava cake. On the patio I would order the blackened creole chicken. The calamari, truffle fries, and burger sliders are amazing appetizers on any floor in cactus. Drinks are excellent too.

On Sunday night I had the pleasure of getting a table on the patio with my family to celebrate my 32 wedding anniversary.  The staff who worked on our table outside were exceptional, as was the star of the night MAX.  I suspect he is a manager, but he was one in a million!  SO friendly, helpful, and made a fabulous drink for me from the bar.  I have dined in the restaurant before, and was hoping to have a fabulous meal on the front patio, and the restaurant did not disappoint!  Max made sure we got a table outside quite quickly, and came by our table a few times through the night to make sure we were ok.  I highly recommend this restaurant.  Even if you have to wait for a table, the food is ALL AMAZING

Heard so much about this place and decided to go check it out with friends. We did not have a reservation, so the wait to get seated was quite long - over an hour. Not a lot of space at the bar, as a lot of the people were in the same boat. Cozy dimmed lights atmosphere, interesting modern interior design. Staff were great, very helpful. We all loved the food, the butternut squash ravioli with prawns were excellent and really hit the spot. The cocktail menu looked good, all drinks we ordered were delicious. It was surprising that the washrooms did not have any toilet paper in almost all of the stalls - it’s a busy place but... So giving 4 stars overall because of the long waits and lack of toilet paper in the bathrooms. Staff and food/drinks would score 5 stars.

reviews.text: Ahhhhh Café Boulud..... only one word to describe it, the GOAT (greatest of all time). This restaurant located in the 4 seasons has the best food and...
Got the grilled kale & fig salad to start and the oeufs meurette for my two courses. The food tasted fine but it only wasn't anything spectacular - the...
Located within the Four Seasons Hotel in the heart of Yorkville. They have a semi private room that is perfect for a bridal shower of 8 people. The...

You will never be disappointed dining at any of Daniel Boulud's restaurants. The food is always excellent, a delight and service is especially great. It's always a very special treat to dine at any of his wonderful restaurants.

Had breakfast here.  Food, coffee and tea were great.   Food was fresh with high quality ingredients, service was polite, portions were good...aaand expect fourseason prices (breakfast for 2 >$50).

At 9am on a Sunday the crowd is older and 'stuffy', and the ambience/waitstaff picked accordingly.  Not a place to be rambunctious.

And the food was excellent.

I had an amazing time at Café Boulud! The food was absolutely exquisite, and the service, impeccable. For two people, 3 courses and 3-4 drinks each, the whole bill came out to less than $300! It goes to show that amazing food and luxury aren't completely out of reach. Our waiter was amazing, he even treated us to complimentary lattes at the end of our meal which were delicious. I'll most definitely be back.

We love Cafe Boulud and D Bar! It is our favourite spot to celebrate our wedding anniversary every year! Great service and delicious food & drinks! 💜 We highly recommend Nicoise salad! Always delicious!

Service was pretty decent. 

Restaurant was a bit noisy, and lighting was very low. Decor was nice and had a definite speakeasy flavour. Better for after work drinks than a date, though. 

Appetizers were much better than the mains. We had the beef tartar (really good, and prepared to your preference). Cod croquets were very good as well  (think fancy fish nuggets). The French onion soup was incredible, and was served with cheesey crunchy bread. 

Mains were both fish, pike quesnel and the Chilean bass. Both were well prepared, but the accompaniments were lackluster (various leak vegetables, etc).

Dessert we had baked Alaska which was pretty good and very dramatic (they light it on fire at your table), but was almost too much for the portion size.

reviews.text:
tl;dr: This is a dope place. Café La Gaffe is the Batman who saves Gotham (aka Toronto and its string of crappy brunch places).

The events that lead to the...

Adorable decor, friendly staff
Great for large groups. No line on a Sunday!  Serves brunch until 4pm 
Banana French toast was awesome, would recommend an...
We went for lunch as a group of 6 for Winterlicious 2018. They have their bigger tables on the patio, so we were seated there. It was a snowy day, and the...

Wanted to accompany friends here. As a gluten-free vegan, they only had soup and salad on offer. So I took my time to really savour the soup as my friends enjoyed the French meal. 

One friend felt the pork chop was a little dry. It was his second choice as the beef was sold out that day. 

My other friend enjoyed his lamb.
My wife and I had dinner there during the winterlicious. The restaurant is cute and charming. I've never tried French food before, but for sure it was very good and well prepared.
Quaint. Good portion size. Friendly atmosphere. On a adorable street with many little shops close by make it an ideal family/couple brunch on weekends!
Lovely setting, cozy little place and good service. Food was excellent!

Great place to wine and dine
People there are very friendly 
Very warm in the winter

That same brilliance is captured through the flavours and textures of its inspired regional Canadian cuisine.

Got seated 10 minutes before our reservation time - yay! But our night didn't escalate that much after that...
I asked for window seating in my reservation...

Reflecting the diverse spirit of downtown Toronto, Canteen’s playful menus offer a balanced mix of creative, vegetable-driven dishes; as well as classic and indulgent sandwiches, meat and seafood. Canteen’s friendly service, daily drink specials and streetside patio make it the perfect destination for summer dining.

reviews.text:
Great food. Great flavour. Ask for gluten free dipping sauce, they are readily available. 
Food comes out hot, fast and fresh. Been going to the same Pho place for years and I would travel the distance to go here it's so good, doesn't taste like an entire year's worth of sodium intake. And the portions are so much bigger than I would have expected. The staff are also very hands off which is great. 

Try the Vietnamese iced coffee!!
Had lunch here on Tuesday. Great little place. Food got two thumbs up - great taste, and excellent portions. Service would get even more thumbs up if I could give it! Highly recommended!!
This is a great place! My coworkers and I come here very often, at least once a week. Highly recommend some of the appetizers, especially the spring rolls. Other than that, enjoy the pho!

Been eating Viet food religiously the last fifteen years.  This is the best Vietnamese in Toronto, full stop.  Meat is fresh and not chemically tenderized like a lot of the other spots in the city.  Moreover, everyone who works there is super friendly.  I can only guess that the lower ratings are spam or competition.
Had some excellent spring rolls, fresh rolls and a very tasty strawberry/avocado smoothie! Highly recommended.
We had reservations for dinner at 6pm on a Friday. I was seeing a 7pm show at tiff and hubby and niece were seeing a show at nearby Royal Alexander...

Nice go to place for a bite before a movie at TIFF or catching a musical nearby and having a chat with a couple of friends.

On this particular occasion I...
Came here with a large group for what we thought would be lunch but ended up being brunch. The restaurant was pretty much the only place able to accommodate...

Canyon Creek takes pride in perfection, which you'll taste in every dish that comes out of their kitchen. From the moment you sit down to your final bite, you'll be treated to a memorable meal.

reviews.text: This was our first dinner in Toronto.  When seeing maple rosemary chips on the menu, this was the place we chose.  The service was excellent....
I've been here three times and this review is based on my last experience. This time I had the shrimp ravioli. My friend had the steak done medium well with...

Great place, Good Service, and Decent food.

Canyon creeks has the same menu in all locations, however they do have differences.

Service: As always Canyon...

Nice quiet restaurant. Not from the area and didn't know it was a chain restaurant. Although it is, the food was amazing. Had great service and it was clean. meal didn't feel rushed and it was priced very well for what you received. Would go here again if ever back in the area.
No wheelchair accessibility - it's located below ground level.  Nice atmosphere  but dimly lit. Heavy meals. Very little for vegetarians. Friendly service.

Nice place. Conveniently located near most downtown attractions in Toronto. The steak is on par with other restaurants of the same scale. Drinks are reasonably good too. Highly recommend the lobster from the dinner menu

I went with a group of my friends for dinner and we all had a great time. One person had an allergy to something and forgot to tell the waiter when they ordered, so when the meal was brought out, he couldn't eat it. The staff were great about fixing the issue and did it as fast as possible. The prices are a bit higher than other similar restaurants but I expected to pay more because of the location (it wasn't too expensive). They have a great selection of items to choose from and there's a convenient parking lot at the foot of university and front, so the restaurant is easy to access.
Excellent meal and service. Love their prime rib. They make a great strawberry daiquiri!!

lic_profile: An elegant French Bistro, Caren's Rosedale boasts a relaxed formal atmosphere that is as sophisticated as it is welcoming. Chef David Nang Nang delivers authentic French classics and daily specials with a Parisian flare, blending new menu items and favourites from Caren's Wine and Cheese Bar in Yorkville. The chic, contemporary setting is perfect for a romantic evening, dinner with family or a night of cocktails with friends at the bar. The open air frontage provides a patio-like feel in the warmer months while the fireplace inside is wonderful to cozy up next to in the winter. The grand piano and live music add flare and fun. Caren's Rosedale provides a multitude of experiences all under one roof and is certain to leave you with a feeling of joie de vivre!
lic_lunchmenu: organic greens, cucumber, flax seeds, goat cheese, Dijon vinaigrette
flat iron, toasted baguette, caramelized onions, swiss and gruyere cheeses

reviews.text:
I visited Carens during summer for cheese fondue. Inside was very classy the tableware and everything was set very beautifully.
When I went, there was only...
A snazzy place! There is a piano at the front door. Decor was fresh and classy. Don't show up in your PJs. Had a reservation for brunch on a Sunday. Glad we...

We had a terrible experience last night at Caren's.  

Details:
-Had a 7PM reso for Saturday night, 3 people. First member of our party arrived and was told...

In an attempt to spare you from a long winded experience story, I will give you the bottom line. 
If you are frequent (every couple weeks) customer of Carens, you will be treated like a VIP, if you are out to try something new, stay away because you will get better service at the Quail across the street. 
Not sure what happened to this place but the service was appalling. 45 mins we waited to be served and nothing. Frequent clients walked in after us and had their apps before us. The moment someone familiar walked in, the owner and staff were on them - so we had to wait again. When we walked, the owner tried to make amends but it was too late, blaming it on a new server they were training. 
Service and training start from the top. Staff shouldn’t be blamed for not being able to be perfect their first day. Lead by example and take ownership. Oh, and try and get your patrons back instead of bidding them farewell as they walk out of your doors.

Amazing gastronomic experience!!Way beyond my expectations.
Selection of cheese, pâté and prosciutto to begin with was solid. Bordeaux so divine that we had to order the second bottle. Steak grilled to perfection, melting in the mouth as if it was a marshmallow. Waiter was looking after us with the nobility of an Aztec God and waitress was the cutest thing you'd want to adopt and take home with you. Overall, glorious place to spend your time and money!!

Cosy place. We went here for our graduation lunch and opted for a fixed menu since we were a large group. Had no problem getting a last minute reservation for 3.30 pm. The aroma of the mushroom soup got me and my friend hungry - it was excellent! The salmon was perfect as well, crispy on the outside and fresh inside. The cheese fondue that my friends ordered was lip smacking. The red wine went perfectly with the meal. The dessert was disappointing. While the creme brule was tastefully done - crusty texture outside and creamy when you dig in your spoon, I felt the quantity was a huge let down. The cutlery was tiny and the creme brule was only half-filled! Broke my heart. Overall, a fine meal. The staff were pleasant and cheerful and seemed to be enjoying their jobs 😄
Absolutely delightful bistro to spend a Sunday evening at. Wonderful selection of cheese and wine and attentive service. Will be back!

Had the pleasure of going to this Hidden Gem on Yonge st on the weekend with my Wife. The food was top notch and the service was fantastic. The server was always watching to make sure our drinks were full. The live piano was a great touch as well. The owner Karen was their to greet you at the door and seat you. We will definitely be visiting this place on a more regular basis. I would give this place 6 stars if possible.

lic_profile: Locally and internationally acclaimed as one of the best Filipino restaurants in Toronto, Casa Manila is the place to enjoy classical Filipino cuisine. Casa Manila's philosophy "Nature to Nurture" ensures authentic Filipino dishes are given a 21st century update to offer wholesome, healthy and fresh tasting food while honouring traditional home cooking. The menu reflects regional authentic cuisine - a blend of Indo, Malay, Spanish, Mexican, Chinese, Polynesian and indigenous Filipino flavours served in a charming, cultural atmosphere depicting the facets of the 7100 Philippine Islands.

reviews.text: We came here for a birthday party and had the Kamayan feast #3. Service was what stood out for me here. They welcomed us like family and you can tell that...

Beautiful decor, above average tasting food (though not mind blowing), a bit to the pricier end though = 3.5/5 overall! 

We did the Kambayan feast and I...

This was my 2nd time at CASA manila. I had gone with a group of 16 for a birthday, so we did the Kamayan feast. 

We made reservations prior for 12 people...

I visited CASA Manila for the first time with my family to try their weekday buffet lunch. I appreciated that the food seemed to be prepared in small batches to ensure freshness and help with eliminating food waste. I don't have a lot of experience with Filipino food but everything I tried was delicious! Staff was friendly, helpful, and attentive.

In all honesty, whenever my family and I go here for lunch/dinners, most of the time, the service and the food is outstanding. This time, we decided to order a delivery. However, the food that we received was completely disappointing, especially considering the high prices. We paid $50 and we received very small portions of food, the containers weren't even full. The food also didn't taste as great as expected.

Outstanding food, discouragingly small servings (contrary to their large plates), and service that is far too focused on talking to each other that they seem to forget the people they're supposed to serve. The only reliable server is the manager. Expect to be ignored and be ready to assert your existence, or it'll close before you get to order food.

I came here to celebrate a birthday, and the experience was amazing.

We ordered 'Combo Dinner 6,' which included Green Mango Salad, Grilled Pork Belly, Tomato Garlic Beef Stew, and we also ordered fried Calamari. The Calamari was crispy and cooked just right, and the Pork Belly and Mango Salad were good too. The real star of the show was the beef stew; the beef melted in your mouth and the flavours were wonderfully balanced. 

The featured cocktail served in a coconut was generously poured, and tasted great. 

Lastly (but certainly not least), the service staff was fantastic and perfectly attentive. I can't wait to come again!

We took my dad here for his 60th birthday and had kamayan during Victoria day weekend (open on Monday). The food spread was bomb, so delicious, and much variety. I love that it all came at the same time in a big plank. Customer service here was top notch, especially the one man with thick grey hair. I also brought a cake in with some regular candles, and they leveled that cake up with a huge ass sparkler. Overall, great food and keep up the great service.

lic_profile: Chez's offers globally inspired cuisine, fusing local & global fare. The menu is designed to evoke feelings of comfort and satisfaction. Inspired by the travels of Chef Mike Bradshaw, Chez's is a lively place, for the young at heart.

reviews.text: I visited a few weeks ago. They had a set menu, which was a great value & others seemed to be ordering. We started with warm olives but returned them due to...
Chez's Restaurant is created by Mike Bradshaw that was inspired by his experience as a chef in Europe for a decade. He worked at two Michelin-starred...

I really wanted to love this place the menu options appeal to me and I'm a fan of the college street vibe.
However it was hard to be impressed with the...

Absolutely incredible experience at this restaurant. It is a very warm and inviting atmosphere with very comfy seats. Napkins are one of my favorite in the city. It came in very handy wiping the delicious handmade food from my face. The chef personally delivered our food and provided his description. To die for!
The best calamari I've had in a long time! Everyone here is polite and genuinely kind. Great music in the background, top notch drinks and a chicken and waffle combo that is off the charts!

Stumbled across this restaurant over on College street when I was in the neighbourhood and what a great find. Fairly new, amazing space, great decor and overall ambience. Staff was super attentive, even caught Chef wall by and said hi and was a super cool guy. 

But let’s cut to the chase, the food was amazing, the braised beef pointing, and bone marrow starter was mind boggling! So deliciously flavourful and after looking them up I seen a BlogTO mention of it and I know why! Really enjoyed our steak, cooked just like we asked, and the smoked cocktail was super good and a fun to snap and share on social too. Would definitely come back and recommend it to others looking for a great atmosphere, excellence service and food! Kudos to the chef, wishing you the best!

Exceptional customer service. The waitress and barman were very attentive to us taking the time to sit down with us and explain the menu. We came to celebrate my friend’s birthday and the food was excellent!! We had to the bone marrow which was soo yummy. The calamari and octopus was succulent. The veal burger and Mac and cheese were generous plates that we couldn’t finish them. It was an overall mouth watering experience you won’t be disappointed. Great music, great atmosphere and most importantly outstanding customer service!! Highly recommend and would definitely go back!

I hosted a Surprise 30th birthday celebration for my boyfriend this past Friday at Chez's. Everything went off without a hitch! We had a group of 17 people and throughout the night I was receiving numerous compliments on venue choice. Everyone loved their meals, drinks and the fantastic live entertainment really topped it off. Alexandra and the rest of the staff were extremely attentive and accommodating, making sure everything came out on time and that everyone was cared for. It's always hard finding a restaurant to host a large group party but I am so happy with my choice. We will definitely be visiting again, one for the books! Thank you Chez's!

reviews.text:
Came here for Winterlicious Lunch ($33 per person pre-tax and tips).  Delicious food and attentive service, would recommend! 

Many options to choose from...
First time there, beautiful ambience, a bit pricy, portion size adequate, appetizers are innovative and delicious. Goat cheese and grilled tiger shrimps...

Well I've been here before years ago but I don't recall much except that the food was good.
very fresh seafood is on the menu.  I had a mastercard special...

Attentive and helpful staff.  A real focusing on making the evening enjoyable.  Excellent food (Lobster Risotto, Fresh Fish, Lamb).  Everyone enjoyed their meal with some making comments that is was the best Risotto they had ever had.

We have been to Chiado several times over the last decade and have always found the food and service to be top notch. We were visiting from Chicago and although the service was great the meal pacing was off and monk fish entree was ruined by being smothered in a mustard flavored sauce. We were very surprised that they brought the main courses almost immediately after we finished our starters and this is unacceptable for a restaurant of this quality. That said, the giant prawns appetizer and wine were wonderful. I hope to return in the near future but will now be careful to instruct staff on how to pace the meal and specifics of fish preparation.

I never been to a Portuguese restaurant and wanted to try it. We went in a group of 10, each one had a different dish and everything looked delicious. I had fish with risotto and it was one of the best fish I ever tried. Sobremesa was amazing as well.

This restaurant is one of the best Portuguese restaurant that I've had the privilege of eating at. The decor, service, food was all exquisite. The dishes were prepared and presented with such elegance and freshness. I HIGHLY recommend this restaurant for a romantic rendez vous or for a get together with family or friends. Our waiter was extremely attentive and professional. Their wine list pairs perfectly with their dishes as well. Now the cost is on the expensive side when you go to Chiado, but with the quality of their dishes and knowledge of their chef, you definitely have your money's worth.

The food here is absolutely delicious and the staff is extremely accommodating, friendly and knowledgeable! Highly recommend if you're looking for a nice meal with family/friends or on a romantic date.
This restaurant is definitely one of my favorite places to go when I want great cuisine with a nice wine pairing.

reviews.text: Chop Steakhouse (Toronto Airport location) has always caught my eye as a very distinctive building: it stands out as a off-black, blockish structure, with...
Chop is a happening place on a Saturday. Half of it being a bar and the other side being a quieter sit down restaurant. It was a darker, more upscale, hip...
This was my first time at one of the Chop franchises because we wanted to try a "new" steakhouse that's not The Keg or Milestones and I was surprisingly...

Went for a belated Birthday dinner. The restaurant decor and ambience was very nice, relaxing and comfortable. Service was warm and friendly. Our meals were great! Mashed potato was lovely and steaks were juicy and tender. They even gave us a birthday surprise for dessert. :-)

Great food, above and beyond customer service!
In addition to the tender, delicious rib eye steak and exquisite dessert trio (on the house for my birthday), I received the attached card with a coupon and signatures from staff, which was an incredibly kind gesture. Patient and knowledgeable service from Elle, and tasteful decor, I wouldn’t give a 4.9 rating if I could.

This is my favorite chop I have ever been to. The staff are very friendly and welcoming and I am always able to get a table. The food is delicious and is prepared exactly how you want it. This is definitely the go-to place if you are staying near the airport

Food and service were very good.   We were in town for work and lucky to get a table for 5 of us on Valentine's Day.   The prices and atmosphere indicated a very nice upscale steakhouse.   Overall it was a great meal.   The one downside was out waitress dressed as if she should be working at a Hooters.   Very inappropriate attribute for this kind of establishment, especially when most of the customers are with wives and girlfriends for Valentine's.   She was a great waitress, very friendly and helpful and attentive, but the dress code was really distracting.

Great service, very comfortable seating. I have also always had delicious food and wine here. I always order my steaks medium rare and they've always been cooked perfectly. Today I had the top sirloin with a side of vegetables, which were surprisingly good too and a definitive step above the typical steamed veggies other steakhouses provide. Service was attentive but not intrusive. Our dessert trio was also great for us to share. Would definitely come back.

lic_profile: Cibo Wine Bar is the biggest and newest Italian restaurant in the Uptown Yonge Street area. Created by Liberty Entertainment Group, this bold and beautiful 10,000 sq ft space is a blend of old world rustic and modern industrial chic.

A true taste of authentic southern Italian cooking freshly made amongst patrons at the 40ft open kitchen counter.  2500 bottles of vino in a soaring two-story award winning wine room equipped with harnessed wine angel to retrieve your favorite bottle.

From Cibo's industrial chic vibrant bar area to the casual Yonge Street patio, every corner turned offers a distinctly different experience.  This celebrated restaurant would not be complete without original artwork from renowned artist Mr. Brainwash.  When on Yonge Street, this space cannot be missed!

reviews.text: Shopping in the area, we decided to give Cibo a try. Fresh bread, sauces and pasta made in house and they had Burrata and pizza on the menu. Quiet on an...

Good service , 
Good food 
Love the bread & olives at the beginning. 
Got the carbonara this time, extra creamy 
The eggplant appetizer was yummy 
One of...
Solid Sunday brunch buffet. Trendy yet comfortable atmosphere. Satisfying selection including: fruit/bread/pastry table, antipasto table, spicy chorizo,...

Just hosted my bridal shower in the downstairs private party room, and I just want to thank Cibo for their excellent customer service! Everything went perfectly, the food here is fantastic with a great selection and variety. If you have an upcoming event, definitely check out their private room, it has beautiful decor, very spacious. All my guests were so impressed. Loved every minute of it!

Great food and the service was thoughtful.  We experienced a few pleasant surprises on a recent visit.  We had a vegan in our party who was well accommodated by the kitchen (though options were a bit limited).  Lucky for our friend that our waiter was vegan and looked out for her.  Another in our party also had to deal with an error in her order (she got the wrong dish) and that was dealt with quickly and unconditionally.  I definitely see myself coming back again.

I’ve never had such a terrible roast lamb in my life. Texture like powder. Taste like liver. Other food were mediocre. Service was not bad. With this price for such a bad quality of buffet brunch. I will never come back again.

We went for a group lunch on a Sunday at 2:30, unaware that you cannot order from the menu.  Only brunch is served.  We were not told this when the reservation was made as it was our first time at this restaurant.
We were assured when we arrived, that the stations will be replenished as we came in at a later time than most.  This was not the case.  Food was so, so.  Expected a lot more for the price of $35 each.  Since we were a group of 8, the gratuity of 18 percent was added on.  We expect tip to be included, but also expect good service.  I had to clear our plates and look around for the waiter to get us forks, etc..  Because it is an automatic tip, the waiter seemed to take advantage of this and not do his job.  Perhaps ordering from the menu on a day other than Sunday will prove to be a better experience.  Disappointed.

The place is extremely fancy to dine at. The food is of the upmost quality. The staff is very kind, and considering. They have decadent deserts to finish your meal with. The prices are totally worth it for the food and the experience. Very welcoming environment.

lic_dinnermenu: The experience at Copa Cabana begins with a trip to the "Galleria" all-you-can-eat buffet featuring a selection of appetizers:

Fresh Baked Breads (Cheddar Cheese Bread, Cranberry Coconut Bread), Dips (such as Hummus, Spicy Garlic Dip, Guacamole, Chimichurri), Fresh Cheeses, hand-sliced Charcuterie, Crisp Salads (Spinach, Kale, Caesar, Greek, Cabbage), Quinoa, Pesto Pasta Salad, Corn and Bean Salad, sautéed Vegetables, Rice and Beans, Mac & Cheese, Mashed Potatoes, Cassava Frites and more!
Choose from a variety of perfectly seasoned and certified angus grilled meats, carved tableside by your gaucho or carver:
lic_profile: Enjoy authentic Brazilian Rodizio at Copa Cabana with mouthwatering food, exceptional service and an invigorating atmosphere. Induldge in a vast selection of perfectly seasoned and grilled meats along with a full galleria of fresh salads, breads and side-dish creations to satisfy every appetite.

reviews.text: 5/5 honestly one of the best service restaurant experiences in Toronto. I went for my birthday with a group of friends and I was surprisingly shocked at how...

Went back for my 2nd anniversary with my now husband! 

Surroundings. Definitely this place has not been updated whatsoever. Chairs are ripping and cut into...

Ok. Normally I do the story like but I wanna do something else...
This was a fantastic experience. 
Seating. Comfortable chairs. Comfortable table. Close to...

The food here is absolutely amazing but beware going with a big group the service isn't well. So my wife organized my birthday party dinner at this location on a Saturday night so we had a group of 18 people. The service was unbelievable firstly for 18 people we had one waitress which I thought was odd. It would take her 20 minutes to get a drink or a refill. The waitress was also rude towards some of the people who came to celebrate my birthday party. Also some people asked for well done meat as this is a special request and it just did not happen at all so some of my friends had to pay full price for a buffet of salad and mac and cheese. At the end of our dinner a lot of us we're unpleased and just wanted the bill to leave and that took another 25 minutes. So while waiting for the bill I personal asked to speak to the supervisor or manager. So the gentleman came over I explained the situation and he offered to take a couple of drinks of three bills which in my opinion don't think it was enough. Plus with a group they take auto gratuity which leaves no option to tip for terrible service.

Great food not so good service something should be done I can't be the first to experience this.

Too loud! I found the steak excellent, the salad bar good and the corn bread also great. Service was good but we had come with a group from work and they seated us right next to the band and it was so loud that we could not hold a conversation with the person next to us. I found the chicken dry and salmon overdone, but I guess you don't go to a steakhouse for chicken or salmon. There were two tables of our group and after we left the other group was raving over the fried banana which our table was never offered. It's a good place as a spectacle, as the show is good, but again loud. So if you want to do any talking in your meal be sure to be placed away from the stage and band at the front.

Came here for fathers day dinner. Even without a reservation they were able to accommodate us on the patio. Which was amazing bc inside was loud and crowded and we had the patio and the breeze to ourselves. The service was incredible and very attentive which is why I gave it 3 stars. However the other stars missing were for the quality of food and entertainment that has noticeably decreased. None better than the average resort food with mediocre entertainment to satisfy the masses. Loved this place but I think the concept has ran its course.

If you love meat, this is your place! It’s a pricey meal but the meat and buffet are all-you-can-eat. The meat is thinly sliced right onto your plate - fresh and hot - and the buffet offers an array of options. 

Both the indoor dining area and outdoor patio are spacious and clean and the live music on the weekend is a definite bonus.

Well worth a try!

Amazing service accompanied by amazing food!

This past Valentines day was made incredible due to the service and ability of Mr.Bo and his staff at the Uptown location. Charlie took care of myself and my girlfriend as if we were family, tended to our needs, and ensured an unforgettable experience. The Dining room is well lit and the ambiance is enjoyable. Furthermore the entertainment experience was actually entertaining and interactive! Guests are encouraged to take pictures with the dancers which personalizes the experience even more. The pineapple dish here is the best thing I have ever tasted and would have missed out on, if not for the recommendation of Charlie. Altogether, I'm an extremely satisfied customer and will be recommending this place to all my family and friends.

lic_profile: Copetin Restaurant and Bar is led by Chef Claudio Aprile, one Canada's most celebrated, visionary chefs and judge of CTV's Master Chef Canada. Open for lunch and dinner, Copetin offers a la carte menus comprised of Aprile's innovative, thoughtful, elevated cuisine inspired by the cultures and food personalities of Toronto's diverse neighbourhoods. Located just steps away from the Financial District, in the heart of St. Lawrence Market, Copetin's ambiance is relaxed, with a deep respect for service, food and the entire culinary process.

reviews.text: We made reservations at Copetin for a fairly large party of people. As it turned out, we didn't need to - the place was almost empty. Nonetheless, the staff refused to take drink orders at our table-- they insisted we get our own drinks at the bar. This requirement was unnecessary, and not befitting the feel and quality of the restaurant.  While the food was good--interesting flavours, with the cauliflower and the fish taco particular stand-outs, the cocktails were underwhelming.  A $14 margarita shouldn't be watery and flavourless because, for some reason, the bartender decided to serve it in a glass filled with ice.
Nice interior. Food was a bit bland- I thought it would have more flavour/spice. Better off with the bar selection, tapas style. $65 for steak- yikes
'went there for Splenda recipe tasting and it was aaawesooome.   0 sugar content, yet, it just melted in my mouth.   100% natural replacement.   WAY TO GO, GUYS!!!   #nosugar

Food was only ok, but we ate inside and the restaurant ventilation system was imperfect. An hour later I can still smell the kitchen in my clothing. Unfortunately the food wasn't good enough to justify a return visit.

Beet salad was delicious, Ricotta Gnudi was fantastic, and the frozen popcorn and ice cream was wonderful. Great service. Cool hip place, parking garage next door. However, limited beer menu, nothing local, and a little slim on the vegetarian options. Three course lunch for $30 is pretty great for the calibre of food though.
We came in expecting this place to be pricey. And it was. However! The quality of the food the drinks were amazing. They did not cheap out on the...

Never adventurous but simple, never complicated but easy to comprehend, never too many spices, but one or two per dish, Coppi Ristorante paved its way to popularity with this simple formula.

My date and I happened upon this place while we were waiting for our movie to start at TIFF. The bright blue colour attracted my eye as I hadn't been in the area for a while. The place is super cute. We got sat at a quiet table near the back and were welcomed by a delightful server with a cheery smile and demeanour. 

She had mentioned the menu had just changed but was super great at surprising us with a few delicious, neatly plated appetizers. She also mentioned she was the manager and although she was running around organizing the night we felt well taken care of.

Definitely turned a good date night into a great one. A+ service and fabulous atmosphere!

Amazing food, outstanding service, and creative cocktails. Always allows for good conversation while at the same time it is very alive and people who go there can enjoy a lively atmosphere. I would highly recommend the Power Plate. My steak was cooked perfectly and the plate was seasoned to perfection.

This is an amazing restaurant! The cocktails alone are next level. The food is great and there are some healthy vegan options... And they have one of the best roof top patios in Toronto!!! Huge fan! Well done!

Great spot for good clean eats on King st in entertainment district.  Lots of vegetarian options available.  Staff were friendly and service was quick too.  Good was very tasty, just wished I knew the size of my order, as the portion was a bit small. Overall, great dining atmosphere and experience.

Updated. 
Stylish interior. Good food... whenever it's available. Went there a few times and tried to order the same dish and every time it wasn't available. On my last visit I took my family there and experience the slowest service ever; waitress also forgot about a coffee yet charged for it as well as a salad that was supposed to be 'on the house'. It was a few months ago though - haven't been there since; and probably will not return. Too bad, I used to like the rooftop patio back when it used to be 'Hush' cafe. (They still have wine glasses saying Hush on them)

UPDATE:
Must lower my rating to 2 stars due to a placement of a plastic full size statue of a donkey with a USSR logo on it in the middle of the restaurant. Disrespectful, especially because The Great Victory Day was just a couple days ago; and furthermore, if I’m correct, it may be a sign of Trump supporters. Very low, District management, very low. Bye

lic_profile: Diwan's elegant interior evokes the luxury of a private Syrian home in the early 19th century.  Sumptuously decorated with wooden panels inset with mirrors, the room extends the Museum experience to diners: the panels are original and form part of the Aga Khan Museum's Permanent Collection.  Diwan's floor-to-ceiling windows offer a stunning view of the formal garden of the Aga Khan Park designed by Lebanon-based landscape architect Vladimir Djurovic, who visited the world's historic Islamic gardens for inspiration.

Master Chef Mark McEwan and Chef de Cuisine John Kovac offer a menu that highlights flavours and fragrances from the Middle East, North Africa and the Indian subcontinent. Prepared with local and international ingredients, the menu celebrates the many textures and flavours of traditional cuisine with unexpected twists on spicy and savoury dishes.

I'm a member of the museum and always try to leave time for a visit to the restaurant while there.

My first time, my dad and I had what were easily the...
I ate at Diwan during Winterlicious, so my experience with the restaurant itself is limited to their set menu options. I came in not knowing what to expect...

Consistently good food in a classy ambiance. It's like a bistro in an area without many classy restaurants.

It's also pretty expensive for the area, but it...

I'm not sure what the prices are normally, but I came here for winterlicious and I thought it was so worth it! First of all, the decor is just stunning. It's has high ceilings, and a minimalistic style with some Arabic art mixed in, that makes the place look so unique and gorgeous. The place was a little bit busy, so the service was a little bit slow, but it was okay for me. My boyfriend and I ordered different things so we could try a variety of their food, and every single dish was so flavorful! I really enjoy spiced food, so I thoroughly enjoyed eating at this place. The halwa carrot cake was so good, probably my favorite thing there. I will definitely be coming back here, and probably spend an afternoon at the museum as well.
Delicious food and gorgeous decor! Lots of vegetarian and some vegan options. Great service.
That was the best restaurant experience from all aspects. I do suggest everyone to try their foods and services. Really go one place.

Awesome drinks! Fantastic service! And great oysters!!!! 
Keep it up! 

It is a great find in the city with a great location. I highly recommend this...

Always a favourite after work spot. Used to come here with my friends and share some yummy snacks and cocktails. Hands down, The St. Germain is one of my favourites. We also love that they offer small snacks when you don't feel like a whole BIG meal (like warm olives, bread, pickles, fries). Perfect for a ladies night out!

Found it by accident because the restaurant across the street was closed. We were there for my girlfriend’s birthday. Attentive and friendly service. Every dish was delicious, from the kin-chi fries to the Berkshire pork belly and boneless short ribs. The lemon custard is one if the best desserts I have ever had. Definitely will be back - before next year’s birthday celebration.

eclectic funky place.  chillhop playing at a reasonable level.  stellar drinks, expensive food, with small portions, tiny menu.  I had the burrata $18, bone marrow with chicken liver parfait $30.  Still was hungry.  Great vibe though.
Food and cocktails were great. Owner Stanley was very warm and welcoming. Highly recommended!

For the price of the food I would expect that they would provide some level of customer service.

After being a long standing customer I will not be returning.

First time here in 5 yrs. Winterlicious menu but not really a special menu. Service is slow. Food is pretty but average taste wise. Unagi was good but tofu steak bland. Cooking style lacks true Japanese aesthetics. Ice cream was good. 
Interior decor much better than 5 yrs ago but then again back then it looked like a cafeteria. 
They charge for green tea! Yikes.

My friend wanted to come here despite being pretty far from us, but I agreed to come with her and my other friend to try the place out. First off, as soon as you enter you'll realize the atmosphere is different. It looks nice, modern, and fancy. You'll also notice that the type of people that eat here are very classy.

Now the first time I looked at the menu, I thought that the prices were to be expected based off the atmosphere. My friends were significantly surprised that they had to pay $10 for 5 dumplings the size of an acorn. I reassured them that it's most likely taste over quantity. We ordered one of each of their dumplings.

The kobe beef dumplings were disappointing. I guess it was a long shot to expect the beef to taste like the Kobe beef I had when I was in Kobe, Japan, but I expected it to at least taste a little less bland. The skin was delicious though, and I do believe when they say they make them in-house.

The veg dumplings were overpowered by strong flavours, which overshadowed the delicious texture and taste of the skins. Perhaps if the filling was chopped a little more fine it may solve the imbalance.

The Veal and ginger dumplings were the better of the three. The flavours were balanced, though had an unusual tartness to them. The skin was still good, and the Ponzu sauce was average.

The service is a whole different case. The hostess sat us down to order and told us the waitress would arrive shortly to take our order, bringing hot towels and mini appetizers. Then she went to stand by the counter leaning against it, looking bored. We looked through the menu, and the waitress still had not arrived but I had some questions. I waived over the hostess, seeing that nobody else was there, and inquired about the menu. She put on a really bad fake smile (cuz as soon as she was done talking it dropped) and said she was new and knew nothing about the food, telling us to wait for the waitress. She went back to her spot leaning against the counter. Finally the poor waitress arrived at our table flustered but ready to take our order. We asked our questions and she answered to the best of her ability. 

After eating, I was disappointed(as you can tell by my food review). I wanted to get the bill so we could leave. I waved over the hostess, but she looked at me, then looked away. I said a light 'excuse me', but she still continued to ignore me. Finally, I got fed up and went up to the counter with my own fake smile. As I made my way up, I heard her say to one of the other waitresses that was doing something on the POS system that the veal they served 'was actually bad', but immediately quieted as I approached. I was fearful hearing this, because our table was the only one that ordered dumplings; being the observant type, I had been scanning the small space to see what other people ordered. Did she mean bad as in taste bad, or bad as in the ingredients went bad? I wasn't sure at the time, but I did have an upset stomach later that night.

At the counter, I tried to ask for the bill but before I could even finish my sentence she cut me off and told me the bill would be brought to my table and I should sit back down. A little aghast at her attitude, I went to sit back down and waited for the bill. 

Overall, I was very unhappy with my experience. I'll admit that my party was diverse, and perhaps it was discriminatory values that made our experience different. Despite our outward appearances, we still acted with respect however, so I cannot comprehend why we were treated in such a manner.

I think it is only the service that was sub-par, hence the extra star. If they improved service, I would say, that paired with their food, it would at least put them a little bit higher on the 5-star scale.
Fun menu and very friendly atmosphere and price. Love the sushi burrito!
Great service, very accommodating. Fantastic food at a reasonable price.

reviews.text: It will meet your expectations.... I went in early around 0715 and the place was not busy but getting busier by the minute....professional staff, I had freshly squeezed grape fruit juice and strawberry salted caramel waffle with added seasonal fruits....the best waffle I ever had and the maple syrup they use was so good.... I highly recommend this place if you are in Toronto....Well done 👍🏼

I came with my friends on  weekday around 07:30 AM.  The place had very few customers at the time of our visit. The staff were nice, and our drinks arrived fast.
The food was good, but VERY VERY slow. You have to be patient here. And difficult to call staff during your meal, I believe they are low on staff.

The food was decent but what really upset us and confirmed that we would not return is the hostess. There were two hostesses last weekend - one greeted the customers and one seated them, her name was Amy I believe. My friend had a stroller and I requested that we get a table that was off in a corner or that wasn't in a tight space so that people could still get by. She said that it was fine. Once our table was ready and I approached the other hostess, she looked at my friends stroller, rolled her eyes and mumbled, "Ugh, a stroller". She put us at a table for four and my friend and I sat to one side that had other tables close to us. For the rest of the morning, every time Amy had to seat someone, instead of going around the table, she went through the very small space between us and the other tables, bumping my chair each time. The only thing that made the experience better was not our server (he delivered the food and was never seen again until the bill) but another server - she was mature, Filipino with glasses - she was incredibly sweet and friendly and we wish we could have only interacted with her the entire time. We both got standard breakfast meals - eggs, bacon/sausage, toast, fruit but we got the pancakes and waffles as well. The food is decent, but nothing special for breakfast. We were so taken back by this hostess's attitude that we will not be back.

Always a very nice place for breakfast or brunch. Great ambiance and friendly staff. Yummy food too. Service is good and the serving size is also decent. We got the salmon eggs benny, lobster Benny and an omelette at this location. Everything tasted delicious and the fruits were fresh. The salmon Benny was my personal favorite. 5/5 would go again.

This is a really nice breakfast location.  It's not too busy first thing in the morning, and the staff are really good.  They do all the regular fare really well and have a couple of specific dishes that are pretty good.  Coffee is good too which is always a plus!  The atmosphere isn't spectacular, more like a diner feel, but you can sit and chat for a bit, it doesn't seem to get really noisy.
I'm not sure why it gets such low rating. I had a great experience here with really nice staff. My check states that my server was Ricardo. He was prompt to...
1st time here! Came for Sunday dinner, ironically, but was pleasantly pleased with the food. I ordered the veggie omelette and partner had the veggie...

Came here for brunch and was pleasantly surprised.  It's a pretty large space so great for big groups.

The decor is unique in that weird but interesting...
Great for groups and dates alike. The setting is very trendy and warming. The room is also designed to keep your conversations within your own are.  In...

This place is great!!! I love everything about it.
The food is excellent!!! Well flavored. 
The Drinks are amazing!!!
The atmosphere was really nice.
The staff and service was on point and friendly.
 Highly recommended.
I will be differently returning with family and friends
Exquisite food.  Surpasses all expectations. An absolute delight to the palette. A fair price.  Chef Cleva and the entire team no what their doing. Trust their opinion for a good start to any night.

Was a wonderful experience.  Parking was close, washrooms clean, staff very inviting. 
Very attentive to my food allergies as well. 
The owner was extremely polite and made sure our meal and experience was great.
These people love what they do!  They were able to get a vegan and a carnivore to experience the same courses by making creative vegan equivalents to meat-centric dishes. Blown away.

May 31st, 2018 was the 1st time entering Entice Lounge on Queen West & actually it still has me speechless while writing this review today June 1st, 2018... I must say the executive chef Justin Cleva is phenomenal. And the staff from the introduction/greeting, to the VIP treatment, the preparation, the food, the drinks, the presentation I can go on & on with more details.. Everyone that worked in the evening of May 31st, 2018 and cannot thank you enough.. It's almost impossible to make my special lady blush especially on her birthday & Entice you've accomplished that task! 5 STARS all across the board ***** those are stars lol Once again thank you! Entice!!!!!

We were surprised at how good the food was. We tried the lamb shank, lamb tenderloin, scallops and a salad and all were delicious. Service was friendly, efficient and thoughtful. Atmosphere was both upscale and casual. Centrally located and a short walk from the subway.
Had several appetizers and seafood salad as main. Must try the octopus and fried cheese. Beautiful interior and great service

I went there for Valentines day, had a great time. The server was extremely knowledgeable and very welcoming. The food was delicious and relatively quick. There baklava dessert is to die for and must try. I had their lamb shank and it was delicious, the meat just slid off the bone. Definitely recommend this place for special occasions.
Foods was fabulous! We had the lamb and fisherman' stew, both were yummm. Service was great. Highly recommend it!

Beautifully plated Greek food, excellent flavour and quality. These are traditional flavours and dishes without the typical pile of rice, tons of potatoes and two skewers of meat that you'd find at most of the usual Greek spots. Lovely atmosphere & decor for a good date place or to bring your parents. Not too loud or crowded tables close together. Reso recommended.

Creative name for a restaurant. Amelia is the street that they are on and it sounds like family...

Long standing cozy spot in Cabbagetown that has tons of charm and appeal. Limited menu focuses heavily on different types of pasta all with diverse styles and flavours. I’ve never had a bad meal here. I feel the menu can incorporate more things and be more “meat” heavy. It’s more modern vegetarian friendly without going too much to either extreme.

reviews.text:
I’m impressed by the service and overall deliciousness of this place. I sat in the corner booth on the patio and it was a bit loud - busy street behind me - no fault.  Beauty was my server and she took the best care of me. My food was cooked to order and everything was so simple, well done and so delicious.  

Please get this delicious wine (picture attached) and the mozzarella and tomato and basil salad.  A perfect way to start the beautiful summer evenings. The grilled asparagus side has a lemon finish - so good! 

Omg - the bread is so crusty on the outside and soft on the inside. A true Italian bread. 

Enjoy!

Attentive service. Pleasant surroundings. I had a delicious salad and a not so delicious prosciutto and arugula pizza. The pizza was way too thin (even by thin crust standards) and the dough was tough and chewy. It also came with the arugula mounded in the centre, with a wall of prosciutto surrounding it. I would not order that again.

Simple dishes full of flavour and who doesn't love a good wood fire oven pizza?  Gnocchi was incredibly light and fluffy (only critique is that it's rolled into a log and then cut) but the sauce was amazing. You want to eat up every last drop. The lamb cavatelli was hearty and huge portion!  Would definitely be back

Located at The Shops of Don Mills, this place has Italian dishes such as thin crust pizza, chicken, meat, seafood and fish. However, despite that, there is not a lot of selection. We were a large party of 12 and I would only say that the best dishes were the roasted half chicken (best dish on the menu), veggie or margarita pizza and veal parmesan. One of our party ordered a fish dish and there were some ingredients in the meal that were not on the menu. Cannot comment on the pasta dishes as I do not recall anyone who ordered it. Service was on the slow slide and prices are on the high side. Overall, it's okay but there are better choices out there if you want Italian.

The food was great. I ordered the gnocci and the ricotta fritters for dessert. What lacked about this place was the service level. Our server barely came over to ask us if we needed anything and we always had to flag him down. 

Vegetarian options are available. Reservations recommended. Wheelchair accessible. Coat check is free.
Great atmosphere, food, and of course, service. Everyone was so friendly and made sure you were comfortable. Right when you walk in you could check your...

I'm extremely impressed by Figo.

The location is a premium corner at the corner of John. Great...

Excellent food and even better service.  The wait staff was courtesy and allowed ample time and suggestions for a wine pairing, and the appetizers were quick to come out of the kitchen.  There was never a time that my water was empty and meal was to die for.  Hard to beat an experience like this!

Excellent first visit to Figo, beautiful restaurant with open Kitchen where you can see the stuff cooking away. Probably the best pizza I've had in Toronto in a really long time! Made by a wood oven, Maple pancetta arugula and shaved Parmesan. Staff was friendly, cocktails were small but well-made. Excellent atmosphere with light electronic music in the background, loud enough not to listen in on your neighboring table, not so loud that you can't hear the person in front of you. Will definitely be visiting again.

I'm not the type to eat a salad for lunch. This place changed my mind! Despite being jealous of my co-workers' pizza selections, I thoroughly enjoyed my arugula salad, thoughtfully made with flavourful toppings. Fast enough service to be in-out in under 1 hour.

Took my girl to figo for her birthday. Although i had a reservation from before i was told they had no tables available which was frustrating. But the staff and the manager went above and beyond and got us a table. Had an amazing experience. Great food with wide selection of wine.

Staff- professional & knowledgeable
Location- easy to get to by street car, bus and walking 
Interior- Beautiful interior. comfortable seating. Bar + dining room + cafe style seating 
Food- amazing food looks too good to eat but of course leaves you wanting more. I recommend the calamari as a starter. Portion sizes are perfect good value for your money.

lic_profile: Figures is serving more than just exquisite food and crafted cocktails - they're also drawing on some of your fondest memories of comics and superheroes and bringing them to life again. Nostalgia at its finest! Guests will be met with enchantment and delight upon entering the venue as decoupage style comics and poetry decorate the walls and complement the dark wood tones. With plush seating the venue is a refined and eclectic space to host any gathering.

reviews.text:
Swanky, young and good music and the food and service was great.

The dancefloor opened up later and it was a really good looking crowd.

Loved it

Bit of a style-over-substance situation over here.

Decided to try out this interesting dinner spot at Ave and Dav...'interesting' in the sense that it has...
Stopped by this spot for dinner while visiting toronto for the weekend and I have to say I was not disappointed! I dont know why this place doesn't have...

A small space with a very unique theme: cartoon & comic book characters adorn the walls (plus Pacman inspired artwork on the ceiling) -- perhaps too small. Our group of 14 arrived on time for our reservation and was forced to sit where 12 would normally fit. A large party -- 15 to 20  people -- was seated in the middle of the floor, not 6 inches behind us. Things were definitely cramped. These issues aside, I can wholeheartedly recommend the cocktails. Expensive, but each cocktail is unique and the care taken in mixing and serving them was a pleasant surprise. The appetizers and main courses were very tasty although portion sizes were a bit small. Definitely make reservations and go with the necessary cash to enjoy their cocktails.

My girlfriend wanted to try this place because it looked interesting from the street. We were very disappointed. Our appetizer came at the same time as our meal and the waiter did nothing about it. When I paid, he did not look away as I used the machine. Then he looked at the receipt and walked away hostily. Did not thank us or wish us a good night. I spoke up and said thank you. He did not reply. He should be grateful for the tip he got. Would not return to this expensive joke of a restaurant.

What a really fun restaurant. The staff are very helpful and eager. The restaurant has a nice atmosphere around dinner time and then a loud/party type atmosphere later into the night. They have really good quality food such as Kobe beef. There is street parking and paid parking available near by. This place is also great for both dinner groups or party groups.

Best experience I’ve ever had at a restaurant! The staff and servers were so unbelievably nice and go above and beyond in every aspect. Bryn was my server and was amazing in every way! And on top of that, the food was the best I’ve ever had - from the taste to presentation, everything was perfect. I will be coming again and telling everyone about this place.

A truly unique restaurant experience in Toronto! The drinks are entertaining on their own and the food is very well made. We all shared plates so I got to try a bit of everything and each dish was tasty and well executed. The owners are personable and take the time to ensure you're enjoying your meal and overall time in their restaurant, but the best thing about this place is that later in the evening it turns into a loungy nightclub with amazing music. Such a great spot you'll want to check out.

Five Doors North redefines eclectic for the Yonge and Eglinton neighbourhood with an inspired cocktail list featuring locally crafted spirits and created by Robin Heywood. Chef Vito Rizzuto and David Brace combine their years of experience to capture the essence of simplicity with flair.

A cozy Italian restaurant. Good food options, the daily specials were great.  Service was awesome!  Overall dinner experience was good and will visit again.
I would give it a 4.5. Good vibes good service my wife's steak was done nicely, but my pasta was not warm. I d visit again
If you want to eat amazing tasty fresh meat, this place is for you.
Has been our to go for birthdays the last two years, great food and friendly staff.

I came here with a party of 15 for a birthday...
A poor experience made worse by an arrogant manager/owner who clearly lacks an understanding of how to create a fine dining experience. Just a few of the...

If you like fish this is the place for you! Amazing seafood and service was fantastic. Setting is upscale but fun. They were playing 80s tunes which is my jam. Would repeat to try some of the other dishes we missed. Fish, octopus an potatoes were done perfectly.

Ask anyone who wants to share a meal with you where to go for amazing food, service, menu and quality if it is possible also to eat outside.   Bingo is what you get when you enter Estia on Avenue Road!  Cannot stop raving over Ken our server and wonderful chef who never missteps and we are there all the time.  Stunning patio along with gorgeous interior also well decorated to make occasions festive and special.   Seriously not to be missed.

I went here with my girlfriend for our first year anniversary.  This is a really good restaurant, as it's classy, great setup and atmosphere.  The staff are really well trained and very friendly.  You also get to listen to very cool retro songs from artists such as Prince, Madonna, Tears for Fears, Phil Collins, etc.  In terms of your budget, for a couple, I would say with various foods, drinks and tip, $250 is what you're looking at.  I gave my server a 20% tip.  She was awesome and very easy to get along with.  Once you're done, ensure to take a nice walk home as the city of Toronto is a great place to view.  :)

We lucked into this spot when we couldn't get a reso at Morton's and we were VERY pleasantly surprised! High quality menu prepared to perfection with professional service. I had my heart set on Steak and while Estia may specialize in fish dishes they make an excellent steak, too. If you're visiting the Yorkville area, do yourself a favour try this restaurant. (Pictured is the grilled half chicken, which my wife very much enjoyed).
The meal was decent, nothing to write home about. Definitely over priced for the quality. Bonus star for excellent service.

reviews.text: Excellent service, well-executed food - and welcoming of a multi-generation family with a toddler. They made a complimentary little bowl of pasta with...

SERVICE: 10/10. Courteous and friendly with a smile. No complaints whatsoever.

FOOD: 2/10. I have no idea who is the chef, but he's / she's clearly not...
We were attending a movie screening, so I Googled to find a restaurant close by for a nice dinner beforehand. What a pleasant surprise! Clean,  welcoming...
Food was great.  Sister in laws birthday. Don't expect your piece of cake as a gift.  Go to the Four seasons for that.

Been here a few times and love the food.
The gluten free pizza and pasta is great!
Prices are reasonable, staff friendly.
Enjoy!
This restaurant use to be amazing.  Tried it this past May with my mother, and the food for the main course was super bland, and their salad was even less impressive. Serivice was friendly.

I am going to give this place an A for effort. The waitress was very upbeat and generous with her attention. The service was super prompt and we didn't have to wait around at all for our order. 
 The atmosphere was generic of many Italian restaurants, but I genuinely like that look. The chairs were slightly uncomfortable and the table cloths were scratchy polyester. 
My husband and I shared a Florentia pizza, which is their house special. The combination of ingredients looked promising, but the flavour was underwhelming. We also shared their gnucci and rustic chicken pasta and again, found their flavours to be lacking.
Overall, we had a good time there, but there is no need to go back.

Lovely ambiance and the waitress. She went out of her way to divide an order of spaghetti into 2, for my kids. The pizza and the seabass were great, however, we found a small metal wire in our daughter's spaghetti. The waitress was way too nice so I didn't mention it.

Located in the heart of Queen West, Fonda Lola focuses on fresh local ingredients and inventive tequila based cocktails. The menu showcases elevated Mexican food in an authentic, rustic environment, offering a casual dining experience with friendly and professional staff.

reviews.text: We picked this restaurant for their Winterlicious menu  and were blown away by the quality of food and service! I had the best tofu taco ever, and I'm also...
The food here is super tasty! Fun music and summery casual vibe. The fish tacos are delicious.  Only reason for the four stars is that it's over priced for...
I reaaaaaally liked this place! Took me back to my honeymoon in Mexico! The ambiance of the joint was perfect for me. Felt as though I was transported back...

This restaurant is amazing! 10 out of 10 for the food, and service. The owner was extremely friendly and the rest of the staff was very accommodating. I recommend the chicken or pork tacos and margaritas! If you book in advance, ask to sit in the back patio - it’s a beautiful space for dinner and drinks in the summer. Must try hot spot!

$40 each for dip & chips, a few lettuce leaves, small tacos, and ONE churos (after a 20+ min wait, so bad we left them after one bite). The tacos were nice, but small. However everything else we could have made better ourselves at home. An absolute ripoff. We very politely explained our feelings to both the waitress and the supervisor, who merely shrugged, said "I understand", and promptly passed me the credit card machine with no other explanation. I can forgive the horrific waiting times between courses and to pay, as I could see they were busy, but cannot forgive charging $40 for so little, both in quantity AND quality.
Good food, if not perfect. Service was outstanding, and great cocktails. The patio is very quaint, weather permitting.

Don't bother wasting your time on this place. Can't give you a review on the food, as we actually never ended up eating here. I had concerns about it when we walked in and found no other customers. The waitress and her crusty disposition could be a big reason for this. As other posters have said, too many other choices in the area to waste time here.
Great aunthentic  Mexican Food!!! Patio is so relaxing I really enjoyed having brunch there. Cant wait  to come back and have a girls night out with a couple margaritas.

reviews.text: Went here for dinner and the food was quite good. The service was excellent as there were only 8 people in the restaurant on a friday night. The atmosphere...
Came here randomly because we liked how there was seating on the street which isn't quite common here in Toronto so we gave it a go. We were seated right...

I read somewhere ..' be like Fred, don't be here' I agree with this statement 100%. 

We had reservations and only to be greeted with 'im busy, I don't care...

What a strange hang. I walked into restaurant with only two tables and nobody visible to help me. I sat down and could see some kitchen help that knew I was there, and still waited and waited and waited for somebody to come out.
When somebody finally did come out I was able to order beer and ask for a menu. The girl seemed surprised that I was going to order food and it wasn't that late. It was 8:30 p.m. and there was still two tables in there. But oddly enough I barely saw her all night long. I ordered the steak and the steak was amazing and all of my three stars are because the steak was really good. What was lame was the side of green beans that were barely steamed almost raw. With absolutely no flavor no seasoning whatsoever. And it will serve for fries and the fries were good. I had that lobster crab bisque soup that was interesting but I don't know why it get such high rating cuz I didn't think it was that good. My meal was basically a really good steak and a really good beer. The cost was pretty enormous for how lame everything had been. I felt like the service was really under par and the meal was not thought out. When I was first ordering I was pushed towards a two-course option. And then as I was ordering she asked me if I wanted an appetizer and I had already forgotten that it was included and said I'm fine. Then I realized I think I'm paying for an appetizer and that's when I added the soup. Overall I felt like it was very lame. Comes to the end of the night and the last table in the place and her back is to me for the longest period of Time full day napkins, I don't know what she was doing. All I know is I had to get up and walk over and ask her to bring me out. I was the only person in the place it wasn't that hard. I question whether it should be a two store review but the steak was really good.

We had a great meal and service. The waitress was extremely kind and cooperative. In the end she gave hints of nice places to go in Toronto, very kind! I chose the lamb rack with couscous and my wife selected a two-course dinner. It all tasted great. The place was a bit empty, though.

Fred's not here has an excellent downstairs restaurant called the red tomato. The Steakhouse also quite good. Not a fan of the chicken but all the steaks salads and pizzas are great.
The wait staff are hit and miss. Mostly hit. They also have cool themed events and whatnot.
Excellent food and service. I did the Mirvish Theatre dinner and show package. Must do. The food here is great and close to the theatre. Service was Excellent!
Nice place, good ambiance, and a very friendly server, but was underwhelmed with the food.

reviews.text:
We come here because we purchased a Groupon tasting menu dinner for 4. Overall rating I would say 3.5 stars but for sure not 4. 

The decor is nice but abit...

I went to Globa Bistro for summerliocus with friends for their 2017 menu.

The restaurant was pretty fancy with high hanging chandeliers and dim lighting....
Went there for breakfast, bit gloomy n cold day outside, globe bistro was even gloomier inside, v dark for the morning.... felt like We made a wrong brunch...

I like this place a lot. The food is great and the prices are reasonable. The only reason they get 4 *'s instead of 5 is that they serve their red wine too warm. Any time after the end of winter in Toronto, 'room temperature' is far too high for red wine; it should be served at the correct temperature, especially if it's one of my favourites, Hidden Bench Pinot Noir!!!

Elegant dining room, sophisticated food, and great service come together at Globe. I've been three times for their tasting menu which changes regularly and features locally sourced ingredients. They also were able to accommodate my partner's food allergies. Brunch is also great. I recommend the dining room over the bar seating area if you can get it as the artwork and lighting are beautiful back there. The best fine dining in the neighbourhood.

Excellent! The food, service and atmosphere are excellent! The maitre d' was especially helpful and informative. Food is fresh and sustainable. Plates made in-house and sustainable. Happy Hour from 4:00 to 6:00 p.m. and includes in-house wines,  beer, drinks and half-price oysters.  Reasonably- priced happy hour menu. Fish and chips ,very fresh and delectable! Definitely will go back!
The food tasted good, but the portion sizes were surprisingly small.  The service was very good.
I had the prix fixe for Easter brunch. It was delicious! I left feeling stuffed. I really liked the parsnips and white chocolate soup.

reviews.text: Great craft beer. Great food. Currys are legit. If you love spice the vindaloo is pretty intense. If you like a nice IPA go for the galactic. Their beer store is open late with good prices.

A cozy place with a rich selection of craft beers. These guys are open 7 days a week with no holidays so feel free to enjoy some quality ales any day you like. Don't hesitate to take away your favourite drinks as there is also a friendly bottle service on the site.

My wife and I had our wedding reception here on January 6th, and we can not recommend the Brewery highly enough, whether it's a dinner, brunch or your wedding reception. 

We want to thank Ron and Chris so much for everything you and your staff did for us. From helping us start planning the evening a year ago, to helping us bring everything in on Friday. When our rehearsal dinner space had a fire Chris saved us some tables so we could still have dinner, and of course thank you for everything you did the day of the wedding.

The food was amazing. It was the first time I ate at a wedding and all our gusts raved about how delicious the dinner was. 

You did so much and it was such a special evening that we will remember forever. You and your staff are wonderful!

Thank you again,

Elizabeth and Alexander

Perfect for a casual pub experience with good food and relaxed service. Food ranges from healthier salads to traditional pub style fare. Beer is brewed on site and can be purchased at the retail location beside the restaurant. My finding is that the beer is very good, very fresh. Neat to find the growler size.
Cozy bar/restaurant with a lot of seating in the back, great for big groups. Nice selection of beer and pub food.
Went to the Granite Brewery on a Friday night around 7pm, with a party my in-laws, (4 adults 2 kids) for dinner. The back patio was full (which made me a...
Food here is classic pub grub, so definitely nothing upscale. I got the taco and it was okay and hit the spot, but my expectations weren't really that high...
The restaurant is much larger than it looks upon walking in. The bar section is very small but there are plenty of tables and booths and an outside patio....
