reviews.text:
Looking for a restaurant before we went to the Mod Club, my partner and I stumbled across Hapa. 

The service was friendly and attentive. The music was on a...
The interior of this place is really nice - looks more lounge-y like than restaurant like, and it can accommodate large parties (there's a whole section in...
This place is large & great for large parties. Their drink prices are pretty good & very yummy. The food is also good, but not worth the high price. $20 for...

An amazing place!! I had my birthday here! Staff members treated my guests and I very well, and they were super friendly! I had such an amazing time and the food was spectacular! Mackenzie was a fabulous host! He made sure that we had such an awesome time, and accommodated my group of 15! Definitely would recommend this place for birthday celebrations or to just chill and have fun with friends and family! I give it 11/10! 😁

Food is great - different, with its own "face". Both tunas (Avocado and  Tataki) are exceptional - for the true fish lovers - don't miss this flavor and the texture. We were a bit early (around 5pm on Sat) and the music was oldies which we get tired off shortly, but the food quality didn't let us go. Cocktails were surprisingly non-obvious  - never thought of mixing tequila with plum wine, but apparently it works great! Keep it up!
Excellent restaurant/bar! Happening place!! Very friendly, hip and fun place to be. Great place to hang out, meet new people, sit next to sidewalk, enjoy drinks and great food!!

Every one of us loved our meals and the service was exceptional. I contacted the restaurant ahead of time about my extensive dietary restrictions (autoimmune protocol) and when we got there our waiter was well-informed about what I would be able to eat. Thank you for such a wonderful experience Hapa Izakaya!
Best place I have ever been to. Service is great with really good food and their signature cocktail "hello kitty" is to die for 👌.

reviews.text:
Went here on a Saturday around dinner time. Originally what brought us here was the reviews about the great patio.

Patio was nice but it ends there. The...

Was taken here for my birthday. 

Nice cozy spot, friendly staff, cool music even a live performer at 8. 

Good menu with a  decent selection of...
Been here a couple times, my go-to here is always the chicken and waffles. I've also been to the other (now closed) location- food is more or less the same...

Great spot that I practically stumbled on to and was very pleased with everything about it. Amazing atmosphere.  I had breakfast and sat outside on the patio and enjoyed the view of the decor that has obviously been well thought out. The food was great. The service was great and the overall experience was fun. I would highly recommend if you are in the area. I hope to be back myself someday.

Love this spot for their chill vibes and delicious Jamaican inspired food! They have a great patio out back too. Thoroughly enjoyed their brunch, especially their take on eggs Benny on their cornbread. The sweetness of the cornbread with the savouriness of the hollandaise is a winning combo!
I went there a month ago for my birthday and I had a ball. The food was delicious the service was impeccable, the staff made sure we were well taken care of throughout the night.
I only went for lunch so didn't get to experience the music and what not. But the food was great. Staff was very pleasant and polite. Get experience. Would recommend to friends. 👌

I have been a few times and look always forward to going again. The food is so good, portion sizes are fantastic, and the music and ambiance is perfect.  Service is a bit on slow side but good food takes time!

lic_profile: An intimate dining experience, Hawthorne focuses on bringing local and sustainable fare to the table. Hearty and heartwarming is the base for all their dishes, finishing with a spark of imagination and a dash of the unexpected. This is casual fine dining with an emphasis on world class service. The signature cocktails and wines from the carefully curated regional wine list highlight the tastes of Ontario. Hawthorne is a social enterprise that trains people in need of skills and employment. All profits are used to support the training program.

reviews.text: Lunch Menu - I highly recommend the Lambton Beets! The service was great, and the restaurant has large windows which means beautiful lighting and lots to...

Personally I have always had great experience here--not to mention the fries are amazing here!!!

This time, my review is based mostly on my experience as a...
10/10 great food, great service, and great cause for the community & environment! Plus the bathrooms were clean and stylish which seals the deal

This place is fantastic! I met up with a friend here and our server was very attentive and gave specials of the day and recommendations. 

I love the jerk chicken sandwich and the chocolate mousse for dessert! Everything was absolutely above my expectations and yes, I definitely will come back here again!

Great tasty food, a social enterprise restaurant that provides training and experience for Front of House and Back of House positions.  Some menu items are meal share where meals are given to the needy in the community.  All locally sourced within 100 miles. Service is always friendly and upbeat.
10/10 great service, great food and wonderful mission of helping the community and environment! Also clean and appealing washrooms which seals the deal

We stopped in on a Tuesday night for winterlicious / my boyfriends birthday. Andrew, our server, was delightful and attentive ! The food was tasty as well with generous portions. Was gifted a free coffee voucher and will definitely be back for lunch! 

Recommend the desserts - thank you for a lovely evening !
Large portions. Locally sourced food. Great staff.

reviews.text: Got a voucher from travelzoo for 7 courses for 2 ppl for 44 dollars. What a deal. It was a nobrainer especially when the restaurant was so close to me. The...
My girlfriend's mom came to visit us in town, and she has requested "something special and fun". Teppanyaki pops in my head right away, so I found this...
It was a great place to have teppanyaki!!! Lobster is so great! Very delicious and fresh!!!!!! And the service and hospitality is great too! My friend and I...

Fantastic service. My husband has a scent allergy and another diner was wearing perfume, the staff were very accommodating and moved us to a private table. The food was phenomenal and the chef was very fun and entertaining. Overall exceeded my expectations and thoroughly enjoyed my dining experience. Will definately come back!

The food and service were great. The staff was friendly and the quality of the food as well as the taste was really good. it's a great place for friends, family, or any semi formal social gathering. It's not too expensive and they have group options too.
Amazing experience! The food was great, and the chef have us a show as he cooked our meal right in front of us!
Perfect! I come to Hibachi every time I fly in Toronto.  It’s a great, relaxed atmosphere and amazing sushi.  They have a wonderful menu and awesome cocktails. Thanks Hibachi!

The service was great (very attentive staff) and the cook was awesome to watch (Justin was our maestro). 

The only reason why I’m not giving 5 stars is because the accompanying salad and sushi were very disappointing.. Let’s be real guys; iceberg lettuce and Loblaws looking sushi is pretty wacky.

reviews.text:
Went today for Sunday Brunch! They've upped their prices to $26.95 per person.

We made reservations easily a few days before hand so we didn't have to...
I had supper this evening at The Hot House Restaurant & Bar with my pals.  Our intent was to hang on the patio but the threat of rain had us sitting...

Went there yesterday for their Sunday brunch. The food, the amount of choices, and the service -- none of it disappoints! 

The only reason I give it 4...

Visited on a Saturday morning. Huge restaurant near St. Lawrence market in Toronto, food was slightly above average for breakfast. Ordered the smoked salmon plate which I was pleasantly surprised to see on a breakfast menu. Was not the usual bacon and eggs so it impressed me. Prices are fair, but honestly the place was pretty dated. Service was good, server was prompt and attentive.

This has been one of our absolute favorite Sunday brunch restaurants for over 15 years. We drive almost 2 hours to come down and sit in Scottie's section. He's so sweet and thoughtful, right down to the complimentary mimosas last time because we were celebrating our wedding anniversary. We've had birthday parties there, intimate dates there, every single time from the service to the coffee to the jazz to the food (of course!!) Everything is perfect.

This rating is for the brunch only.  There is live jazz performance and a the food is not bad.  What I like 1) a great amount of cakes available like 4 cheesecakes and 3 moose cake.  2) most food is light and fresh (not salty at all).  3) kids under 5 is free.  What I don’t like 1) roast beef is dry and over cooked.  2) wish there are more variety of food 3) wish there is more seafood other then salmon, smoke salmon and small shrimp in a salad.

Had lunch here with a fairly large group of people. The service was decent and the wait was normal (about 30 minutes). I had their Atlantic salmon which was seared to perfection. Their Jambalaya was tasty and the Makhani curry chicken was fairly good as well. Portion sizes are filling, however prices are on the expensive side.

Amazing brunch. The place was packed so we had to wait for a table to be ready even though we had reservations. It was about half an hour to 45 minutes. Once we got to our table the service was outstanding and the food was amazing.

reviews.text: As far as Italian food goes, this is the real deal. The pasta is fresh, the pizza is not too thin but definitely not thick, the tastes are authentic, the service was nice, and all-in-all it's a wonderful dining experience. Check it out!

Small meat portion, meat was tough - waiter argues instead of solving the problem almost created another one. Eventually a replacement dish was offered which was acceptable.
food was too oily and left a bad aftertaste.
Good food, pizzas ,good steak and veal chop , friendly service.
Great service and very professional team. Highly recommended for events and family gatherings.

They are extremely cheap when it comes to meat. Do not get the lasagna lol it's a joke. A little square of thick noodles with with one or two little pieces of ground beef and a bunch of oily tomato sauce. Stay away from this place I tell you.

3.5/5, +.5 for service.

My second stop for Summerlicious 2013 took me to this Italian restaurant, after looking at the prix fixe menu with the combination...

"An Italian classic that shames its heritage with mediocre food and abysmal service"

This well established Italian restaurant on the Northern end of tony...
After getting a glass of water slammed down in front of me, waited 15 minutes to be asked what I wanted, the time during which the guy behind me, who came...

reviews.text:
I am vegan and ordered the "AGNOLOTTI IN BUTTER SAUCE". It was absolutely delicious but the portion side was shocking! It was probably the smallest portion size I've ever seen in my life (and I eat out a lot at restaurants). I still felt really hungry after finishing. In all honesty, I would have expected double the amount they gave me. I would have gave this place 4 or 5 stars if it wasn't for the stingy amount of food they served me. It's not like it's cheap either.

My friend who also ordered the same dish got the same measly amount. I noticed some of the people at our table who ordered meat got a better portion size. I don't know if this it just the standard portions they serve for vegans or what was going on but I was very disappointed by it. Everything else was great though. Good service, nice atmosphere and I'm actually happy they have a Vegan menu. I think if they start to dole out better portions then I'd eat here again.

Went with my son for a Saturday afternoon lunch date. He had the lasagna which was great.

I ordered the omelet of the day. The food all came at the same time. Alas, mine had gotten cold.

One of the servers noticed my disappointment and whisked it away and brought back a perfect new omelet in just a few minutes- piping hot.

We were not even her table so good on her!

At the end of the day the food was all very good and the outside patio was a nice place to eat

My friend and I went to the Danforth location to try its plant-based vegan menu.. plant based vegan Italian?! sign me up! 

I had never even heard of Vegan Merlot wine... but I must say it was a crowd pleaser! There were so many intriguing menu options to choose from it was hard to settle on one... we got the avocado Caesar salad to start (honestly better than a regular Caesar!!!), as well as the Greek salad. 

If it couldn't get any better... we tried the cashew "ricotta" stuffed agnolotti and the asparagus "cheese" pizza. It was to DIE for! I told the owner that when I come back, I would willing order a vegan style pizza. 

Service was outstanding, I can't wait to come back to try more menu items and relax on their wonderful patio! Highly recommend this spot :).

Service is excellent, and 90% of the food is spectacular. I was hugely disappointed in the vegan item I had, the vegan "fettuccine alfredo". While I'm not vegan, I have some trouble with dairy so I was excited to try it. While the pasta was good, the sauce was beyond bland tasting like plain pasta with margarine.  The other dishes I've tried have been amazing, though. So my conclusion would be that for great Italian food I would go here, but if I wanted vegan food I would go elsewhere.

Great service as always! Food is very consistent, fresh and yummy with a nice drink menu.
It's on the Danforth so parking can take some time especially at dinner time but there's street parking and several Green P's around.

I love their thin crust oven baked pizza!
The staff is very friendly and always accommodating! 
The best pizza in the neighborhood by far.
We enjoyed a late dinner, were treated right away, our server was great, very friendly, accommodating and professional. Even though it was late at...
Stopped by for a bite Wednesday night. Got seated right away. Shared a $10 pizza special and calamari. Food was great, service was friendly and multiple...

reviews.text:
This is an excellent Italian restaurant. The food quality is high and the service quite good. Prices vary based on item but there is a good range to choose from in terms of luxury items line lobster to more standard fare.

It's location is just off the beaten path and that may account for its slightly less busy atmosphere.

Would I recommend you try it... Definitely!

I’ve dined here on several occasions. Last Friday was however the best eating experience I’ve had. A romantic date for two, or a casual setting for friends, the atmosphere fits any occasion. The food/service also measures high in my books, seasonally changing menus, it’s always fresh and truly Italian. Be sure to listen for the specials and do not pass on dessert!

So consistent. So good.
Update: we went back this weekend for a Father's Day dinner and they knocked it out of the park again. Authentic contemporary Italian cuisine  -even impressed my old man who was born in Northern Italy.

This past weekend we hosted a couples shower for a group of 30. Prior to this we came to check out the place, tried a pizza, and were excited about having our guests join us because everyone we met that evening were very nice. We finished our pre-dinner event earlier and I sent my guests there to have a few drinks before dinner, they arrived about 45 minutes earlier than the reservation. This was clearly a mistake on my end because it was not well received and stressed out the staff. For the entire night I felt bad about this and apologized to Giancarlo multiple times to try and change his mood. I will say now, I have mixed feelings about even feeling bad. Our group was very easy going and polite. It is a celebratory event and I shouldn't have had to feel bad that we showed up early when my guests were very polite and respectful. They nor I were not all greeted as well as we could have been.

I had a set dinner and there was miscommunication here and I should have gotten things cleared up on my end in writing. Giancarlo was gracious and honoured the price we verbally agreed to. Thank you.

Overall food was good, great atmosphere, and most importantly our guests had a great time. This event was something very special for us and we appreciated the accommodation though I wish the service was a little bit friendlier. Without the kindness of one of the staff members - Sharon, I'd lower my rating. This would have easily been a 5 star for us had I not felt I needed to explain myself all evening. I will say it ended well (at least for me), but not for any lack of effort on my end.

I have been dining with Giancarlo for over 3 years now at Il Ponte. Il Ponte...the bridge to great food. As an Italo-Canadian, food is always the top of our food chain...and Il Ponte does not disappoint. From a single meal to a group of 50 guests Giancarlo and his staff have always been gracious, courteous and thoughtful. Last week we hosted a dinner for a celebration and renewal of the TV Series The Expanse. There were 50 cast and crew that enjoyed the atmosphere, the food and the service. Hats off to Giancarlo and his staff for pulling off a great evening for everyone.

lic_profile: Indian Street Food Co. is a perfect place for a quick snack, a hearty lunch, a night on the town or dinner with family!  Embracing the past with an entirely new approach, fun, familar yet innovative, the food focuses on recreating traditional recipes using local ingredients, showcased in contemporary form. The cusine is best described as "street inspired", the kitchen classic with unexplored charm on India's diverse regions.

reviews.text: Probably the best Indian food I've ever had.  When I was a kid I used to always go for the inferno type spicy food.  Now I prefer things milder so I can...

I'm no expert but I thought the food here tasted really good. 

For 3 people, we ordered the Veg Samosa Chaat (not actually a triangle shaped pastry with...
One of my biggest pet peeves in the restaurant industry is this trend of under-explaining everything on a menu, which is certainly true of Indian Street...

Really food place for authentic Indian food. The most amazing thing about this place you will see more foreigners there rather than Indians. That testifies for the food. Though the hard drinks were not that good but the food overall was fantastic. The setting of the restaurant is so beautiful. The servers are really good. Overall perfect place.
Great food. Excellent quality ingredients. Good vegetarian options. Never enjoyed cauliflower so much! Nice decor and attentive service. Recommended.

The food was really good. We ordered Chicken Thali, all the vegetables but tasty. If you like spicy food you have to tell them before. The ambience was very relaxing. I liked my server Shabbir who was very welcoming and accommodating. 
I will definitely go again for the food. I am foodie. Wish it was at the west end of the city.

POOR SERVICE! Terrible customer service !!! Not only they are rude to walk-ins and they only give u a table if u have a reservation but they pick and choose who they want to place on their tables.  The waiters are racist and rude. They are just there to make maximum amount of money per table.. they are there to serve you indian food. I have had better indian food cheaper and yet amazing customer service. Never going back there.

Food was good but service was very poor. The server was very rude. We had a group of 12 people and there were some other customers as well. Restaurant had only one server. He got me the room temperature beer. Unacceptable, but i didnt want to create a scene. Second beer also same. Third time, I had to ask him to get me a chilled one whichever brand he had. 
My friend had to wait for 20 mins to get a cold beer as the waiter kept it in the fridge only after the order. Funny thing is when my friend asked where is the beer, waiter's rude reply was its getting chilled lol... I'm not sure who goes to a restaurant and wait for the beer to get chilled!! Will never go back again. For me, service is very important.

lic_profile: Nestled in the heart of Toronto's Annex, Insomnia Restaurant & Lounge is a neighbourhood favourite known for its great food and warm service.  The menu combines international comfort foods with seasonal and classic cocktails and local and imported beers and wines. Open from early morning to late night, Insomnia offers consistent hospitality and a great experience.

reviews.text: I have been here over 10 times in the past year for brunch (if you can't tell it's my go to place) but I've unfortunately never had the opportunity to come...

Wrong order? 45 minute wait for food?

I'm generally a patient person, but I get pretty cranky if I have to wait a while for my breakfast. Getting a table...
It's been quite a few years since I've been to Insomnia and my friend suggested to come here for brunch on Saturday. She warned me it would be packed and...

Went there for brunch on Sunday. We were 8, so waited for almost an our for the table. Food was served pretty much fast considering the place was packed. The food was amazing. I ordered steak and eggs and the steak was a close call to a steak house dish. We were served perfectly and politely. I recommend to go.

Great place for brunch! What I particularly enjoy were the potaotes. The home fries were all coated with ketchup which provided a sweet and tangy taste. They also have a variety of vegan options due to its location. The brunch menu only lasts until 3PM and when I arrived at 2:50 I was still given the brunch menu which was nice. I find their portions quite fair and I enjoy that there wasn't an overwhelming amount of fruit compared to some other brunch spots I have been to. 

Parking is a little hard in the area so be prepared to circle around to find a spot. 

If I'm ever in the area I will definitely be back!

Great place to have breakfast or brunch. I've been hear with friends and I've been here solo. Both times the service was great. I would recommend their omelets! And only weekends they make the blueberry pancakes (it's massive) but so delicious. Definitely top 5 favorite brunch place in Toronto.

A favourite brunch spot in The Annex. Unique decor with a bit of a rustic feel. Enjoy the wall art while you’re here, especially the chalkboard wall in the back. If you like French Toast or Eggs Benedict this is a must try. Try to snag a lounge chair in the back for a more intimate setting.

Brunch all day with some interesting options. Extremely busy most of the time so expect to be waiting. Atmosphere is really interesting with cool ambiance like a tree and hanging less. All in all, worth the wait.

Jamie’s Italian has an inviting, relaxed atmosphere, offering simple, freshly made Italian-inspired dishes with a Jamie twist. Focusing on fresh, sustainable ingredients and bold, classic flavours, the restaurant features high ceilings and an open kitchen, accented by vintage school chairs, leather banquettes and a statement wall of reclaimed wood. A welcoming bar and friendly service will make each guest feel like they’re at their new favourite local gathering spot.

reviews.text:
For a Thursday night, the place wasn't as busy like most people have been saying in their reviews. We were seated right away which was great. 

The service...

Came here to celebrate my first year marriage anniversary with hubby and we were surprised at the quality of the food! 

We came on a late Sunday night so...
I went to the Yorkdale location on a Saturday evening. The place was busy good thing we booked a reservation. We got the Italian nachos for appetizer. It...

My mother and I always enjoy our meal a Jamie's! Their brownies are absolutely to die for. I've had gnocchi here a few times and it's always very good. The less traditionally Italian meals are also enjoyable, I had a delicious and juicy burger here and the salads are well balanced with a protein and grain so they are filling.

Also, the kids meals are really nice, I appreciate that they are healthy and allow my son to try new things. His favourite so far is the fish stew (salmon, peas, and gnocchi). I always enjoy eating his leftovers. 

The only reason I am giving 4 stars instead of 5 is because the portions are too small. The pasta size is good, but whenever I get something else the sides are tiny. Jamie, would it break the bank to give me more coleslaw?

Good price good service and the food was good. I totally wasn't expecting it to be so good. I only went there because Moxie's was full. Now I'll probably just go to Jamie's from now on. It's right at the front of Yorkdale Mall and has a huge sign. I'm sure it will be more popular soon but for now it's a fun place to eat and drink and it won't take long to get a table even on a Friday night 🌃

My husband and I were really looking forward to trying this new restaurant and we are thrilled we did because we loved it! The food was fantastic, I had the silky carbonara which was subtle but nonetheless satisfying while my husband had the delicious Turkey Milanese. The food was just as we expected and the service was amazing! We had a waitress named Sarah who was awesome! She was attentive, funny and really knowledgable! We will definitely be going back soon!

I absolutely devoured and enjoyed the Turkey Milanese.  Our server Gene recommended it and he was very pleasant. It's a terrible shame that they are taking this dish off the menu this week or next. I crave it, it's a winner. I never order Turkey in a restaurant,  however I was very surprised at how rich and savoury it was. Cheers to the Chef! The Caesar salad was tasty with Pancetta bacon. I give it a 4 out of 5 stars because my friend order a medium steak and it came well done. Plus it was just Meh. The accompanying mushrooms were lovely though.
High temperature inside restaurant, sticky tables, overpriced with smaller portions. The food was very tasty, but too much wrong with service and environment. Won't recommend.

The culinary team uses high quality ingredients, locally sourced whenever possible, to create an eclectic menu offering something for all tastes. Jawny Bakers boasts a beautiful outdoor ravine patio, a central fireplace, a separate bar and lounge area, and ample free parking.

reviews.text: The staff were extremely wonderful. I came with a group of business associates on Saturday evening. We were greeted and seated right away. We never waited...
We came here for winterlicious, and loved the place for its warm decor (fireplace especially) and yummy food. The winterlicious menu desserts were not the...
Ordered the Jawny's burger. Not what I thought it would be. The lettuce was chewy, probably GMO. They had sweet pickles on it which was ok but I do prefer...

I had a terrible experience with poor customer service over a year ago. It's now in the past. The staff are superb now, and their food is excellent. 

Tried their wings. One pound with hot sauce, and one pound with sweet BBQ. The sweet BBQ is the star sauce! Wow!  The wings are served in sweet little bowls, topped with crispy fried onion chips. If that's what you can call them. They're delicious. The wings are so tiny, but you get plenty and you'll be pleased. 

The sweet potato fries are crispy and the perfect sharable. On a separate occasion I have tried the bruschetta. Also amazing! I feel like this place will continue to impress me, even though it's just a humble place in the neighborhood. I will definitely be back!

Great food, cozy atmosphere and good service. Nice variety of specials and wine. Have been coming here for 12 years, but items are getting smaller and pricier. With prices for steak similar to the Keg, complimentary bread was a nice feature but was taken away, as were the veggies with the steak. Will still definitely visit, but will consider other options as well, only because of the price point.

A little isolated but worth the visit. Great spot to bring the family. A varied menu with healthy and not so healthy options. Sweet staff and clean. I work near here so I have been often. It's always been good and the price point makes sense.

Great place to have a cider after work. 

Patio rules in the summer. The corner off the ravine is a treat on a warm summer afternoon. No traffic noise & a little bit of nature in the city 

Food is great never had a bad meal yet. 

In the winter it’s nice to sit in the front room n watch the traffic go by over a burger n cider. I also been spotted at the bar on a Wednesday afternoon. 

Great staff, friendly & prompt service.

The restaurant name kind of fooled me because I accidentally ready “Bakery” and thought I would get some deserts.

We drove and parked, as we were walking towards it, the it became more clear that it was clearly a restaurant. We got back in our cars and went to somewhere for coffee. I would recommend the place though, looked pretty cool inside.

lic_profile: Jazz Bistro, located in the Yonge Dundas corridor, just steps from the Ed Mirvish Theatre, Massey Hall and the Elgin Winter Garden Theatre, is the perfect place to enjoy a pre-theatre meal or dinner, followed by an evening of live music. Jazz takes centre stage from 9 p.m. but early diners will enjoy music from the great American songbook played by resident pianist Robert Scott. The seasonal menu composed of fresh, locally sourced ingredients can be enjoyed in the main floor dining room or top floor patio.

reviews.text: The young blonde hostess at the front was a bit snooty + rude. Please leave this passive-aggressive attitude in 2017 where it belongs. A pretty face can...
I'm giving Jazz Bistro 2 stars for the good music and service.  The food is mediocre to put it nicely, though the prices are decent and the portion sizes...
I took my 13 year old niece for dinner during summerlicious. I had the vegan soup which was fresh and tasty and my niece had the kale salad, which she said...

Chill atmosphere, nice lighting with friendly staff. Went to celebrate anniversary with my wife and being our first time there we had an enjoyable experience. Food was really flavourful and music was great. I would recommend you give it a try.

Awesome decor and vibe. Won't be disappointed esp if pick out a performance of interest - really good sound. Food price/quality ratio not that good. Drinks not cheap either but understandable given the great entertainment.  Might be best served to order simple menu items, or just drinks and an app. Excellent spot if like jazz or for pre/post theatre drink.

Truely great service.  We ran a bit late and needed to make a 730 show. The host, our server, and even the bar staff were so kind in helping us enoy great food, wonderful atmosphere, and incredible music.  Our meals were so fresh tasting and light that we left sated and very happy.  Thank you all so very much for a great start to the evening.

Went to see Pavlo play Saturday night. Great venue for an intimate show and highly recommend going. The service from our waiter was wonderful and he was very attentive to our needs. I was upset though when it came down to the dinner service. The kitchen had run out of the chicken dish due to high popularity so we settled for the beef. The beef looked equally as amazing and the popover on other guests plates made the dish look even more appealing. Where I became upset is that our beef dishes came to our table without the popover. I would of settled for the risotto if we were made aware that no popover was included. I was also offended that the runner dropped the dish off in front of us as to think we would not notice that we were given two measly chunks of bread it's place. Overall it was good night. But a let down from a Communication standpoint. Our bill ended at almost 300$ for four people. Not sure if I would recommend dinner at this venue again. I never made it a big deal to our waiter knowing we more than Likely would only come to see another show of interest. PS for Pavlo fans. This venue is a phenomenal setting to experience his music locally.
Such a unique experience. Great food and great performances. Would definitely recommend.

lic_profile: Jump combines classic style with sleek modern eclecticism.  The sky high glass atrium, dramatic lighting elements and signature New York style bar provide the perfect backdrop for the world - inspired cuisine.  Offering food that is robust, honest and full of flavour, Jump is renowned for the classics and continually creates fresh, innovative dishes incorporating locally sourced beef, handmade pastas and seasonal vegetables.  Featuring over 60 types of whisky, bourbon and scotch, as well as 10 whisky and bourbon - infused cocktails, the Jump bar buzzes with warmth and excitement.

reviews.text:
Jump truly made my tastebuds jump!

Came here for Valentine's Day but ordered off the regular menu. We started off with the Yellowfin Tuna Tartare, which...

Another Oliver and Bonacini restaurant...what's new?

I came here with a large group for a birthday celebration last Friday night. The receptionist was very...

Went here for dinner during Winterliscious with a reservation.
We were seated promptly after the hostess took some time to find my reservation.
The service...

Came here for a business lunch.  Very nice atmosphere and the food was fantastic.  I had the tomato-fennel-chickpea soup and the salmon.  It was very good.  Our server was very attentive and prompt.  Overall very nice restaurant....I will be back!

My rating is based on what I ordered Alfredo with chicken, mushrooms and fries on the side.
Alfredo wasn’t that great, chicken tasted like it was cooked night before, mushrooms were ok overall 2 stars. 
But 5 stars for the fries as it was one of the best I had, very crispy and fresh.
Will I comeback to this place? No but I definitely recommend for once.

Over-rated.  I've eaten here a few times in my life, always related to work, and I find the restaurant looks great and has good service, but the food is unmemorable.  Truth be told, when I visited a few weeks ago, I thought I was going the first time ever, but as soon as I arrived, my memory unblocked the earlier unremarkable visits.  This time too, I had a chicken mushroom pasta dish that was nothing special.  The fungi had an amazing pungent taste to them, but the cream sauce and chicken were both ridiculously bland.
The food and service is amazing. The location is pretty awesome to . My server was Jonas the guy went above and beyond for our table. My family could not have had a better time. Thanks jump

We were both disappointed with the portion size of the Cobb Salad, taste (dressing was very bland), lack of cheese which was advertised and was none existent in one salad and the salmon which was not cooked.  On a positive note, when we pointed this out to them, they removed the price of one salad. Jump needs to "step it up"!

This cozy spot in the heart of Little Italy embodies that sense of romance with its decor and flavourful dishes. Sparkling chandeliers, large, gilded mirrors, and intimate tables have been part of why Kalendar has been continually voted as the best place for a first date and the  most romantic restaurant in Toronto. Kalendar offers a wide variety of cravable dishes and eclectic, international comfort food.

reviews.text: Have been working in the area and decided to meet up with two girlfriend post-work for cocktails and eats. Have always walked by here but never thought to...

Came here for brunch with a group of people.

They accommodate groups well and the staff are attentive. The environment is nice.

The Napoleon is good. It's...

Rude management/service!!!!!!!
Can't believe how they treat customers. 

Food was really mediocre. Not really sure what style of food the restaurant is...

We received terrible customer service from an employee of yours named Andre and then from your manager Ansley. 

My boyfriend and friend had lunch in the restaurant, as I am home sick, he ordered me a salad to go, specifying no dairy as it is an allergy. Upon bringing the salad home it looked like there were sesame seeds on it (which I am unfortunately allergic to too) so to be safe we called your restaurant to see. When Andre returned to the phone he let us know there were not sesame seeds but there was butter. 

We asked if we could return it in exchange for something else and Andre's response was 'Its not really our fault so no'. If someone is allergic to an item and you put that item on the dish, it is 100% your fault and responsibility. 

I called back to speak to the manager, thinking as a manager this person would have better customer service skills. After cutting me off multiple times and not apologizing once Ansley told me 'to not take things so seriously'. I take my health seriously, and it is your responsibility as a restaurant to make sure your patrons are in a healthy environment as well. 

As customers that have been eating at your restaurant for 8 years, we will never be coming back. 

I hope this issue is addressed because that sort of lackadaisical service is how someone can get hurt.
Nice brunch menu. Their scrolls are really tasty and filling. Girlfriend and I split one just to try them out, ended up ordering another although we were quite full.

Really good food. Their salads are very filling and tasty. They don’t cheap out on potions. The pizza and scrolls are great too! 

Great spot for casual meals or date nights! They make decent drinks too.
Food and service was decent. They include the tip on your bill which I find rude. I would have tipped higher than the amount entered so their loss.

This is a cozy place with an interesting atmosphere. The prices are reasonable, we had the muscles in curry sauce and the seafood pasta. Both where awesome.
The French onion soup was good, but wasn't as hot as I wanted it to be.

The food was very delicious! The portions were big and tasty. Our server Jamshid Mishka was super nice and made this experience even better! This restaurant is highly recommended!
Amazing fish curry the staff is really helpful hard on your pocket but the food is worth it

We were walking by this place with the intention of going somewhere completely different for dinner but changed our minds when we walked by and smelt the deliciousness!! I'm glad we did. Our server, Mishkant, had great recommendations and was so attentive to us. He was very personable and make the experience event better. Next time I'll be back to take him up on his other recommendations!

The food is divine!  The service is outstanding, professional and friendly.  You can see and taste the quality of the food.  This is the best Indian food I have ever had and highly recommend it everyone.

Terrific food & service! On this visit, eggplant bharta was more tomatoey (than smoky, as usual) but no worries, I will return and try again! We are lucky to have a great restaurant like Kamasutra in the neighbourhood!

reviews.text: We made reservations for 8:30 for 4 people but ended up as a group of 7. The restaurant was very accommodating. We were a little cold due to Canadian weather, the staff moved us to a warmer table and provided us blankets as well as a portable charger for our phones. The food was amazing, staff was very friendly, and the music was great! will definitely go back!

Amanda is the only reason this rating is missing a star. Thanks so much for such delicious dishes: tuna & crispy rice & shrimp tempura Maki roll tasted phenomenal and I would highly recommend it to anyone who doesn't know what to get on the menu. The Ambiance along with the view by the open windows is my favorite seating. I'd also like to shout out Isaac for providing amazing service along with his Pleasant personality. If only he had served us tonight I would have given this rating a total 5 star. Management needs to look closer at some of their servers who aren't performing as they should be...

We came here for our wedding reception and are extremely happy with how it turned out! Staff was exceptional and gave great recommendations. We had a variety of food including vegan options which were all delicious. Definitely check this place out! (Also the patio is gorgeous)

My husband and I booked Kasa Moto for dinner after our wedding. We found they were very accommodating with our budget and dietary restrictions. Service was excellent, staff members were friendly and prompt, and the food was amazing! We had such a great time and would book them again. 12/10 would recommend!

I’m giving my experience at Kasa Moto a 2 star rating only because I actually liked most of the dishes. My girlfriend planned a special get together for my 30th birthday which was horribly executed. She left multiple notes with clear instructions that the staff did not execute what so ever. 

Firstly, when me and my girlfriend walked in we were greeted and told “the rest of your party is waiting” which automatically ruined the surprise. I acted oblivious for my girlfriends sake but it didn’t do much. 

Secondly my girlfriend made two notes on her reservation for a private/intimate location. I’m guessing right by the stairs and waiter stations are considered cozy? Maybe I’m not up to the trends. 

Lastly, the waiter decided to open up my surprise cake right into front of my plain view and proceeded to place the cake in the table without any platter!? Another server (thank you) came by and asked why the cake was on the table and brought us a plate. 

What makes this kind of comical is that there was a receipt attached the the takeaway bag with two lengthy requests that were clearly ignored.
My wife and went here for mother's day and I can't say anything bad.  Our food was amazing (cauliflower, crispy tofu, soba noodle, and black cod) I would...

Guests are greeted by a chic ambiance that complements KOB’s savoury, fusion-influenced plates. The entertaining atmosphere of the dining room, bar, and patio fosters both formal and informal gatherings with the help of a friendly and memorable team.

We ordered their Valentine's set menu and was pleasantly surprised by the quality of food. Service...

super service and great food

I had 5 days of breakfast at this place and it's amazing, I actually met a Vietnamese chef and I am also Vietnamese too, it was really nice to see someone come from same country as me and he was really nice and friendly and extremely helpful. Raj, a waiter at this restaurant was also really nice, friendly, and helpful. Raj, the chef, and the atmosphere and also the food brought me the best experience at the restaurant. I don’t know if it’s because the dinner we had was a Groupon deal or it was supposed to be like that, my bf and I were very disappointed. As you can see the soup was sitting in the kitchen too long, so it had a layer of “skin” when they served it to us. Presentation: 1/5. Beets were burned, they were completely black. I couldn’t tell it was a beet... and speed of service was very slow. We waited for 45 minuets to get our starters. And it was not busy at all. After starters, we had to wait another 45 minutes to get our steak and trout. Fish was dry and over cooked. Steak was excellent! 8/10. 

Staff was standing right between two tables and giving me a butt when he was talking to another table.... 🤦🏻‍♀️ 

For those who need to park, make sure you park under tiff, it s only $7 after 5pm on weekdays.

reviews.text: Amazing place! I absolutely love this place! The environment is extremely cozy and perfect for a night out! The food is delicious and of course the drinks were amazing! I highly recommend King Taps if you are visiting for your first time or even if your a regular! The staff is extremely efficient, helpful and friendly and of course the restaurant is very clean. I personally have had only amazing experiences to share at King Taps and would highly recommend you to go there too!

Was really looking forward to visiting King Taps as my partner has frequented a few times for work and said great things.  Beautiful spot, great patio, food and wine list were average. We had a lovely evening with friends until the end when we were overcharged on our bill for items we did not order  then it took the management over a half hour to attempt to resolve. We said we had to leave as we were meeting friends and only then did our correct bill emerge without any real apology other than a business card from the manager saying to call directly to make a reservation at any time.  Not exactly a stellar example of good customer service. Difficult to use the offered compensation gesture when we will never be returning considering  how this situation was handled. I work in customer service and know that this was very poorly handled.  Sorry King Taps, there are many great restaurants in Toronto that will be getting our business in the future. We tried to give you ours but epic fail!

I ordered the forager pizza which is a mushroom pizza and it was amazing. Their red wine sangria was also quite good. For dessert I got the pretzel brownie, it was really good but heavy after eating an entire pizza but no regrets. My friend ordered the chicken tacos and a frozen margarita and was happy with her order! 4 stars because we had to wait at the bar for an hour to get a table, but I guess that is expected on a Friday night.

Everyone said the food is good here. Maybe I ordered the wrong thing; don't get me wrong it was fine but typical. Staff was friendly but nothing out-of-the-ordinary. Setting was casual but nothing stood out. I really can't find anything wrong with the place but also I can't see anything special. I'll probably forget about it in a few days.

Love reserving a spot here for lunch. It is always good service and good wine. The waitress staff should ask if guests want bottled water versus tap though, some of my colleagues didnt really appreciate her opening a bottle of water and charging them for it without asking first. That was literally the only issue. Always love getting the Market Salad with Grilled Chicken!

Really like this place. It's a Cactus Club spin off (same owners) and done pretty right. Food quality and execution is about the same as a Cactus.

I've...
While visiting Toronto, we had an awesome time at King Taps. So much so that we wanted to come back for the second time. Have you ever visited a city and...
We have been meaning to try out this spot for some time now and so finally made the reservations and decided to check it out last night. I would give this...

A mellow Retsina or fragrant Moschofilero complement the Greek dishes.  A modern and inviting space featuring both a waterfall and fireplace, Krystos is suited for casual and family dining.

reviews.text:
Nice casual place with friendly staff. I had lentil soup which was simple, lemony, and hit the spot.
Then I had the spanakopita which was simple and tasty...

Went here for lunch on a weekend and really enjoyed it! 

Staff was very friendly and attentive and the restaurant was not too noisy and was able to...

The grilled calamari was not very good value. Portion was small for price and not done very well. The calamari wasn't that fresh.

The chicken souvlaki...

One the best places to eat. The food is so fresh - you can taste the difference. They do not precook or use frozen food. They have fresh food coming in. The olive oil is flown in from sparta. Their salad dressing is their own unique creation and you can even buy it. The price is great and the so is the service. They even celebrate birthdays and small events - lots of parking and wheelchair accessible. Great neighborhood and the owners are usually in and are very kind and personable. Absolutely love the food - something for the family, or a work gathering or even a romantic date night. Krystos has it all!!!
Came in for lunch today for the first time and had a great experience. The food was fresh and delicious, and the staff was lovely. I highly recommend trying their house hot sauce with your meat!

Went to Krystos for the first time & absolutely LOVED it!! The chicken souvlaki dinner was delicious....the chicken tasted great, rice & potatoes were very tasty & the salad was fresh with the most delicious dressing. Loved the decor of the restaurant, especially the pictures of Santorini. Service was great & waitresses were very friendly. Would recommend this restaurant for anyone who loves Greek food & is looking for a good place to eat!

I went to this place with my girlfriend and it honestly let us down. We ordered calamari which was 4 super salty small pieces for $16! The main entre was a small portion of food which tasted like something from the frozen section of a supermarket that they just popped into a microwave for an insanely expensive price. Not happy at all.

I love the food here! Always yummy and cooked fresh to order. The salad dressing is really good and all the meats I’ve had are always cooked to perfection. Every time we’ve been here the food does take some time to come out. But I guess that’s the downside of eating fresh and made to order; I don’t mind...

reviews.text: La Fenice is one of Toronto's classic Italian restaurants.  The owners and staff are really first grade, as is the atmosphere.  If you get to know the...
Really nice room, excellent service and superbly prepared food.  Likely the best Italian restaurant we have visited since Florence Italy.  A wonderful...

I visited La Fenice a few weeks back for their Summerlicious promotion, we were a group of 4 people
As we walked through the door we were greeted in a...
Food was amazing. Service was excellent. Absolutely delicious. Worth coming back.

There is a reason this place is empty on a Saturday night when the theater crowd arrives and everywhere else is packed with an hour wait.  The food is poor quality and just boring, it’s really hard to make Italian food be so bad.
My wife and I were so mad that we didn’t just grab a hot dog from the street vendor out front and save the $150.  
In a place with such dated interior you expect kitschy but great food, unfortunately this place doesn’t deliver.  
My PSA for the day, if you’re going to a show please make reservations somewhere good vs ending up in this overflow catch-all!!!
Great service, but just ok food.

This place really makes me smile and will be our new local, our waiter was not only helpful but had a great way at telling funny stories in enough time for him to serve his next table and also leave us laughing, my partner and I have travelled the world eating in nice places from top celebritie places to small cosy places and I must say we love to get a waiter that nos their stuff, our waiter was polite and very confident on his wine chose to pair with our lobster which was a bonus, I study wine and I no the red he chose was not your usual seafood pairing, but ow right he was in his opinion we loved the wine so much we have ordered our very own for our house 😂 Thank you to the chef who is excellent at his job. This place is worth a romantic meal or a fun waiter or simply a trip just for nice food, they. Have it all!! ❤️
I really enjoyed the winterlicilous lunch special that was served. The salmon was really well done.

reviews.text: I have walked past the restaurant several times, but finally went in with my wife and kids. So glad we did. The food was amazing, combined with top notch service made going here an unbelievable experience. They offer great portion sizes with reasonable pricing. What a little hidden gem! We will definitely be back.

I've eaten there several times the food is consistently very good and the prices moderate. The atmosphere is is just right, intimate and alive.

 The last time, service was a little slow because an employee failed to show for the night shift. The two guys there worked their butts off to keep up on a busy Saturday night.
That was great! Food was awesome. All workers of the place great. Nice oficiant, looks like a Jack Swarrow.😃🤩😉😊😎

I made a reservation for New Year's Eve online, and put a copy of the confirmation and the restaurant menu under the tree as a Christmas present for my mother. On Christmas day, we studied the menu, made our choices, and began looking forward to them. On New Year's Eve we arrived at the restaurant and were given a printed sheet with a limited prix fixe menu that did not appear online at the time of my reservation. It included dessert and alcohol, neither of which we were interested in consuming. We were advised that the pricy prix fixe menu was required. This was a terrible disappointment for the two of us, particularly at a point when it was too late to find another restaurant for the occasion. At the time of my reservation, I read the other reviews and was looking forward to receiving friendly, personal service. Our experience was the exact opposite.
Great food & service and super dog friendly

reviews.text: I don't understand anyone who gives this place a bad review. I have been multiple times and love it. The service is great, the restaurant itself is...
Love their patio on the second level, which overlooks the boutiques on Bloor street! The service was friendly, and the restaurant had polished bistro decor....
I always wanted to try this place and finally did for winterlicous 2018. Hands down the worst restaurant I tried during the event.  The atmosphere inside...

Absolute Disaster .... epic fail.   We have been several times in the past, and always enjoyed it.  Great room. Lovely presentation.  But - as other reviews confirm - it appears there has been a change of direction at the Toronto site and it is not for the better.  In short, it was awful. Service was slow to nonexistent.  We watched 3 waiters cash out for 20 minutes at the bar standing next to cocktails long since ordered for our table.  At one point, we were actually bussing the table to remove dishes. Empty plates, glasses and wine bottles went unanswered.  Then the main courses arrived, where 5 of us, after the first bite, paused and stopped, wondering if it was just me? Or could something be this bad.  Then the awkward moment when someone speaks out loud what we were all thinking.... 5 of the 8 mains were insanely salted.  Steaks were over cooked.  First time in my life I've had a plate that was literally uneatable.  The manager somehow walked off while in mid discussion about the issue.  Four of us ordered something else, which - incredibly - was just as over salted and cold.   It was pure comedy.  They still managed to stick us with $1000 + tab, while the stooge manager did nothing, eager to close.  Aside of all this, like other reviews have said, it seemed the portions were small, plating was indifferent, execution was lazy and prices, even for Toronto, excessive.  We've call the GM and outlined this nonsense.... we will keep you posted on the results.
Absolutely loved this place! The service was incredible as was the food. I highly recommend and cannot wait to go back! It’s great for a small or large group.

Went for our one year wedding anniversary - had an excellent time from start to finish. Food was outstanding, everything we ordered was flavourful, fresh and delicious. Service was impeccable with knowledgeable, friendly and attentive staff. Felt very special for our very special night!
The place looks fancy and chic. Services are pretty cool. Food is just fine. Very light and normal, nothing exciting, but price for brunch is quite acceptable that’s why I gave 4 stars.

Fantastic place!

My wife and I organized a get together of about 20 people for buck a shuck oysters and champagne. Everything was excellent right down to the service and the staff. We will definitely be going back.

lic_profile: Located in the heart of downtown, lbs Restaurant's mission is to deliver sustainably sourced seafood in an upmarket atmosphere, striving to create an unparalleled dining experience. Chef Jonathan Williams sources the best possible ingredients from local suppliers, combining them with innovative techniques, to create refined yet approachable dishes with balanced flavours.

reviews.text: We were in town for 3 nights staying very near lbs.  I had not planned on going there but our hotel's concierge (The Adelaide) recommended it and boy were...

Came here a couple times for lunch, for both their regular and winterlicious menus. 

Signature Lobster roll: it wasn't bad, but I thought it was a bit oily...
Whoa. I stopped here on the way home from a client visit and was wary based on some of low star reviews. First things first, ignore those reviews because...

First time trying this restaurant and I highly recommend trying it, you won’t be disappointed! Great atmosphere and the staff are very knowledgeable and helpful. Highly recommended to all my friends and family. Great selection of wine! We shared a few different types of the whole fish as well as the oysters and they were all delicious. Great job chef! No complaints here! Will be back soon for sure

Seafood was fresh and oyster selection was great. Prices are quite steep and the rest of the mains were okay but nothing to rave about. That said they were still quite new at the time. Management was nice and the ambiance is very nice. Wouldn’t rave about it, but definitely a great place to enjoy seafood if you’re looking for seafood with an overall higher end experience.

Awful experience. I came here with a few girlfriends, where half of us did the Chef’s tasting menu and the other half ordered off the dinner menu. Those who ordered off the dinner menu waited about 2.5 hours for their food, while the chef’s tasting menu took almost 4 hours!! No customer should be made to wait that long for food, they were very unorganized with bringing out food for the two different menus at the same table (they told us after that they won’t mix menus at the same table again but that was irrelevant for our experience). Next, after waiting 2.5 hours for a dinner menu item, the pork came out almost raw in the middle - the manager came over to reassure my friend that he had it the other night and it was fine like that, didn’t even take a closer look as to how raw it was (maybe that’s why the lighting is so dim so you can’t see??), so we sent it back and the chef agreed it shouldn’t have been served that raw. Next, when we spoke to the manager about how long the food took to come out that those waiting 2.5 hours lost their appetite, he apologized and said that dessert is on them... they just said they weren’t even hungry anymore?! Lastly, two of us who did the chef’s tasting menu got sick. Never coming back here again!! 

I will note that our server was an absolute gem. She did all she could to try to make us happy and cater to her customers. It was by no means her fault what had happened it just sucks she had to deal with so many issues as well.
Fun great spot for seafood and more. The afterwork crowd is lively but it's never so packed that you can't get a seat the bar. They have a nice selection of wine and the staff are super friendly.
Great experience at the Lbs. restaurant. From great customer service to very delicious and exciting plates! Hats of to the chef. Hands down the best fish I have had in Toronto.

reviews.text:
The tasting menu, experience, atmosphere and food is very unique and delicious, best spot in Toronto for a business meeting, romantic intimate date or to go with friends after work or on the weekend, la Notre is one of those places where you feel like you are at your own elegant cozy home.

Sergei is a great host, their menu constantly changes with very creative dishes depending on what is in season, very well designed and portioned.

Awesome selection of wine, liquor and cocktails at the bar.

This is a hidden gem and got motivated to try it by different friends and clients that absolutely loved it.

Amazing food, comparable to the best restaurants in Toronto. We were served by the owner who had excellent recommendations without trying to upsell us on anything.

We sat at the bar, which wasn't the best experience, but the food and elservice were so good that I couldn't give the restaurant anything less than 5 stars. I will definitely be going back soon
Outstanding! Le Notre Bistro is our new favourite restaurant in Toronto. Everything from food, service, and atmosphere was top notch. I would highly recommend.
Wonderful food, exception service. Best meal we had on our trip to Toronto.
Good food but pricey and ridiculously small portions.

Le Notre is a perfect French spot for date night!

We loved this restaurant! The food was delicious, the ambiance was cozy and relaxed yet stylish and contemporary. The service from Neil was FANTASTIC!! We absolutely loved him. Thank you Neil for being so amazing and super sweet. We will be back.

Absolutely fabulous food and exceptional service.
Don't remember the names of what I ate lol. But the starter was Chicken liver, main was a nice veal and pork pie with delicious chutney and to top it all a Godiva Chocolate Cheese Cake, YUMMY!!!
The food was prepared well and the service was good. However, definitely too overpriced. The food was good but not good enough to be priced that high.
Authentic fine French cuisine. No loud music. Excellent dinner crepes. Only thing, the waiters weren't snooty. Actually quite friendly.

lic_profile: Praised as one of the "Ten Chefs of the Millennium" in 2000 by food & Wine magazine, Susur Lee is still at the top of his game.  Between helming three restaurants in Toronto - Lee, Bent & Luckee - and overseeing his prestigious TungLok Heen in Singapore, Chef Lee makes numerous television appearances and travels the globe as guest chef and consultant.  Balancing the epicurean traditions of China with the classical techniques of French cuisines, Chef Lee improvises a daring and original culinary aesthetic. Frequently appearing many of Toronto publication's "Best of" lists, Lee offers a menu inspired by the convergence of land and sea with seasonality in mind.  From the bar comes a sake driven wine list and fresh-to-order cocktails with handmade ingredients.

reviews.text: This is one of those restaurants my fiancée and I always reminisce about. We came here twice during a 3-day stay in Toronto and that isn't something we...
Wow it was a great place. I would definitely recommend to have a reservation at this place if you want to get a table. Good food even for vegetarians the...

This review is totally based off of a service mess up and not the food. The food is usually great every time I've eaten here. 
I called too book an...

Absolutely exquisite atmosphere, service, and food. The waiter was very knowledgeable as our group of 5 did not know exactly what we were getting into. 

The menu is offered à la carte but the waiter recommend a different option that allowed him to pick the items and bring them out one by one. We chose the $70/person option and it came with 7 courses that included desert. 

Every item brought out was amazing ranging on a scale of 1-10, all being 8+. Several of which I would give a 10. 

Just an amazing experience. One of my top 3 best dining experiences ever.

What an experience! From the staff to the food, everything was just beautifully executed. Lee is one of the great ones that deserve a little more recognition than it currently receives. The Singapore slaw is a piece of artwork and the rest of the dishes on the menu really serve as a aperitif as you will be left in awe by the sheer complexity of that slaw.

Absolutely amazing service by every single employee at this restaurant, and their food tastes like the chefs actually want to be there. What a great way to run your business - I'm sure that the reason their food and staff are top notch is because the staff are treated amazingly and are selected based on their passion for the industry. My friends and I are going to be at Lee Restaurant occasionally until we try everything on their menu!

Many years of consistent flavours, the staples are the slaw, tuna two ways & black cod. (they had a Singapore Slaw pop up at the Brickworks market too. ) Friendly service from gorgeous waiters. Peanuts galore so those with allergies proceed carefully.

Great service and delicious food. Make a reservation in advance, even if it’s just the afternoon the day of - sometimes you get lucky! 

I am #blessed to live beside this restaurant but it’s not exactly an every day spot. Go here for a special occasion or if there’s something to celebrate! One of the better places in the neighbourhood for a fancy dinner that’s actually worth the $ (not that I’ve ever been the one putting down the 💳 here 😉). Yes, get the Singapore slaw, you will have a really hard time recreating that dish at home!

lic_profile: A Chef Anthony Walsh creation, Leña pays homage to his Argentinian mother-in-law, Elena, from whom he has drawn great culinary inspiration, and embodies what he experiences in her kitchen – a passionate food philosophy that brings people together. Imaginative yet rooted in tradition, Leña’s cuisine showcases the vibrant essence of South American cooking, with unique Spanish and Italian influences. It, along with the stylish design, warm character and lively tunes, promotes a “live to eat” ethos and fosters a convivial spirit at the table. Above all, Leña celebrates authentic, flavourful food and drink, enjoyed amongst old and new friends.

reviews.text: I came here for lunch with a few co-workers and I was blown away by how fancy the place looked. Do we even belong here? Although it was during the busy...
Service is pretty good and attentive, ready with menu details and recommendations if you're looking for it.  Had the grilled shrimp that came with a side of...
Came here in the evening on Friday night. The atmosphere is really unique and seems good for groups! The bar is in the centre when you walk in and there's...

Came for winterlicious and the food and service were honestly just okay. Nothing that spectacular and worth another visit. While their decor and tiled flooring is pretty, their seating is quite odd, and I ended up on a half-couch, in which I couldn't really see the person I was eating with. Service was a quite abysmal and slow, as we sat with dirty dessert dishes for 15 minutes before getting the bill. The food was well-done with solid ingredients, came out warm, and properly seasoned, but not worth a regular visit in my opinion. It is on the louder end, so while its quite pricey, it is also a somewhat casual atmosphere, likely not the best for formal old-school business meals.

A building lobby turned into a restaurant with **Lovely ambience**. Very limited vegetarian options if you are a vegetarian. Not sure about vegan options but almost everything has cheese in it. A little pricey but justified for its location and ambience. A full course meal for two should be around CAD 70-80. Again, go for the ambience. It's beautiful.

The food is excellent! The service was unfortunate. The young man who was our server was so intent on moving us out quickly it bordered on rude. It really spoiled our dinner. Even giving instructions many times not to take plates, drinks whatever, away yet as we weren't finished he didn't seem to care. We did go for the first sitting but the table beside us with a different server wasn't bothered by their waiter at all they were able to enjoy their dinner at their leisure. So it was quite obvious for us that we were being seriously rushed. Really too bad because the food is worth taking your time.

Fantastic food and service. We came here for a post graduation dinner and enjoyed everything about this place. The best meal was the rabbit, but the seafood pasta was great too. Appreciated the selection of interesting and tasty mocktails!

Only came for coffee so can't comment on much. However, the coffee is great and the atmosphere is so nice. Very fancy and has spacious private bathrooms which is always a plus. Good music levels and attentive service.
Some of the seats have low backs which can be annoying. Suppose it forces good posture though!

lic_profile: A modern-day brewpub, Liberty Commons marries fine comfort food and craft brews in Liberty Village. Serving lunch, dinner, late night bites and weekend brunch, it offers classic pub fare, Southern-inspired BBQ, and fresh light bites, paired with craft beers by Big Rock Brewery. Located on the lower level of a heritage building, Liberty Commons features a contemporary bar and dining space that buzzes with excitement on game days, and offers the perfect spot to relax for a post-work pint.

reviews.text: This place is awesome!  The food was great and the atmosphere was lively!  The perfect spot to watch a playoff game with a large group of people.  We ordered a bunch of apps and mains, everything tasted great!  I hosted my wife's birthday at this restaurant and the service was excellent.  I would definitely go back and would recommend this place to anyone looking for place to go too.

My Fiancee and I have been to this location twice now. Both times we were after their pancakes.

We were eating in the downstairs area of the business, which has a good deal of space and a nice sports bar atmosphere, without being overly loud which tends to be the case at a lot of sports bar locations here in town.

Service was prompt and reliable. The second time we had a trainee who did fine, no issues.

The food itself was good! The pancakes the first time were extremely fluffy and tasted delicious. We did run into a problem on the second visit where a small amount of baking soda was still in the pancake, but the servers immediately replaced them and comped us the pancakes as an apology.

We will be visiting again!

The beers good. The foods good. The staff were very friendly and accommodating. It's a little dark inside but that all adds to the ambiance of the place. Plus they have many personal washrooms. So you get your privacy and wont have to wait for the guy ahead of you. All in all great experience I would go back 100%

Had brunch there this morning. We had a reservation, but still had to wait for our table. No apology from the staff. Waited an hour and a half for our food after ordering. Again no apology or indication that the wait staff cared. 

3 of our party had to leave before food arrived because nobody planned on it taking 3 hours to get some pancakes...

Toronto has soooo many great restaurants. This is not one of those.

Okay this place may look like your average “brewery/pub”, but it’s much more delicious AND their chairs are uber comfy. 

I had their Beer Can Chicken Noodle Soup. I don’t think I’ll ever have anything but that at this restaurant. It was very cool (presentation wise) and also VERY delicious. The staff was patient and friendly. Oh, and every week they release a series of weekly beers that are terry unique and we’re pretty tasty. 

So, his neighbourhood isn’t full
of a tone of choices, but this place was legit.
My family and I were in town to attend the Toronto FC 2 game, facing FC Cincinnati. We found this place while doing an internet search for nearby...

I'm not a beer drinker but I am a bruncher with friends who drink beer so this was a nice compromise. 

It's a steady spot for brunch on a Saturday. Slow at...

Checked out this place recently for brunch and beer tasting. 

Definitely seems like a hidden gem. It was busy, but no lines - the dream for brunch in...

lic_profile: Lisa Marie is the brick and mortar restaurant for the Fidel Gastro's Food Truck located in the heart of the Fashion District. With a vibrant energy and a constantly evolving menu, this restaurant fully embodies its West Queen West roots and its street food heart and soul.

reviews.text: My friends and I went here for brunch and the place was really live. We were seated at the back and the table was big enough to accommodate for 10 of...
It's been a few years since I last dine here so I was looking forward to coming back here for some pad Thai fries.  One thing I didn't remember about this...
Came here for brunch with some friends a while ago. This place gets pretty busy for brunch, so try to make a reservation or come first thing when the...

I think it's great that the restaurant takes reservations for brunch (no line ups!) We were seated at the bar. The only issue is that there is no AC in there, so you could see everyone sweating buckets. The bartender's back was completely drenched, and my friend and I were melting in our seats! Kinda lost my appetite, and the heat made it difficult to heat. I'm sure the food is great though!

Went for brunch with my friend. We both ordered the chicken and waffle. It was absolutely delicious! I would go back any day to this place! The pad Thai fries were so good too! I like the ambiance too. It does get busy so make sure to make a reservation!

Nothing but great things to say.  The atmosphere is great for sharing a meal and drinks with friends and not needing to shout across the table.  Food is so creative and good.  

You must try the Thai fries.   So so good. Never would have thought.   

On the pricy side for the portion size. But not enough to ruin the experience.

Hands down one of my favorite brunch spots with consistent food and service. I would describe Lisa Marie as a grown up, modern diner. The food is always amazing - modern spin on great classic comfort foods.

It's a diner - it's a little loud; it's casual and lay back with shared seating. There's enough space to eat but also to rub elbows; ogle other people's food and chat with your table buddies. Easy and great food.

Went for my birthday party Saturday night and loved the eclectic menu items.. we all tried a bunch of them and loved them. Great hidden gem, glad a friend recommended it to me! So many guests complimented the delicious food! 
I read all of the reviews before deciding on it... a lot of low star ratings because of the washrooms but the staff kept on going downstairs to clean them often and it wasn’t as bad as people said. I’d go back for all of those apps again for sure!

Whether it's a romantic dinner for two or a function for up to 120 people, you can discover for yourself what Portugal has to offer from its centuries old culinary art. Lisbon by Night offers live entertainment on weekends.

reviews.text:
This place was simply amazing!  I can't find other words aside from that.  The food, service,  ambience.. Everything was above and beyond... 

Thank you so...
On our girls night out, we decided to try Portuguese food during Winterlicious. It is in an old building with a lovely chandelier hanging on the top floor...

WHAT TO TRY?!?

Winterlicious is over but if summerlicious comes back around, order the calamari if it's on the menu! The seafood rice is definitely a hit...

The music sounded professional and smooth, a little loud for the size of the dining space. The service was pleasant. The entrance to the restaurant being up so many flights of stairs could put off those with limited mobility. As for food, while my dining companions professed to like theirs, my grouper was dry and rubbery, unlike any grouper I’ve ever had. The worst part was how salty it was. To make matters worse, there were crunchy grains of salt on top of it.  The asparagus was limp and the potatoes were again over-salted. I would not recommend it. I had an epic thirst for the next 24 hours.

For seafood lovers, Lisbon is great place try. Generous portion of very delicious seafood was served on our visit. 5 of us could not finished 3 servings! Inside deco and table setting were clean and comfortable. Staffs were excellent, very professional, and served with great smile. Had to do street parking. Highly recommend for family dinner.

This place is an hidden gem. It is located on the second floor with windows with a lovely view of Toronto. Service is great, food is excellent and there's great entertainment. On the night that we went, there was live music and it was really good. Not on the menu, but you can have an all-you-can-eat seafood option for only $30!! Best deal ever. It includes a fish soup, few variety of grilled fishes, calamari, shrimps and grilled pineapple. So worth it! Highly recommended!

Staff was extremely friendly. Great live music. I strongly recommend the "all you can eat fish" option . I would definetely return to this establishment. Make sure you're hungry because the portions are huge !

I went there with my wife for dinner. This is really nice place for romantic dinner with live music. Sea food was delicious with large portion size, specially Shrimp. Nice and friendly staff.  The restaurant is on second floor of an old building, so it is little bit difficult to locate.

The bright, sophisticated room and warm, friendly service round out a dining experience for all to enjoy.

reviews.text: Great ambience to this restaurant. The servers were very lovely as well. Keep in mind this could be pricy if you are a three course meal type of person. We...
Came here for dinner with some friends one night, it was surprisingly empty when we got there and it was only around 7:30pm, granted it was on a weekday,...
Little Anthony's is an italian restaurant in the heart of downtown Toronto. The restaurant comes off as fairly upscale, with nice lighting, a fancy...

Great for a lunch, a dinner or a business meeting! 

Great service - always friendly.
Good food. The menu doesn’t have a lot of options, but they are good.

What I love the most about this place that it is quite. It is so rare in Toronto that you can find a place where you talk, not scream to each other.

A nice place, a bit more upscale than I was expecting. Probably a great place for discussing business or having a celebration. The food was pretty good, but my portion was smaller than I expected, and I thought they could have had a better pasta selection. 
Dessert was nothing special.
Food and service was good. Fair price. Portions are not too big nor too small. Good to meet friends / co workers as its not too noise.

Very nice little restaurant. Food was excellent! Service was top notch in a relaxing atmosphere. It's definitely some fine dining. Prices are on the higher side. An appetizer, two pasta dishes and some wine was about $100 (plus tip). Would recommend!

Very flavorful food preparation with a nice, but small, wine selection. Traveling alone I appreciated the nice wine by the glass selection. Staff was extremely nice and always making sure I was taken care of through the dining experience. It is always hard to judge/grade Italian restaurants since everyone has their own preferences on flavor of sauces. I felt they provided a Good flavorful selection for my tastes. I will come here again
