reviews.text: Stuffy, old and dated with archaic lunch menu. Slightly better menu for dinner. Great for a quiet private business meeting. Tea room remains as good as ever.

Vegan review 

Ambience 5/5

Beautiful traditional design. Up beat jazz/blues music

Service 5/5
Ben was our server. Very catering and friendly.

Food 3/5
Appetizer - tomato based soup- 4/5

Main - tempeh steak - 2/5 great flavorful veggies, dry distasteful tempeh steak, painful to eat.. 😅 

Dessert - hot brownie 4/5.

Servings are small like all upscale restaurants

Super slow service that took 2.5 hours. Waiter was subtly rude with eavesdropping on our conversations and making odd remarks. The entree food was good (Although it took forever), atmosphere was absolutely dead. I did not overall enjoy my experience here. Would I return? No. And skip the dessert...its just awful.
Brutal experience. Dead atmosphere, slow service (1.5 hours for breakfast), high prices and average food (if that). Disappointing waste of time.

The food tasted really good, but the man that helps deliver food and clear the plates (not the waiter himself) was rather rude. I had the scallops as a starter and the chicken piccata as my main--both were delicious and had the right blend of flavors. Even the ice cream here tasted great (very rich). Our waiter was extremely friendly, and was very attentive to our table. Overall, great place to eat with a group (we were 6).
Was here for Winterlicious 2017 and only slightly regret dropping $50+ on dinner since the place was so classy and romantic and the food was so good, from...

reviews.text: Very good spot. Highlights include very well executed menu, friendly and efficient service in a cozy wrapper. Ownership may be getting a bit ahead  of itself (big heads?) With prices edging up here to two star Michelin levels - if you don't have a budget or value issues it's a great little spot.

On the advise from a business associate, we made reservations for dinner last week and it was worth it!  We were a party of 6 and if you need your space while dining then this might be a little too cozy for you.  The restaurant had the feel of dining in Europe and the atmosphere was lively and fun.  Our waitress helped us along the way throughout the entire meal and each plate was just what we expected.  Looking forward to our next visit!
Amazing spot in the city! The food and people are authentic, great wine, diverse selection of tasty menu items ,always the best time.
Great food with an intimate setting. Service is fantastic, and it's among the best pasta in the city.
Great atmosphere in a cozy environment. Food is delicious with generous portions. Arrive at your reservation slot but no earlier as every inch of the space is used so there is waiting area inside.
The food was bursting with flavour! The decor was very hip and neat, service was gracious and discret. But did I mention the food? Kudo to the chef!! The...

Truly a hidden Toronto gem! The best pasta i have EVER had by far. 

Food 5/5: I came here for Summerlicious but have no fear, they have a regular set menu...

lic_profile: Los Colibris offers authentic dishes by Chef Elia Herrera who has prepared her entire menu with family recipes from her hometown in Veracruz, Mexico.  Upscale dining in a formal yet comfortable atmosphere, with warm, hospitable and efficient service, Los Colibris strives to provide an exceptional dining experience.

reviews.text: Have been here 3 times and each visit was a great time. Food was very good. Value and quality were accurate. Don’t expect large size glasses of syrup margaritas, their cocktails are sophisticated potent and delicious. The service was excellent, the server suggested great food and wine choices for our group and just the right amount. He also found out we were there for an anniversary and gave us glasses of champagne to celebrate. It was a very nice touch we really appreciated it. Definitely recommend Los Colibris for any type of evening out—-friends, date night, special occasion, business, family etc. You won’t be disappointed.

Excellent restaurant. The food was amazing. Service was a tad slow ,but it was a busy saturday night with two big shows playing at theatres next to restaurant. Atmosphere was very nice staff was friendly and knowledgeable of menu.  Definitely will return.

Had the tortilla soup which was incredible! Also had the chicken paboino(?) Which was tasty but a bit too messy. Girlfriend has the braised octopus which was very tender. 

To finish off the night, we had the tres leches cake with a crisp pineapple slice, and it was very good. 

The service staff were attentive and helpful, and the environment was dim enough to be intimate but not so dim as not to see.
Interesting and unusual menus required our little group to be adventurous. It paid off and our meal was delicious. Pictured here is dessert.

One of the best upscale Mexican restaurants in Toronto. We went there for my birthday. All the staff were friendly and nice. Food were delicious and drinks were extremely tasty. 
At the end, when we ordered the dessert, they surprised me with birthday candle. 
Menu is a bit pricy but it worth it. 
Totally recommended...
I had a great dinner last night. After going for a long walk downtown i stopped at this place to grab dinner and it did not disappoint. I started with a...
Visited with my mom following seeing a musical down the street at the theatre. I had purchased a Mirvish package deal for her as a Christmas present which...
Another fantastic meal at this place! They now have vegan options....I had the guacamole and taro and corn chips. My son had the FREE TACOS that we got for...

lic_profile: Praised as one of the "Ten Chefs of the Millennium" in 2000 by Food & Wine magazine, Susur Lee is still at the top of his game.  Between helming three restaurants in Toronto - Lee, Bent & Luckee - and overseeing his prestigious TungLok Heen in Singapore, Chef Lee balances the epicurean traditions of China with the classical techniques of French cuisines. Luckee's Nouvelle Chinoise cuisine features classic dishes and dim sum from the culinary traditions of Guangzhou, Hunan, Shanghai and Szechuan regions, updated and enhanced by Chef Lee's delectable signature. Chinese food the way it was meant to be.

reviews.text: Great service and great food! I will say that for Dim Sum it is VERY expensive. Ambiance is ok, nothing that I would rave about. The drinks were delicious and the bar was very nice. I would say the best part of my experience here was our server. She was awesome, super helpful at explaining the menu and giving recommendations. If you are looking for fancy dim sum, this is your spot.
An interesting taste in Chinese food, if you're looking for traditional stuff it's not the place... but if you're looking for a modern take on Chinese dishes try it out.   Not inexpensive though...

The food was great, everything I had was delicious but the most outstanding feature of this restaurant is the excellent service. Rarely have I seen a restaurant where each employee put this much effort into their work and seemed like they enjoyed doing so. In sum very good food and great service!
Everything we ate was delicious .. we both especially loved the scallops entree. Our server was terrific. Thanks for a great dinner with great ambiance!

Every time you go to a celebrity chef’s restaurant for the first time, you’re hoping that the hype is worth it, and it isn’t an overpriced taste of some fusion type of food. Unfortunately, my experience at Luckee was definitely of the former; overpriced and completely average.
 
I and two others had the Dim Sum for four, which added to about $210 all in with tax and tip. With three people eating the portion size for four, we were still hungry at the end of the meal. While not objectively bad, the dim sum was completely average; in fact, I would argue that there are numerous places in Chinatown that have better dim sum. The fried rice was dry and lacked any real flavor. The offerings might be a creative take on traditional Chinese dim sum, but the dishes just don’t taste GOOD.
 
For the price, I feel like you’re paying more for the service and the environment as opposed to the food. Service is top-notch and very attentive, and the atmosphere is fancy without making you feel stuffy. However, it won’t make it for the thoroughly disappoint food. Maybe I, as a Chinese person growing up on my dad’s cooking (and the local family-run restaurant), just don’t understand the uniqueness of the dishes. I won’t be back in the future.
Luckee is my fav for Chinese. Ordering your first time can be difficult, but all of the servers are super helpful. They are also very careful and...

Love this place. Usually go here after comiccon or fan expos.

Mood is relaxed, calm and collected. Dim, but a good dim (ie you can see). Clean place,...
Luckee serves iconic Chinese foods served in perfect sizes inside the Soho hotel. I am a fan! Getting there from the downtown core might require a cab ride...

Chef Michael Wilson’s original, imaginative cooking is the perfect complement to Luma’s warm, inviting dining room, designed with rich woods, leather and stone.

reviews.text:
Amazing food. Great service

I always find myself coming back here. The food never disappoints and the owner and his staff are the friendliest you will find. 

The atmosphere is cozy and well put together. The last Saturday of each month he had dancers come into the restaurant with live music. A full roast pig and the best mojito in the city. 

I would recommend everyone comes by and gives this place a shot.

We went here for a date night. It was a pleasant experience after being able to sit down. We had reservation but seems like it was a little mixed up because there was a private party going on the same night. We had to wait outside that we almost left but they sorted things out and gave us a spot. The service was slow but maybe that's because the place was full but the owner and the servers were all really nice. Food was good and the mojito was great. Place was really lively with the music and the dancing going on.

Mambo is the BEST and most authentic Cuban restaurant/lounge in Toronto! Great vibe, with great live music and FANTASTIC food! I highly recommend Mambo to everyone looking for a great Latin/Cuban spot in Toronto. Customer service at Mambo is also amazing! Thanks to Andres (the owner).

A great place for celebrating an occasion or event! I had a yummy 3 course meal and an exciting vibe. The service was great, tables always getting checked for drinks and plates. They have a small live band playing to keep the Cuban vibe rocking. It is a small area and it can get busy and loud. I came here on their new years special, and the handed out party stuff to celebrate I thought that was pretty fun.
The Cuban Sandwich is a hit! So tasty. The beer is cold (we had Estrella) as it should for the summer vibes.
Nice little Cuban restaurant, serving great, tasty food. Must have apps include the Fired Cassava Sticks and the Grilled Calamari. I had the stewed Lamb...
Great Cuban food but the music is too loud for the small space. The musicians are in the middle of the place and the amplifier is set to way too high of a...
My friends and I went here for Winterlicious. Our reservation was for 7:30 but we arrived early. The waitress was nice and sat us even though we were 30...

lic_profile: Located in a building originally built in 1910, the newly renovated Maple Leaf Tavern strives to recreate the look and feel of a true community tavern. With a focus on working with local suppliers and an elevated menu created by Scarborough native, Chef Jesse Vallins, Maple Leaf Tavern is has become a neighbourhood destination in East Toronto.

reviews.text: My son, his girlfriend and I just attended the Visa Infinite event at the Tavern. We paid $100 each to participate. The food and drinks were excellent (well worth the trip) but the service was poor. We sat for 30 minutes and were served one radish and one shrimp each while others around us were served wood grilled bacon, sausage rolls, shrimp, radishes and various cocktails two or three times per table. We had to complain twice before things improved. Not a good way to attract new customers.

The bathroom was tastefully appointed with lots of dark wood trim, adding a dignified ambiance to relieving yourself. Outfitted with gleaming faux gold fixtures and ample toilet paper, the fully enclosed stalls provide peace of mind while using the bathroom, knowing that you won't be overheard. The mirror is wide and allows a full look at yourself. There is minimal odour as well which is great.

I had a steak and some sausage and some mushrooms and it was all good.. The scotch was reasonably priced.

How often can you find a restaurant with an award winning sausage maker? Every dish they brought to our the table was excellent. The prime rib was outstanding. The cauliflower with cheese sauce melts in your mouth. The wine selection is superb and the cocktails are proper cocktails, seasonal and a clever and considerate offering. Always busy it seems. I especially love the fact they kept the venue's original name after its rebirth. Class act all around.

The only regret I have with this restaurant is not coming to try it sooner! My husband and I dined there for a Friday date night. The place was slightly busy but luckily there was a cancellation and we were at to be seated at a table in the corner. However, they have an open style kitchen and bar seating where you could observe the chefs and that is one of my favourite things to do in a restaurant so we opted for the bar. The service was friendly and attentive and the food was mostly excellent! We both had a cheeseburger with fries and it was quite delicious. The only downside was my Caesar salad. Although made with a homemade anchovy dressing, the salad really fell flat. But that would not discourage me from coming back as my husband and I both sure we have a new local date spot.

Pleasant, quick service, affordable meals and drinks.
Great food, excellent service, comfortable atmosphere.
This place is amazing!  The servers are great, the food is 
excellent,Love this place.Fantastic restaurant. I've been 
coming here for a while now mostly for brunch and 
food and service are consistently great.
Been hearing this place had a stories, rowdy past. Passing by the Maple Leaf Tavern every day to and from school growing up however, it did not look like a...

An excerpt from a longer review...

"This was not your grandfather's tavern--ambiance, execution and taste were kicked up a notch.

Take the whole Ontario...
I visited Maple Leaf Tavern for the first time tonight (Valentine's Day). It was buzzing but not exceptionally busy, which is perfect for a high volume...

lic_profile: Located in the heart of Toronto's vibrant and historic fashion district, Marben's cuisine is modern Canadian, with a strong focus on seasonality and vibrant local flavours. Chef Chris Locke utilizes his British roots to create innovative dishes that highlight the bounty of Ontario and Canada. Marben prides itself in using only the highest quality ingredients from local source and suppliers and craft all breads, condiments, and sauces in-house.

reviews.text:
We came here to celebrate my friend's upcoming marriage. The wait staff were all very friendly and informative.

As a group of 5 ladies we decided to order...
I couldn't help but walk into Marben feeling excited and anxious for the meal to come, as the place boasts an almost incredible number of positive reviews...
Normally you can make online reservations for Marben on Opentable, but recently you have to call. Lucky for me that meant they actually had a table 4 days...

Great place. Excellent food and warm, friendly knowledgeable service.  Laid back ambience of a rustic modern pub.  Food is sourced as local as possible and the servers know it well.  Meat is incredible as is the ricotta tomato app - beautiful!  Plus the atmosphere is casual, fun, and friendly on top of sophisticated food. Would cross town again for this.

Really interesting looking bar. They had a great list of craft beers. Everyone in my group was pleased with the taste of our food,  but the plates do run on the small side. So if you’re really hungry you’ll need some appetizers. They had a great looking patio but it was too cold he night we went to sit there.

Went here for dinner. I highly recommend making a reservation or you will not get a table or end up at the bar. We had bar seating. I'm always a bit leery of sitting at the bar when I know I'm going to order food, but this was an excellent experience. The staff were quick, attentive, and friendly. The food selection was lovely and it made picking one item a hard choice. I had a few nibbles of the steak which was excellent. The pork belly was melt in your mouth delicious. The atmosphere was very welcoming and warm. Would definitely recommend for a small gathering of sorts or a date night.

Unbelievable. Just because we were a group of 5 guy friends looking to celebrate my cousin’s birthday, they didn’t let us in around 1am on Saturday night.

They explicitly said they wouldn’t let us in. The bouncers weren’t so clear but I’m assuming that that’s the case.

You would benefit from not wasting your time.

A nice restaurant, good location, with a warm ambience. There is a very nice patio in an oddly unbusy street of downtown. The food choices are limited. The quality of food is good but not extraordinary. The toast is so delicious. Not too kids friendly. They only had one high-chair and they took ours away because another table booked earlier.

reviews.text: While in Toronto for a meeting, I just had to satisfy my ever present craving for Indian food.  Marigold Indian Bistro was consistently mentioned as quite the spot, so off I went on foot from my hotel.  The neighborhood where this place is located is lively and energetic, with many shops, bars and restaurants open late.  The decor of this place was understated, tasteful and relaxed. As the host seated me I overheard the manager/bartender chatting with customers at the bar about different drinks and in particular, a new drink he offered them gratis.  My meal was scrumptious and delicious: hot and tasty.  With each bite I had to close my eyes to experience the full flavor spectrum which was wonderful.  My waiter was quick, friendly and observant though not overbearing.  As I finished, the manager/bar tender began chatting me up and offered me the same new drink he offered the patrons before me.  Not an alcohol drinker, I demurred, though quite happy for the offer.  This place is a combination of wonderful people, great service and fantastic food at great prices.  I give it my highest recommendation.

The food is quite good. However, the service, particularly delivery, can be spotty. The last delivery order we placed took nearly two hours to arrive! Calling a hour-and-a-half in elicited more excuses than apologies. Having ordered many times previously, some gesture of goodwill might have been nice, but apparently repeat customers must be easy to come by. For now they've lost one. There are many alternatives in the area. We'll patronize one of them.

Fantastic place! Me and my coworkers come all the time. Today, eight of us came during a busy lunch hour. The owner was so nice, he juggled tables including a no show reservation just for us. Staff is quick and we always love the food. Very classy place!

Wonderful experience on my first visit. Even though i have lived in the area but very recently i found about this place on very peaceful street of Mt pleasant road.  Its truly a hidden gem. I tried their Lamb Kashmir, the spices were mild, very flavorful, and lamb was very tender. The quality of their lamb surpass all other Indian restaurants ( believe me i have tried hundreds  of Indian places)  i loved the way they do their Biryani Rice. Presentation is beautiful. Cheers to their staff who took good care of me. Great service, great food. I am definitely returning back soon.

A good place.

Bit expensive as the quantity is not much.

Excellent prawns curry.

Salad quantity very less.

Nyc romantic place.

Good service by waiters.

Ordered takeout with UberEats and thought it was excellent and the food arrived hot. 

We ordered beef madras, palaak paneer and butter chicken with rice,...
Loved the interior decor when I walked into this small restaurant. It was modern yet still cultural - a perfect mix. It was empty 7pm on a Tuesday night....
We were feeling lazy and I'd had a taste for Indian food for a while, so we decided to order in using one of the many food-delivery apps. Marigold seemed to...

reviews.text: Great place! Food is always delicious! Small but cozy. A Great little place to take a date.

This was my second visit to this wonderful Malaysian spot downtown. I had the seafood curry which was perfectly flavoured and spicy. My other 3 colleagues also had wonderful meals. The servings are generous and the price just right. Will definitely recommend and return soon.

Nice ambience and some of the food did taste good but we ordered a chicken satay(that came on skewers) which had broken splinters of skewer in it!The splinters poked my mouth, and if they had been swallowed, would probably have been worse:/....The waiter was nice enough to apologize and call the chef out.
But the chef was ridiculously defensive about it and said it was lemongrass:/... didn't even hint at an apology or another solution.
Our whole evening and mood was ruined.They did take it off the bill,but blatant disregard for the customer s experience/feelings is disconcerting to say the least.
The food was excellent! Our waiter Johnny was great. He was friendly and helpful and made suggestions and was very knowledgeable and helpful. The chicken capitan was great!

What a delightful place to be off of Baldwin Street in the heart of downtown. My friend and I were greeted to a very empty restaurant but was full on delivering its promises. The shrimp wonton soup was a decent portion and broth was tasty. The red chilli chicken was a very good size portion for 2 (possibly 3) as well as the Curry Laksa with prawns. The coconut rice was decent as a first time but definitely opened me up to trying it again in the future. The lindt chocolate ice cream and vanilla were just exceptional and a nice amount of it too. The patio fencing could be a bit higher for a more intimate feel. There were neighboring patios as well to get that interconnected feel. A must if you're in the neighborhood!

I had lunch at Matahari Grill today with 5 of my colleagues.  Everyone enjoyed their food.  We all had the prix fixe menu for $18.  

The chicken satay was...
Matahari Grill is pricy, but its one of the few Malaysian restaurants in the city (as far as I know - if I'm wrong, please correct me lmao), so I'll let the...
I came here on a Tuesday for lunch with a few coworkers after making reservations on the phone answering machine.  Their website has incorrect hours posted....

reviews.text:
I came here for a date night for the winterlicious deal and I enjoyed my experience. 
The atmosphere was nice and romantic, it's connected to the Marriott...

Hello, 
I wanted to share our wonderful experiences we had at your restaurant. My husband and I are visiting family and we stayed 4 nights.  We are usually...
I would normally turn my nose up at the hotel restaurant, but was super pleased with everything about Matisse. As a vegetarian, I found the options offered...

The only thing that gave them the extra star was the service. The people are pretty nice and passionate, refreshing to see. What isn't refreshing is the food. The portions are frankly a joke, do not come here if you're starving. The steak was mediocre at best, and to hide the small size of the steak they put it on french fries. And the chocolate cake they had was simply a triangular cut brownie. Not going to go there again
Decent service, Nice food. The atmosphere is great the service is my only complain, if they get better on that it could be one of my favorite places to dine.

The food was just okay but the service was not very good. When we walked in the waiter saw us but just walked away and came back 10 minutes later and told us to sit anywhere. When we sat down he brought us our coffee which was cold and the dishes were dirty. We also had to wait another 10 minutes to just get our menus. When our food was brought out, the waiter also brought us the bill, as if rushing us to get out. We are paying a premium price for bad service and diner quality food. Not coming back.
Great service and food. Make sure to try the flourless chocolate cake!
The "cocktails" in reality were quite far from what the menu described them as and the service was appalling - no water refills, very slow, never proactive and always a hassle to get.

reviews.text: I'd never been to this restaurant previously but it is really a beautiful restaurant. Loved the atmosphere - plenty of interesting and eclectic paintings and pictures to keep your eyes engaged, large bar and plenty of seating, fantastic food with larger than expected portion sizes, and a gracious and friendly host and wait staff. I appreciated their prix-fix menu which included a glass of champagne which paired perfectly with my meal and wonderful strawberry covered cheesecake - yum!!! Definitely a restaurant to return to in the future.

Great French food with very tasty sauces. I liked the French wine too. I would prefer some changes in the menu at least one or two times during the week. I would also add few top selling dishes like tenderloin Cafe de Paris sauce. The prices are around 65 CAD including wine.

A marvelous place to visit for a scrumptious menu day or night. Lovely pleasant friendly hostesses, and the well trained ladies that help you choose your menu. Who could ask for anything else.It even has AMBIANCE!!

I have been to Merlot for the first time last week and it was wonderful. The staff is super friendly and professional, the food is high quality and very tasty.

I will go back for sure!
A wonderful authentic French restaurant...a real gem. Delicious food and well priced...great atmosphere too.

Hostess is an impeccably lovely older lady. Pity the rest of the staff don't measure up.

Apparently the waitresses here don't do table checks. If they did...

Note: Winterlicious Review

The atmosphere was nice and cozy, with candles lighting up the space. The servers were for the most part attentive and warm. 

I...
Came here to celebrate my husband's birthday last night. It's unfortunate that some reviews online had me questioning whether we should go here at all, but...

reviews.text:
Discovered this neighbourhood gem tonight . Food was great- portions were very generous . Service was friendly ... 

The restaurant was larger then I...

I've ordered a delivery from these guys and I feel like I need to leave a note of praise!

The order was delivered even before the time that was emailed me!...
I don't get it. This place is almost always full and a lot of the diners are Italian families, so I was expecting the food to be amazing like the...

I've only been here once, so I can't comment too much on their menu, but their seafood risotto is really good. Portion size is very adequate, if not large, there is a generous helping of mussels, scallops, and shrimp, and the rice itself was cooked nicely with a nice consistency.

Their complementary variety bread appetizer was also delicious.

Service was a little slow, but I did come here at an off time with only one waitress working, so I'll assume it's usually quicker.
The first time we had pizza. It was very good! Yesterday I had sea food with risotto. It was good. The service is wonderful! The price is ok. I recommend Mezza Notte!
Decent food but nothing exceptional. You could find better. Appetizer bread they provided was cold. Waiter was good.
Room temperature and undercooked pasta. Waitress with dirty blond hair was a biat**

This is an Italian restaurant that is located right on Yonge Street. Not a particularly outstanding venue for being on such a major street. Parking is available but it is not always easy to access. Not enough parking so you may have to pay for it on the street. Patio in front might be nice in summertime but very small and not particularly inviting. Decor of the restaurant is very casual. Could use some updating. Food is ok. Not large portions. Have a good wine , beer and spirits list. Tried the Danish beer Ceres and was very pleasantly surprised. Was the best thing about my meal. Bread before the meal was uneventful. Cold pizza and not too fresh bread offered. Table next to us didn't finish their desserts. So decided to skip that. Service however was very friendly and efficient. Very honest about recommendations. Lamb ragout was not fresh so opted for cheese crepes. Were very nice but not particularly well presented. On the whole, ok for a light meal and drinks, but would not take my guests there.

lic_profile: Michael's on Simcoe, located in the heart of downtown Toronto, is an upscale, modern steak house with an Italian touch. Specializing in premium beef, seafood and handmade pastas, carefully selected ingredients are sourced from trusted suppliers who only offer the finest of products. White table cloth service is complemented by valet service five nights a week, a gorgeous bar and lounge offers live music four nights a week and the exquisitely designed dining room is accented by a fireplace. The menu is enhanced by Wine Spectator award winning wine list featuring nearly 700 offerings.

reviews.text: Michels on Simcoe. The best steak place in all of Canada. Complete menu of beef, fish fresh made pasta. All beef is very high end from around the world....
Amazing customer service from Alex our waiter and one of the manager tonight. Our Amex card kept declining my payment and we went through 3 different Amex...
Wow, where do I begin. First of all, the ambiance is amazing for a romantic and intimate night out. We were greeted by a gracious hostess and then Peter...

The service is excellent. The staff are very friendly and attentive. There was always someone attending to our table which I found to be quite nice and at the same time expected for a high caliber restaurant. 

The food,however, came up short. The main course of our tasting menu was a rib eye steak and it was bland at best and the chicken served with it was dry. I didn’t bother eating it after the first bite. The rest was ok.

We were also seated by the entrance to the restaurant and it was uncomfortably hot towards the end of our uneventful meal. It was refreshing to step outside during a heatwave than to be inside.

For the $450 value of my rewards + $100 tip this wasn’t worth it to have left unsatisfied with a sweat soaked dress shirt.

I am not one to return to restaurants over again, but with Michael's, I make not only an exception but a consorted effort to return!  This restaurants keep astounding me in terms of their excellent level of service, very knowledgeable and friendly staff, and a chef extraordinaire.  They even cater to vegans! Not only vegetarians! What?? A steak house?  Superb meat and I won't even get into the details of how delicious the food really is as that is for you to figure out, but I know my food and wine having been to restaurants around the world, this restaurant hits it out of the park!  Get the tasting menu as you will not be disappointed. This is a definite must go and fast!  It's a five star experience from the valet service to the very end.  I am truly blown away by this Toronto gem!

I went to Michael's with a girlfriend after a conference for a quick ladies night out. We sat at the bar and enjoyed a glass of red wine and some delicious appetizers on a Thursday. The food was excellent! Also, the owner was so friendly and attentive, as was our bartender. The ambience was hip yet relaxing. It was busy but not over crowded. It felt cozy,  especially with the fireplace. I had a great time and will return for sure! I am a little picky with restaurants since I don't get out often (I work too much) but I would recommend this place. It is really a hidden gem.

Such a cool spot. You almost feel transported when you walk into this place. It gives off this cool, yet comfortable vibe that I love. Add that to the incredible staff/service, impressive wine and whisky collection, and their truly delicious tasting menu...there's no going wrong here. I'll definitely be going back!

Michael's venue is in an absolute stunning location just North of King, South of Soho. I sat down with a friend of mine in the the bar/lounge where we were greeted with smiles and refined service. I ordered a variety of items, recommended by the beautiful staff, and everything was balanced and full of flavour. Michael even took the time to come by and ask about our meal, and took a genuine interest in our dining experience. His personality is woven throughout the entire restaurant; posh & charming.  5 STAR.

reviews.text:
I was able to host my birthday dinner here on the last day of Winterlicious for a reservation of 30. I have to admit that I probably called 2-3 times before to change the numbers from 15 to 25 to 30 but the staff was extremely friendly and accommodating. Didn't even have to put a deposit down. 

On the day of, we practically took up one entire side of the restaurant! From taking drink and food orders, to having to add additional people to the party, to food expedition, refills, and splitting the bills, every single staff member did things happily and efficiently. Even offered to take some of our pictures!

Food wise, everything came out in a timely manner. I ordered the Lamb Shank but also got to sample a couple other dishes from friends - everything was tasty and were good textures (veggies soft, meats fell off the bone).

Overall, had a phenomenal time here and super happy to share my birthday with friends and the staff. Highly recommend!
Our large lunch salads were pre-prepared, cold, without dressing, mostly lettuce, and tasteless. Very disappointing. Service was fine, though.

Winterlicious: Food and service were very good. Many seafood options on the menu. Desserts were good. Did not try the wines but it seems that they have a good selection. Best of my visit was the bill. Very good value for the money. Recommended!

Midi is a great little lunch spot in the discovery district. A good selection on the menu, solid wine list and very good service. The prices are very fair and they are quick, so if you're in a hurry it's a great choice. I'll definitely be back, because the food is good too.

Food was delicious, good value, good portions and amazing flavour too. The atmosphere was perfect! This place WILL have you yearning to come back. 

P.s.: good wine selection too

It has been a couple of years since I wrote my original review.

It continues to be a place that draws me in, for all the same reasons

Great food, great...

I had the pleasure to enjoy their Winterlicious menu. The overall experience was pleasant.

I ordered a French Onion Soup, which is sub par, not the best I...
I've walked past this place many times without the urge to go in, but my roommate invited me to try the Winterlicious menu with her and I regret a little...

Milagro serves traditional Mexican Cuisine:  you'll enjoy an amazing selection of regional specialties, fresh fish ceviches, delicious tacos & tortas as well as a large selection of Tequila, Mezcal, cerveza & amazing Margaritas.

reviews.text:
PERFECTION!!!!

Not only is the food to rave about (those tacos and margaritas are unbelievable) but so are the staff! 

I had my birthday dinner here a...
Went to have dinner with a few colleagues from work and we all loved it. A good option for groups is the cantina platter, which includes a little bit of...
We were really excited to come here but found the food so-so and a little but too stodgy. Our kids were with us (11 and 7) and the kids portions were way...

Very tasty but largely spicy tacos. If you are not  a fan of spicy food do not go. They have a kid menu though so you can bring your kids and not worry. The mains are also excellent. It's on the pricey side. I have seen people leave after looking at the menu prices. But the food is made with care and very good ingredients. Very friendly staff.

Great food and a good atmosphere but somewhat over priced considering the quality and the cost but at the same time they are located in the heart of downtown Toronto and I’m sure rent isn’t cheap! Worth going to! the enchiladas are excellent! I’ve been many times and the food and drinks have always been wonderful!

Absolutely delicious! Delectable, authentic dishes. Very attentive, friendly, lovely staff. Charming atmosphere. Fantastic cocktails. Bring your date. Bring your grandma. Bring your grandma’s date. They won’t be disappointed. This place is fantastic.

I absolutely love this restaurant and go often, however I find that sometimes the food can be prepared differently.

The last two times I've been, one of the items ordered was shockingly spicy. Last time it was the fish taco, and the time before that it was the guacamole. I've ordered both these items in the past and they were never spicy!  Not just talking spicy...I'm talking inedibly spicy. Actual physical pain in the esophagus spicy. I don't know what's going on, but clearly there is some kind of cross-contamination happening in the kitchen. I love going here but I won't be taking anyone new because I don't want to subject them to potentially inedible food.
Milagro has become my go to casual dining spot with friends. Usually come here on a weeknight. I like how it is not too busy. Love the vibe. Staffs are friendly. Great food and margaritas!

lic_profile: Fresh seasonal ingredients are on the Italian menu in this multi-award winning restaurant. Savour unforgettable flavours from handmade pasta to fresh fish in the elegant dining room that flickers with candlelight. Mistura has an extensive wine list and a list of creative and refreshing cocktails and martinis to accompany your dinner. The friendly, professional staff will make you feel welcome and comfortable while you enjoy the entire dining experience.

reviews.text:
Atmosphere is classy and comfortable.  Service is attentive, friendly and professional.  It should be noted that this is refined dining. 

Risotto...
Mistura provides a warm welcome once we entered the door.  Excellent services and top quality entrees.  We ordered Ontario Shrimp and Lobster Risotto.  We...
the veal has very terrible smell which doesnt even frash. Duck confit is too salty, I have to keep drinking water. Overall the display is very bad. It's...

I was there with 2 friends on a Tuesday recently. The room is very nice, everyone was so friendly and welcoming and the food we had was excellent. The menu has some nice pastas and you can share or have one as a main all to yourself. Great place for a relaxing week night dinner anytime. Nice reasonably priced wine by the glass or bottle. I'm going to be a regular and I recommend you try this place.

By far the best restaurant I’ve experienced in Toronto. I’ve been to restaurants and paid double for food that doesn’t come close to Mistura. Everything is as authentic Italian as it gets. The owner visits the table to make sure everything is going well and knows more about Italian food than anyone I’ve met. We ended up here by luck and will be our new go-to Italian restaurant. Bravo!

Authentic Italian, great ambience! My hubby and I went their recently on our anniversary and had a nice relaxing evening. The service is also excellent. They are not pushy and our waiter really explained the menu to us! Had a wonderful evening! Thank you ☺️

Great for a special occasion. Friendly staff, delicious food, nice decor.  The owner walks around and makes sure everything is going well.  He also takes a lot of pride in making authentic Italian cuisine, using imported Italian ingredients when necessary.  The beet  risotto is fantastic!  Overall I would certainly recommend this place and will go back.  Also, street parking wasn't a problem: area isn't that busy.

I had dinner at Mistura while on a business trip.  Everything on the menu far exceeded my expectations. Typical Italian cuisine. Lasagna is out of this world! Service is amazing. It's like having dinner with the family. A must if you are ever in Toronto!

lic_profile: Mochica offers authentic Peruvian cuisine, ancestral but presented in a modern interpretation.

reviews.text: This place brought me right back to my trip to Peru all those years ago. The Pisco Sours are the best I've had outside of South America, and everything else...
I was excited to know of a Peruvian restaurant, sadly I came to realize that it is disgrace to Peruvian food. This is not Peruvian food, please don't come...
Great food. Love the Lomo Saltado.

I used to work at Mochica as a server/bartender for about 4 months. At first it seemed to be okay but soon it became obvious that their operation is extremely unorganized, super unprofessional and ridiculous. They do not know how to run a proper, operating restaurant. On top of the (extreme) lack of management skills, the other servers, bartenders, cooks, and staff are hired illegally without Canadian work permits or visas. The chef/owner paid these people in cash instead. I was the only staff member at the time who was eligible to work there legally along with my certificates as a server, which no one else had, and they also weren't required or encouraged to have by "management". The chef/owner keeps NO paper trail of his employees. I called to try and get my T4, Record of Employment, etc. but of course, he denied that he knows who I am, that I worked there, etc. Overall, this restaurant did not have the management to run a business... I feel sorry for anyone who chooses to support this establishment by going in to dine, or work there. Not worth it.

Waited more than 75 minutes for food when we told them to cancel they all of a sudden had our food ready , we were told they were waiting for oysters to be ready while all the other food needed to be cooked we sent the spoilhad d oysters back and still were charged for it , he actual food was canned food poured into the dish absolutely he worst bar restaurant possible in Horton’s food is much better than theirs the worst possible choic in toronto
When complained to the manager he was rude and absolutely didn’t care about customers the worst owner restaurant ever
The food is ok. I wont go there again. The waitress was very helpful but the food and quality I am not sure, especially sea food.

Great spot! Was just here for a catching-up-over-dinner date with two friends and we loved everything about Mochica. All of the food and drinks we ordered were delicious. I'm still thinking about the ceviche mixto and the purple corn pudding dessert. Our server was so helpful with menu suggestions and really attentive. Cant wait to go back.

Amazing peruvian food with wonderful presentation. In my opinion is the best place in toronto to get a true peruvian experience.  the pisco is also very authentic and straight from peru! A must try !!!!

reviews.text: I haven't been blown away by a meal in Toronto in ages. This meal though, this blew me away. It's very simple fare, at least to the eye, but the flavours...
My partner and I ate at Montgomery's for a special occasion, having not known much about the restaurant but being recommended it by the staff of a nearby...
Great service! I like how they spread out the guests amongst attached tables.. best mackerel yet! Try the tasting menu

very unique, and amazing dining experience. The kitchen is at the front of the restaurant, allowing for the truest 'open concept' kitchen I have ever seen. Really adds to atmosphere. Very nicely decorated, and beyond comfortable. The food was amazing, our waiter helped us with ordering, and suggested the timing of the meal in order for us to get the most out of it. The duck is a must, so so good.

My family and I visited Montgomery's last night for my brother's birthday dinner and it was a wonderful and memorable meal. We were so impressed with the warm and efficient service. Everyone we came into contact with was lovely. The meal was incredible. We opted for the sharing menu and it did not disappoint! The pacing was perfect and the meal told the perfect story of local, Canadiana, well-executed food. We don't go out often as we genuinely enjoy cooking for each other and when we do, we want it to be a meal that we either could not or would not make at home. This fit the bill. We will definitely be back and I can't wait to visit again! Thanks for a great meal!

I really enjoyed my meal at Montgomery’s. We had a cheese plate, duck, steak, salad and desserts — and everything was delicious. My favourite was the steak and the apple buttermilk ice cream. The owners were friendly and the service was on point. I would definitely recommend Montgomery’s.

What a unique spot. Enjoyed dinner here on Friday. You walk in and the kitchen is right there - you can observe the chefs at work. Staff take your coat and lead you to the dining area in the back, which is warmly lit by candlelight. Our server was very attentive and took good care of us - the service was excellent. We ordered the bread and churned butter, salad, mushrooms, trout and squid dishes - all creatively executed, beautifully presented and quite delicious. Come here to discover new flavors and execution, and leave inspired! Thanks, Montgomery’s!

Cool, funky Queen West(west) restaurant serving delicious, well executed unpretentious food and drink. Small plate/sharing format and nice cozy room. Service was friendly and professional. I'll be back.  100% recommended.

reviews.text: The chef is absolutely amazing. And the owners are as well. The food is prepared with fresh ingredients only. The main chef is a generous and kind soul that will prepare every single dish for its best quality. The prices are great as well. I encourage you to try the daily pasta or sandwich specials.you will never be disappointed

As always food and service was great. Patio is a great spot with a sunny area and a shaded area. I have one complaint about my visit today.  

I LOVE butter tarts, and as anyone who loves these sweet bundles of awesome knows, there are a few divisive aspects where butter tarts are concerned.  Runny or firm, and raisins,nuts, or non.  

The menu says butter tarts and that is it.  Looking at the price you can assume it is a but larger than normal so runny or firm might not make much difference because it is going to be a knife and fork situation ( it's runny by the way). However discovering raisins inside when not indicated on the menu was a HUGE disappointment.  

Other than that, this place is one of the best in Danforth and everyone should eat here.

While visiting Toronto from Montreal my wife and I were invited by some very good friends to dine at Morgans On The Danforth.

To start my wife and I decided to share the Red and Golden Beet Salad. Super delicious. My main course was the Southern Fried Chicken. Real crispy and yummy. My wife chose the Candy Roasted Salmon and the other members of our party had the Halibut and Fries and the Pasta and Shrimp special. There was not a crumb left on any plate. I'd say that was a good indication of wonderful food. For dessert we all shared the Flourless Brownie and the Blueberry Kuchen. A sweet and heavenly ending to a great meal. Service throughout was also extremely friendly and efficient.

I would highly recommend this establishment to all.

Found Morgan's staff and owner to be very hospitable. I enjoyed Chef Jerome's BBQ baby back ribs cooked to perfection with the meat just falling off the ribs. Portion size was enough. My girlfriend enjoyed the lamb burger with goat cheese with marmalade accompanied with argula side salad which tasted wonderful without the smell of lamb and no ketchup needed.

This is the pub of choice for Toronto RUSH 💿 players after their games at Monarch Park. Upscale pub food and a good selection of local craft beers. Well lit clean facility with a noise level (65db) that is reasonable given RUSH were celebrating their 33-19 win over DC BREEZE. The game was great and the drinks deserved.
Even though it is also a pub, Morgans is also a bit of an oasis with its tall benches that allow for privacy and a buffer to noise. I was still in a pretty...
Came for return Winterlicious Feb 2018 after coming here 2 years ago. Small local bar serving good quality food. Cozy atmosphere and lots of locals visit on...
This is is a very well run restaurant full of regular locals. The food and service is always amazing! Everything is fresh and of quality. They have great...

reviews.text: I've been coming to this location for years. Never had a bad experience. The staff is super friendly and all the food tastes great. They have good daily deals on beverages. The desserts are the best part, sometimes I come here just for that. Highly recommend!

Service was pretty awesome. Refills on drinks were brought without request.  Waitress was friendly and had a good knowledge of the menu.  Food was served quickly and tasted fantastic.  Loved the selection on the menu.  Price was decent.  Would definitely come back if I lived in the area

Amazing atmosphere, very comfortable to sit, eat, drink and enjoy a wonderful day alone or with friends. The Food is really spectacular, I have never been disappointed. They will try to manage allergies ,if you mention them. Overall, I love it.

Such a terrible experience. It's like they hired all kids. From the greeting to sitting down, to even paying the bill. I was served my steak and my girlfriend's pasta and we have no cutlery. So many servers running around however it took us 25 mins just to find someone to get us the bill. My steak didn't even look appetizing as the plate was massive and everything was to one side. Wish I took pictures.

This is the Moxie's by the Scarborough Town Centre. Nice ambiance and a good vibe all around. Food was good except that the Sirloin steak that I ordered was a bit saltier than usual. Sides and the desserts were pretty darn good. The servers were polite and friendly. Overall, a good place to eat if you are around STC.

I am a big fan of Moxie's.  I've eaten at most of them in the local area.

The food is always consistent.  The service is always good.  The restaurants are...

I would give this place negative 100 stars if I could. 
Let me elaborate, my and my boyfriend along with two other friends were there for dinner on a not so...

Moxie's is a good standby that's stood the test of time in Toronto.
The menu is dependable, the staff are competent and the ambiance is a good mix of...

reviews.text:
One of my favorite spots in Toronto.
Love the atmosphere, the food, the crowd, the drinks, the friendly barmen, everything gets a 5 star rating except the...
Museum Tavern was on my list for about a year especially after I heard it was the number one burger according to the man who ate a burger everyday for a...

Arrived with no one to greet me and my partner . We were meeting with friends so when I saw them
I just joined them to shady glances from
servers.  Another...
This place is neatly maintained. I liked buttermilk fried chicken twice. Never disappointed. Order usually takes time given this place is usually busy which is good.

Wow!! Cocktails yum...bar staff can create almost every drink. Great chill out spot. Relaxed vibe, must try the chicken when here so good. Oysters yep thumbs up. Would make reservations for a Friday night can get busy. Would highly recommend this place

Museum Tavern is one of my favorite restaurants in the city.  There's one bartender that works there and he makes the best cocktails you'll ever have. If you ever find yourself in the neighbourhood between 4-6 pm pop in for a drink.  Ask Justin to make you a Johnny Sour.  You won't regret it!

Was unsure at first, but once we got some seats, and a couple beers, it was all uphill from there. The bartender serving us was top notch and attentive, the beer pours were excellent, and no word of a lie the prime rib burger tops my list as burger of the year. The fries they serve are also amongst the best. Prices are reasonable as well. Will be returning.
Update: second visit decided to try the cocktails and they were all delectable! Had to have the burger again because it's just so amazing. We decided to try the desserts as well and they were all amazing. This place doesn't disappoint.

Quality tavern and friendly service. Good relatively simple food. Only downside is a poor selection of beers but I can’t knock them a star for that since it’s not the crowd they cater to. In saying that, great cocktail selection and whiskey flights are a nice touch

lic_profile: A cozy, romantic jazz bar & restaurant, N'awlins is located in the heart of the entertainment district and offers a variety of Cajun-Italian cuisine and live jazz & blues music. The patio is perfectly situated for watching the excitement of King Street West. With close proximity to theatres, it's a perfect spot to enjoy dinner & drinks before or after the show.

reviews.text: Wonderful small jazz Italian restaurant close to second city. Appetizers were excellent: brouschetta excellent and right size. Escargot good tasty garlic...
This a very quaint little (seats may 50-60ppl) restaurant in the centre of the King West entertainment district. We went for the Summerlicious promo & we're...
Lovely atmosphere, free live music, and fantastic food. My only question is this: Why don't they have crawfish on the menu?

Such a nice place! A little cramped but nothing I couldn't handle. The jazz music was so amazing. The band I saw was interactive with the audience, smiling and having fun! The waitress we had was so great as well. I'd recommend this place for a little date night, or a friendly get together if you like something hip and don't mind music and a lively atmosphere. This place does fill up fast, too, so keep that in mind!

This is one of my favourite places in the city. Friendly staff, great food, and frequently, live music. It's a tight space. The tables are really close to one another and it's almost impossible to not bump someone or have to shift to let someone by. The crowd that gathers here is usually a friendly one and so the closeness isn't a bother for me.

If you're claustrophobic at all though, maybe scout ahead to see if you can survive this space. It's well worth it if you can.

Very good food, a little pricey. Live music. Talented trio playing that night which I really enjoyed. Good casual atmosphere. It is a little congested due to the building being quite narrow. I happened to go with two singers who were allowed to sing a song with the band.

Service was terrible, "patio" is crowded.  Moved inside and the terrible waitress put us right beside the piano.  Left with a headache.

The food was decent but overpriced.  The Mississippi Mussels and Catfish were great.  Jambalaya was disappointing. 

The live pianist was great but too loud for such a small venue.

Would not come again.
Great service Great food & Drinks. Live jazz music most evening. Love this place I highly recommend checking N'Awlins out. Try the seafood dinner.. You can thank me later.

lic_profile: Located in the downtown core for more than 30 years, Nami continues to serve traditional Japanese cuisine in a simple, modern setting. Kimono-clad servers attend to patrons in the main dining room, private booths and the Tatami room with rice-paper screened doors. The Robata Bar serving made-to-order grilled meat, vegetables and fresh seafood and the Sushi Bar round out a traditional yet unique dining experience.

reviews.text:
Unagi Don!!!! Pricy place but you can taste the quality. A definitive must try!!!

Great atmosphere and the service is on point.

I don't remember much, but I remember it was 3.5 stars.
 
I went here with some colleagues after work on Friday for dinner and drinks.
 
Drinks were in the...
Ate there again last night, as always the sushi was excellent, along with the authentic Japanese atmosphere.

The restaurant is amazing!

The food is fresh and the quality of the ingredients is definitely something they take seriously. 

The prices are expensive but what you get is well worth the price. Taste is amazing, the staff are always making sure that your glass of water is full and are polite.

Everything was delicious and I would definitely recommend taking the "Black Sesame" Ice-cream  for dessert if you want to be blown away by a simple yet delicious bit of sweetness after your meal.

We stopped in for a late lunch just before they closed at 2. Despite arriving at an awkward time, the food and the service were excellent. The sashimi sampler was a great way to start and the avocado salad was delicious (get the large size, you won't regret it). We also  had the lamb chops and the scallops.  Both were perfectly prepared and presented beautifully. When we have the opportunity, we're looking forward to returning for dinner.

Worst yakitori ever. It cannot be worst. Rubbery skinless chicken, the sauce is sweet but no depth. I cannot believe they are serving something so terrible for $18.  I want to give it zero star but i cannot.
Has continued to impress each time we have showed up at the door. Accommodating and professional wait staff and a killer menu. A solid place for good sushi/sashimi. Doubly good if the Toro is in!
It's probably the most amazing Japanese restaurants that I have been. The sashimi is delicious and as well as sushi. Even though the price is a little bit higher but it’s definitely worth it to try.

lic_profile: For more than 20 years, Noce has been serving refined and authentic Italian cuisine on Queen Street West.  Owners Elena Morelli, Guido Alberto Saldini and Chef Eron Novalski have kept the focus of their menu on sophisticated flavours using the freshest ingredients, locally grown whenever possible. Whether you dine in the newly renovated dining room or the large patio, once you have been to Noce you are sure to return.

reviews.text: Noce is a lovely Italian restaurant in Trinity Bellwoods. I went for Winterlicious this year along with a few of my girlfriends for lunch. At $33, we got to...

3.5 stars. 

I had high hope for this restaurant and we came here on a Sat night for my friends 30s birthday. 

The entrance was quite hidden. If you come...

WHAT TO TRY??

It's the season of winterlicious so why not give this restaurant a try during this event? I was intrigued by the selection in their...

So overall we had a great time. The service was excellent. We were a party of four and our waiter was extremely informative, patient, suggestive of items to try, he even separated our shared plates into equal sections for us. We ordered a bunch of food. Overall the food was good, however a bit expensive, for the result. We LOVED the mushroom ravioli, it was delicious, the lamb was pretty good, but it didn’t have that much meat on it. The halibut was good but again pretty small portion for the price. The burata was also tasty, but small for $24. See pictures below.
We shared: 3 appetizers, 2 pastas, 2 meats, 2 desserts everyone had a drink. Our bill was $330 (not including tip).
Great staff. Excellent wine list. Fresh food with interesting specials. I'd highly recommend for a group of friends or date night.

Excellent restaurant. Surprisingly spacious. Friendly staff. I had a fixed menu for a large group and it was fantastic - fresh calamari and sausage as app and steak as main. Very good wine menu and some interesting cocktails.

Great little italalian restaurant! The food was good but the service was great! Habby is a great server, she was very knowledge, respectful and considerate. Seems like a great vibe for drinks, and the music playing in the background had me and my date singing along.

Absolutely delicious!! Cannot recommend enough! Myself and a friend found this little spot for his going away dinner and it was just perfect! The service was top notch, conversational and personal but knowing when to leave us alone, the food was out of this world! Great quality with good portion size and very reasonable!!

lic_profile: A cosy, neighbourhood restaurant in the Annex, Nord Bistro serves classic food with a modern twist, made from scratch and internationally inspired; something for everyone’s taste. The welcoming atmosphere, friendly service and cosy bar in the back make it a destination for locals and food seekers alike. The menu is complemented by local craft beer, a extensive by the glass wine list, and customized cocktails.

reviews.text: Vacationing in Toronto, from Boston. Stopped here for a bite to eat based off of reviews, and we were not disappointed. Daily menu specials are delightful....
Had a wonderful lunch with friends at Nord Bistro ... great salad mains in a quiet and friendly atmosphere.
I stopped in for lunch recently with my parents.  It was a great experience.  I had a burger, but not just any burger.  It was made with chuck, brisket and...

What a nice, cozy and charming bistro with great food. We were greeted quickly and everyone was courteous. We had the mussels and fries, it was cooked perfectly. We also had the grilled calamari, so tasty, not chewy, seasoned perfectly. The chef came out to chat with us, making the experience so personal. Definitely going back for other items on the menu.
Another hidden gem , hidden away in this cute little neighborhood. Great food and friendly helpful staff with moderate price.

Chicken was undercooked and rubbery. I left feeling ill. The waiter did not bother to ask why I'd hardly touched my food. I don't normally go through the trouble of posting a negative review, but my experience here was particularly bad.
Great bistro.  Very comfortable small place and great food.
Fantastic brunch.   Food and service perfect. Thank you Nord

lic_profile: Named after the city's latitude, North 44 is known to Toronto and international diners alike for its unique dining experience and elegant surroundings. With a sophisticated, yet relaxed atmosphere, North 44 is a gourmet experience perfect for business professionals, social and romantic dinners.

reviews.text:
Been there for my first time, one of the best places in GTA!
Very recommended - Fettuccine with Lobster and mushrooms as well as the Bison steak, make it...

TL;DR: Do NOT go for Winterlicious. While the food was nice but nothing impressive, the service was more than disappointing.

I've been to many fine dining...

This place is my favourite !!! I may be biased as the experience was heightened by good company :p

The decor and ambiance are gorgeous, classy, with...

Valet parking offered for $15. Green P parking on Sherwood and Yonge for $6. Free street parking if you're willing to drive around +/- walking further. Was immediately greeted by friendly hostess. Excellent wait staff trying their best to accommodate everyone. Tuna capaccio appetizer a must try. Several vegetarian options, but can always ask. Truffle risotto was delightful and full of mushrooms and root vegetables. Worth the price.
This is a good restaurant  for  having a wonderful dinner with your beloved ones. especially the cornish hen dish  tastes really good.they also have some well planned menus.

Attended for a special dinner out with family. Hosts made us feel welcome once arrived. The service for the first half of the night was slow.  Ordered the Ribbons Of Ahi Tuna and Seared Breast Of Duckling as my appetizer and main, both delicious. My mother ordered the Black Cod dish, which came with an overcooked, barely edible prawn. Other family members ordered the 10 oz. Australian Striploin, some were cooked perfectly, others uneven. The Truffle fries were amazing. Was upset that the Honey Mascarpone Mousse was unavailable, when it was once of the dishes I was looking forward to trying most - ordered the Dark Chocolate Ganache instead. Even as a fine dining restaurant, the portion size of the dessert was underwhelming. Two small cubes of chocolate cake, drizzled with sponge toffee, creme fraiche and 1/4 scoop of ice cream for $16. Where's my piece of cake?!
It wasn't perfect, but it was a memorable experience.
Had a corporate meeting at this restaurant. Delicious food with amazing service. Great for groups!

Went to a office holiday party here and the food and especially the service was great. I am looking forward to going here for a reason of my own, the ambience was good. Dim lighting and relaxed setting with a good buzz.

lic_profile: Northern Maverick has a fiercely local menu, offering an elevated gastropub experience with an oyster bar, house-made charcuterie and curated food that pairs well with the house beers on tap.  Located in the city's trendy King West neighbourhood, Northern Maverick is a two-floor brewery, with a 400-seat restaurant, patio and event space.  Northern Maverick offers a casual vibe, along with a seasonal food and drink menu.

reviews.text:
Really great local brewpub. Came here for drinks and a bite to eat with a friend and had a lovely evening. 

The decor is upscale, but not overly...

Gord and I had supper at Northern Maverick Brewing Co. this evening.  They opened in September and I've been wanting to check them out.

Alas, it was too...
The decor is appealing, the patio is great, and even the service is attentive but the food.. good God. It's f*cking AWFUL. If I were a "chef" and that was...

Venue - nice location off King, modern furnishings, comfortable

Staff - very friendly, service average

Prices and food - this is a two parter. Lunch is good and a fair price. Dinner is over priced and offers numerous share style plates as well as "large plates" which are burgers/fried chicken etc. 

Beer - good mix and nice quality beer.

Overall - Come for lunch! Come for beer! Don't come for dinner.

Really enjoyed our girls' night out on a Sunday evening and especially the buck a shuck promotion ($1 per oyster). Loved the local brew options as well as the food. For dessert, the vanilla ice cream with the maple bacon jam was amazing. Service was friendly and swift. Do visit the adjoining beer store where you can purchase the local beer and some swag.

A nice patio, attentive service, and a good selection of tasty beers.  I was pleasantly surprised by how good the food was.  The fried chicken platter and the burger were both excellent.  Buck a shuck oysters on Sundays doesn't hurt either.  I'll definitely be back.

I will start by saying the beer here was good. Good selection of in house beer, tart of darkness is a great dark sour. We came on a Sunday afternoon just after 4 and were told they only had a limited menu. We were fine with that as we were only looking to have a few drinks with some light snacks. The service was terrible. Our waitress didn't really have any idea of what she was doing. We had to ask several times for side plates, napkins, and cutlery. Apparently after 4 is buck a shuck but when we ordered oysters we weren't told, it was a nice surprise but it seems like the sort of thing that they would inform us of. When our order was taken the waitress again didn't seem to have a clue as we had to repeat our order several times before she got it right, or so we thought. Our food arrived and was wrong, which is rather difficult as there was a choice of three items on the menu. When we informed that it was wrong they brought the order back and it was again wrong. To their credit the item was removed from our bill. When we asked for our bill it brought and we were ignored for about 15 minutes as we waited to pay. I would recommend stopping by the bottle shop of you're interested in the beer or come for beer only but all other aspects need to be tightened up.

We went here with some co workers for dinner. Took about 15 min to get our orders. Craft beers were fine but the food was ok. Burger had Every thing wrong with it, raw onions, non toasted bun but meat had some taste. Would go for some drinks again.

lic_profile: Named "Canada's best new restaurant" by Air Canada's EnRoute magazine, and "Top new restaurant" by Toronto Life, Nota Bene continues to deliver outstanding food and great hospitality in a polished and casual atmosphere.  Located in the heart of downtown, Nota Bene is steps away from the Theatre District and Four Seasons Centre for the Performing Arts.  Open for both Lunch and Dinner, the menu features the fresh, contemporary and globally - inspired cuisine of Chef David Lee.  Whether for a business lunch, celebrating with friends, dinner before the show, or after work cocktails and snacks, Nota Bene is on everyone's shortlist when seeking a great meal downtown.

reviews.text: I don’t mind paying big bucks for food but then the food better be worth it. It wasn’t the case here. Too pricey for the food they’re serving. Nothing special. Nice friendly staff but service was meh. The server forgot our order twice. I was reading other people’s reviews here. Yeah pretentious is a good word. Definitely not going back.

Amazing people.  Will always return.  Your in for a fabulous evening!
Great place to take family out for a night.  Get the hubby to take care of it.  Great wine, Great food, excellent service.   Absolutely fantastic lighting and the venue is beautiful....

The White Asparagus salad was very nice. The striploin steak was done perfectly.The pickerel was excellent. Descent wine selection. The staff were attentive and insured orders were brought to the table quickly.

This Is an impressively deceiving place. It tells you nothing from outside and little from the decor.  But the menu is wonderfully rich and balanced, the food was great and the service very good.  I had the NS Lobster salad, and it was very tasty.  I will happily go back when I'm Toronto.

This is our go to restaurant before the opera.  They guarantee to get you out in time.  Both the atmosphere and food is fresh and fun.  They take dietary restrictions very seriously.  They were more worried about me being pregnant, and having my food cooked properly than I was.

The ambience is superb, the service is decent (will get more into that), but I'm not sure the food is worth its value.

Went to Nota Bene for a company...
I was there with a recommendation from AMEX, so they served us with the complimentary charcuterie board. I would say that I had pretty high expectations for...
I'll start off by saying if you haven't been here, book your table now! I really enjoyed my experience. My friend and I sat at the bar and ordered our...

reviews.text: Came here for Winterlicious 2018 the other day. I wasn't sure what to expect, as some of the photos I looked up online showed wedding food. But honestly the...

Hotels Tonight coming through for a mini, unexpected luxury.

We were planning to book through the app, but I figured why not stop in first and see what...
Great place to kick back with your laptop and work on afternoons or weeknights. Affordable drinks and not a sleazy crowd, also has coffee and snacks hat...

It's located on a main drag in Toronto. You're definately surrounded by the hustle and bustle but, the rooms are very quiet. They're located near food(especially because of being in Chinatown) entertainment, public transportation and a bike rental station. The staff was knowledgeable and pleasant The bathroom is amazing. The main rooms are simple in decor but, impressive. The bed was amazing. Big windows with lots of natural light.

Great location for China town and some great bars and restaurants. Nice to stay in a fun small hotel that has some life to it too. Great to get somewhere for a good price that is not like all generic hotels. Cool design, big industrial style windows. Great shower. Nice cafe bar over 2 levels. Enjoyed it very much.
Beautiful quaint hotel with a modern twist. Exquisite food, nicely stocked bar, comfortable beds and large (open concept) rooms with comfortable beds. Definitely recommend.
I come here with friends to drink at the bar of this boutique hotel. The atmosphere is great. It's a quiet, cozy, comfortable place to drink and chat with friends.

Loud as f*** AC that starts itself when turned off (Service program?!). The front door is locked at night and key didn't work on front door. We were informed on check-in that key would work. Found a side door that worked due to luck. Reception said 'ops' when we questioned the front door the next day. Throughout the night you heard constant flushing. Sound level is unacceptable. When I needed to leave in the morning the elevator did not work as it was locked by an employee... Breakfast is a bad bad excuse of a breakfast. Next time I am going back to their competitors on the other side of the steet!

Very disappointed, came here since I was in the area and the reviews looked good. I got the 6oz steak and shrimp, asked for medium rare but it came well...

Beautiful space, the most comfortable seating!

Wait staff and hostess are all delightful...On Christmas Day no less!

Candied butternut squash soup is very...

Simple & classic menu with a creative twist. I had the Butternut squash & spinach gnocchi dish, amazing! Quiet, cozy & still elegant. Staff is friendly and attentive. We would definitely plan another work function here.
It has been a family tradition for mothers day brunch for the last 5 years. Great food. Loved the anti pasto bar

Eaten here before during Anime North and the good is always delicious and staff for the most part very nice.  Just wish they would have someone standing by to escort someone to their seat or have a sign that says seat yourself or something but otherwise the staff are very nice
Very, very tasty and healthy lunch. Great ambiance.

It was ok.  Pricey and slow service, but decent food.

For example, it took them half an hour to bring a Coke, but they also comped it, so it's a little give and take.

A gleaming open kitchen extends into the airy dining room, featuring washed tin ceilings, leather banquettes and dramatic and distinctive light fixtures. The diverse menu offers something for everyone, including fresh, made-from-scratch soups, salads, sandwiches, pastas and fire-roasted pizzas.

reviews.text: Came here originally to have brunch but apparently they have have it on the weekend, the octopus was perfectly cooked, it's chewy but not difficult to chew...
I attended a brunch here yesterday. We came at 12:30 and it was very very busy!! Located in the ritzy area of Bayview village packed with elegant dressing...
Great location. Part of Bayview village. Staff is always friendly. Food is never a let down in my opinion. There is typically a bit of a wait time but it is...

I came over the weekend with the intention of having brunch, right before my massage appointment. It was fairly busy, with lineup out the door. Since I was alone, I was able to grab a seat right away at the bar. Yay! I ordered a smoked salmon egg Benedict croissant, and server said it will be ready in 20 minutes due to the high volume of customers. I didn't mind and ordered a mango peach mimosa while I waited. Mimosa was only $5 a glass!! It was a good price and I couldn't say no to that. As soon as I finished my mimosa, an older lady plopped down beside me. She was definitely a regular customer, and you can tell by all the hugs  and kisses she was giving to all the employees that worked there. By the time, I ordered a second mimosa, the lady beside me already got her quiche and salad?!!! I certainly felt neglected and had to inquire the server why my food was taking so long. When my food did arrive, I had to get it packed to go since I was running late for my massage. I was hoping to enjoy my brunch in the restaurant, but unfortunately that didn't happen. This experience did not make me feel like a valued customer, simply because I wasn't a regular customer. As soon I got to my car, it turned out they didn't even bother giving me any utensils or napkins?! Not sure whether I should return to this establishment or not...even though their brunch & mimosas are really good! :/

I had hoped for more. Been there 2x when visiting Toronto (my home),l. Convenient place to meet. That is the only reason I went  there the second time. Small town I live in has better restaurants than here.

I have been here multiple times. Can never say I've ever been impressed by the food, but this last time here was just too much. I ordered the steak (medium rare) and it was cooked to such, but it was the toughest, worst cut of steak ive ever had. Cutting through it was a definite chore requiring several passes before I could cut through. 

As for my friend, who ordered salmon, it was disappointing as well. The salmon was too salty. It overwhelmed the taste of the actual salmon. 

The only thing here that was good was the carrot cake. I would only come back here for a slice of that.

I have eaten here 5 or 6 times, each time out of convenience.   Gotta say that I have found it to be nothing special.  I think it's overrated.  I wouldn't go back by choice.  If I'm meeting friends or family and they want to try it or it's conveniently centeally located then sure, I don't have strong objections, but the food isn't so great nor is the decor so stunning as to make me count down the minutes until my next visit.

If you know Bayview Village from back in the day, before its upscale renaissance, then you'd remember Max's was here, and frankly I liked that place way more (not that the quality of food was better -far from it, but rather it had a more family friendly casual happy vibe that O&B can't come close to replicating).

My wife and I love this place for date night. We've also had a family reunion and a major birthday party in the party room. We've never been disappointed over the years by the food. The one time we had a bad experience, the management sorted the problems out on the spot. On our next visit, they went even further without us mentioning our last visit, and truly made us feel like they value our business.

lic_profile: ONE Restaurant is celebrity chef Mark McEwan's North American contemporary Yorkville hotspot. The stunning décor was fashioned by award winning design group Yabu Pushelberg. With low light and textured walls creating a sumptuous ambiance, it is the spot for entertaining. The tree-lined candle lit patio is the perfect place to sit back and savour ONE's culinary creations and unique signature cocktails, all the while taking in Yorkville's bustling and exciting street life. With dishes that will amaze the palate and an energetic atmosphere, ONE is sure to be an experience to remember.
