reviews.text:
My friend and I celebrated her birthday here a few days ago along with some other guests. We were very pleased to be seated on the patio with us being such a large party and all. 
The patio has an absolutely gorgeous set up with just enough privacy from the surrounding streets.
I ordered One’s version of a Moscow Mule and it was worth the hefty price. I think I can speak for the whole table that the food was delicious and arrived quickly. Our server was polite but a little on the shy side... good service regardless.

One of the best restaurants. The staff are wonderful. The restaurant has a nice atmosphere. They have really good quality when it comes to food. If you like lamb, you have to try the lamb chops. They also have some good selection of wine and you can ask for colourful drinks to be mixed up. They have the have parking on the street or right across there is a parking lot. This place is also great for big groups. They also have an amazing brunch menu. Must try if your looking in this area!

Five star service for sure every time you're there things just get done! Always great food today we had brunch which was steak and eggs that was the best I've had ever. Served it in a skillet like presentation. Highly recommended in Yorkville

Went the night of Jazz Fest and received a very surprisingly low quality of sevice from Eddy H; no eye contact, no water, did not know the wine menu, didn't take our order...hard to recommend. Additionally, treated other tables around with more attention that led us to ask another server to take our order, several times. Not what I expected at all.
Nice patio in Yorkville! Food was delicious had the jerk chicken there was really good. Also had a couple of bites of the turkey club sandwich which was amazing.
My friend and I decided to come here for no particular occasion because he was tempted by the pictures on Instagram from this restaurant. I emailed the...

3.5 I came here for my anniversary dinner during Winterlicious. I can't say it was the best food I've had but ONE was great for a special occasion.
One...

Came in on a Wednesday just past midnight.
Very dead and very very rude, full of attitude.. it's a hotel bar but supposedly they can do their last call at...

reviews.text: Was immediately greeted by friendly hostess. Excellent wait staff trying their best to accommodate everyone. Delicious food with amazing service and beautiful atmosphere. The white pizza and octopus are a must try and the new wine list are amazing. Fantastic place especially for groups! Most definitely will come back.

They have a good lunch menu where they let you choose between a fair amount of options, I think this is a sweet deal because you get to try different things and still get a delicious dessert (picture attached). The portions might be a bit small if you’re looking for quantity but the food is delicious and the portion was good enough for me to be honest. Loved the architecture and design of the restaurant.

Been here yesterday. The restaurant is really fancy and staff is well trained. Quality of the food is OK. We had rack of lamb and the char. But best thing here is the happy and fancy vibe! It’s a recommended venue in my opinion.

The decor is gorgeous. And our server (I forget his name) was very knowledgeable and friendly. His Italian accent added to the whole dining experience considering we were at an Italian restaurant. I got the salmerino dish. It was yummy although not filling during to it's small portion size. The military I donuts were warm and delicious. I'd recommend this place to others.

Came here for dinner after my graduation and I was slightly disappointed. Our food was okay, but I was really expecting more. My friend and I got the squash risotto which were both dry. My boyfriend got a pizza which was boring and bland. The only good meal was a pizza my mother got (don't remember the name but it had a white sauce base). The calamari was okay but nothing special. The banana bread for dessert was also just okay. Service was spotty - we had to flag down our server several times to get her attention, but she was nice. I'd come back for the apertivo hour for snacks and cheap drinks, but I wouldn't come back for full meals.
Oretta is a really nice place to go for its very nice interior designing! They have a circular bar in the middle so it's right in the centre of action and...
Busy Saturday night. We made reservations and the table was not ready because the previous guests were still seated. Should they not have the table ready in...
I was looking for a restaurant to host a dinner for a group in the King West area and I chose Oretta only because they allow large groups to order from...

For over 20 years, Paese has stayed true to a handcrafted and house-made approach to an Italian-inspired menu, with a distinctive and original made-in-Canada twist. The multi-region wine list is not only a wine lover's dream but is reasonably priced for all to appreciate. Enjoy!

The menu highlights the finest ingredients available from around the world with only the top choice of meat, fresh fish, extra virgin Greek olive oil and vegetables. The exclusive selection of fine wines includes the best of Ontario, Greece and sites around the world. Every Friday and Saturday enjoy a live Greek band and belly dancing shows.

reviews.text: Excellent Greek food, good service and awesome ambiance with retro chandeliers and cozy interiors. We had :Scallops and grilled calamari which were authentic greek style delicious and for mains : char grilled lamb Loins and lamb shanks and both dishes were spot on! Very well Done guys !

I went in for a late dinner. The place was full, nice ambiance, very well decorated, not loud. Very good entertainment from a band playing live and a belly dancer.
We ordered Sesame Baked Feta which was delicious! I also had the Filet Minion with grilled vegetables and definitely recommend it. I ordered it medium well and it was well done :(  but it still tasted well. For dessert we tried the Baklava but I must admit I've had better. They have a good selection of alcohol. 
I would go back. I really liked this place!

This place was amazing. We were looking for a Greek restaurant one night, and we remembered hearing about Pan. We got there, were fortunate to get a table for 5 immediately, and sat down to eat. The server was absolutely on point with the celiac-safe options, which was a huge relief. There was live Greek music, at one point a belly dancer started dancing around the tables, and the food was amazing. If you're down for dessert I strongly suggest the flourless chocolate cake. It was incredible. I fully intend to go again, and suggest you do to.
Awesome food..fun atmosphere.. belly dancing and live musicians on Friday night's.  My favourite Greek restaurant.

I live on the Danforth so I feel like I have a little more authority to say this place is top 😁 by far one of my favorites. They have it all: great ambience, the most friendly staff, amazing food and amazing drinks! To make it better, you might get lucky and watch a belly dance.
I came here for a friend's birthday on a Friday night and fell in love with the vibe and food. It's a small narrow restaurant with 2 comfortable  seating...
I'm not sure what went wrong here but maybe I went during Winterlicious, which was a bad choice.  Our dinner was mediocre at best.  We even ordered a...

Came here on a Saturday afternoon. The place was pretty empty (probably because it was -25 out). We were seated and brought waters right away.

They had a...

lic_profile: Parts & Labour offers a casual fine dining experience in a minimalist industrial design space. Located in the heart of Parkdale, this restaurant is outfitted with large communal tables and reclaimed lighting fixtures made of re-purposed fire extinguishers. Head Chef Benjamin Daiken's menu is a well balanced mix of international inspiration and contemporary takes on classic dishes. Boasting an impressive cocktail program, along with a wide variety of beer, spirits and wine, there is surely something to suit any palate. The organic rooftop garden and apiary contribute many ingredients to both the food and cocktail program, helping achieve the restaurant's goals in providing locally sourced sustainability. This energetic space is perfect for large groups and couples alike, whether it be a special occasion or a casual meal mid-week.

reviews.text: Good atmosphere. Food and service is decent. Table seatings are a little strange. Would recommend this for "friends catching up" kind of situation over a...
I came here for dinner with friends and got the Fried Chicken. It was just alright. It seemed to be their take on Chicken and Waffles but without the...

Came here for Summerlicious but was unfortunately was not impressed.

For appetizer we had the octopus and the beef salad. The octopus was pretty good and...

Went here for our anniversary and they treated us like royalty.  Brought out complimentary champagne and were very attentive!  We had the Nashville hot chicken, and it was delicious.  The parsnips and fries with malt vinegar aioli were also great.  Chocolate mousse with raspberry coulis and toasted meringue was a perfect ending.  The staff were wonderful, they'd be worth going back for even if the food was terrible!

I have been waiting to visit this place ever since watching Matty Matheson’s first burger video from vice when he was head chef. 

Tonight was incredible. I have never had such an amazing burger and the service was excellent. Everyone at the table couldn’t believe how good their food was. When I come back to Toronto I will absolutely be returning. Thank you for making my burger medium and cooking everything so perfectly.

Visiting from Australia and went
here because I watch the owner on youtube and he is hilarious. The food was delicious. Half price wine on a Tuesday as well so can't go wrong. We don't often order desserts but the donut and the chocolate mousse were so good! Glad we ventured out of town for this one!

I went there for my birthday last week and it was easily one of the best experiences I've had at a restaurant. The environment was great, staff was really helpful with recommending different items off the menu, I ended up getting the roasted cauliflower,  and lamb shoulder and they were spectacular, I'm still going on about it. They also have items on the menu that are a part meal share program, where they provide a meal for someone in need. There's nothing to not like about this place

Don't bother with cauliflower dish. They say it's the one of most popular dish but it ain't  worth your daily calories. What's worth try at here is the burger. Wednesday is burger + beer/bubbly special price day.

P&L also turn into a club in the night but disorganized entering system and extremely small low ceiling basement make the place hard to call it a club.

 Will definitely come back here for the burger but probably not for late night dance.

lic_profile: Peoples Eatery is a unique dining establishment that aims to celebrate the city’s cultural diversity with a menu that’s all over the map - but without fusion cuisine. Dishes are true to their respective origins and live happily together on a single menu, representing the city’s motto: ‘Diversity our Strength’. Chef/Partner Dustin Gallagher, recently of Top Chef Canada All-Stars, helms the kitchen with a menu driven by ‘crunch-to-squish ratio’, fun-to-eat, punchy-flavoured, technique-driven dishes. The bar program by managing partner, Matt See, includes carefully chosen beer, wine and cocktail lists which round out Peoples Eatery’s offerings. Dining at the bar or in a number of private spaces for larger groups makes Peoples a distinctively unique restaurant in an unexpected location: look for candle light in the front windows.

reviews.text: There is nothing that these guys do badly. Service is fast and friendly. Cocktails are delicious and interesting. Food is yummy and varied. I mean it’s not cheap, but not everywhere has to be cheap.
Always the best time amazing food people and drinks. So happy they're serving late night food Thurs-Sun

The People's Eatery shattered my expectations and was excellent on every level.  The carefully crafted menu is absolutely bursting with flavors and textures.  I'm a die hard carnivore and the fried tofu was off the hook satisfying.   The restaurant concept is an honest and clever take on what makes Canadian food interesting. 

The drinks were excellent as well as the service. Come early and see if you can find a quiet spot upstairs. If boisterous is your style the downstairs is great too. 

I am looking forward to going back and trying some of the large plates.
Great cocktails, great ambiance. Had a couple of drinks there and loved it - will definitely be back.

Nice cozy place with a small but interesting menu, they add a twist to their dishes. The chicken had a salty carmel taste to it. All the dishes ran a bit salty, but the consistent service made up for it. Interestly the waiter was a huge overwatch fan.

Such a good spot for a Friday night and here's why: 

1. The atmosphere 
The music here is fantastic if you're into drake, r&b, etc. It's such good vibes -...

Food was very good.
Service was slow. Not enough staff. Our waitress was also serving a group of 16 people and was too busy.
Ambiance is relax but a little...
I am torn on my review of this place. The ambiance, service and food is excellent (4 star level). However, the portion sizes are sooooo small for the price...

The kitchen serves Executive Chef Noah Goldberg's constantly changing menu of seasonally driven Canadian cuisine, steeped in French tradition with a smattering of cheeky British influence.

reviews.text:
Exploring the streets of Toronto, we stumbled upon this place and had to go in. (Huge Peter Pan fan)

We were welcomed by staff right away and enjoyed a...
Randomly decided to try this place out. We got the eggs Benedict with avocado.. it was probably the most untastiest (if that's even a word) eggs Benny I've...

TL:DR Nice place but I felt like I was getting pranked by the sight of the food.

not sure how to post photos if you're writing a review from your computer...

A wonderful, even whimsical, brunch experience. The food was delicious and well prepared. The service was attentive, kind, accommodating. The atmosphere is a combination of classic British tavern and whimsy. There was a wait but we were able to be seated relatively quickly. Overall a great experience and will definitely patronize again.

We had a marvelous lunch! Delicious croque-madame, wonderful glass of wine and terrific service. Next time we're in Toronto, I hope we get to go there again. It's also in a delightful part of town for shopping.

One of my favourite brunch spots in the city. It's so cozy, and there's always a wait for a table. Food is delicious, I love getting the fresh scones and in house made jam to start. The coffee is also incredible, it's infused with cinnamon and tastes delicious. My go to order is the vegetarian eggs Benny.
Great brunch spot. They move people through reasonably quickly so you don't wait too long, but never feels rushed. Always have good service here. Nice back patio when the weather allows.

Great service food was alright. Salmon on salad was cold...fish over cooked on the fish n chips n bacon burnt on the devils on horseback.  We did have lunch at 230 though. Service and caesers were delicious though

reviews.text:
Fantastic experience here. Went before a concert at The Opera House just down the road. Servers and Bartenders were very courteous and conversational, despite it being quite busy. A friend and I split a beer flight, which is five 5oz beers for a little over $12 l, and loved the opportunity to try something new. I ordered the Double-Decker Club Italiano with greens on the side and it was phenomenal.

All in all, a little pricey, but well worth the cost.

This place is a phenomenal beer selection, which I was very impressed with. In addition to plenty of other brews, the food is also amazing. Their mac & cheese is to die for. Their servers are super friendly and excited about what they do. This has become a go to spot in our neighbourhood and I strongly recommend.
Absolutely loved it here. Great service and drink specials. Delicious food. Loved the vibe and will definately return

Great tasting  bad for you foods are the ones that are the lowest priced. If you want something that is not artery clogging, be prepared to pay 20$ or more.
The beer selections are good and creative if you like trying new beers.

Happy hour here is pretty happening, from 5-7!  Great vibe here.  We got there for dinner at 7 and started with a Hemingway daiquiri which was delicious- not sweet at all and a little strong but quite nice. We then had Caesar salad and the nachos with pulled pork and wow 😮 we were so pleased it tasted great! The Caesar salad dressing tasted homemade, with real bacon and lots of pepper and it was fantastic!  I don’t typically eat pulled pork but I enjoyed it on the nachos.  All in all a great dinner 👍
this is my total go to when I'm in this area. It's a combo of a neighborhood bar and an upscale restaurant (without being pretentious). The drinks are...
After the Yelp Elite event, some of us wanted a few more bites plus beer. Upon recommendation from another Yelp Elite. We got quick seats at the chefs table...
It used to the go to for me and my daughter but the quality is not what is used to be... They have the same menu, correction they've reduced the menu.   Had...

lic_profile: Pukka offers a forward thinking take on Indian cuisine.  Featuring smart, zingy flavours, the menu is prepared by chefs each hailing from a different part of India. Dishes take you on a journey through decadent tastes, while maintaining a lightness that enchants the palette.

reviews.text:
May not be the traditional Indian food, but if you are looking to experience the amazing food with mesmerizing flavour-fulness in your mouth, better go now.

Sweet potato samosas, prawns
Boatman’s fish, butter chicken, and especially the Lollipop Lambs curry is the most amazing thing here.

Definitely worth visiting for a dinner.
Delicious Indian food with amazing service. Lamb lollipop was especially exquisite! Will definitely come back for more!

Amazing place with an amazing Indian cuisine. Totally recommend the butter chicken but everything we eat was brilliant. The portions are sharers to be fair. We eat so much in 5 with 3 mains and 3 sides. It’s such a treat.

Tried to have a nice dinner here yesterday with my wife but was denied service when I ordered a beer because I didn't have my ID on me (my wife was going to pay for the meal). Normally I would understand, but I'm 30 and don't look anything under 19. The server was going to give me the drink as she could tell I was over the legal drinking age but the manager stopped her from doing so. He was giving me cut eye ever since we walked in for some reason. Something tells me he didn't want me there based on the way I was dressed (hoodie and sweatpants). 

We left and went half a block down to the Rushton and enjoyed nice steak dinners with beers as the server there was able to tell the difference between a 30 year old man with his wife and a minor.

Oh, boy. Can't say enough about this place. Comfortable atmosphere and friendly staff make the experience enjoyable, but when the food comes, the feeling of enjoyment transforms into utter delight. I've had the opportunity to order many of the dishes on the Pukka menu, and haven't found one that I didn't love. Butter chicken seems to be the staple, but changing it up and ordering the steak vindaloo or beef short ribs is a delicious alternative. Well worth the price. Will be returning as often as my belly allows.

My partner and I were having a difficult time finding dinner reservations in the city for six people, as we were having a special dinner with family.
I...

My husband and I finally got a chance to have dinner at Pukka after planning for it over a year, and we were not disappointed! From the moment we walked in...

The service is warm and courteous, parking is free and the best local and imported ingredients are used. All cured meats and tomato sauces are made in house.

I had my birthday dinner at Pulcinella during the Summerlicious event which I strongly recommend. It's within walking distance from my house, Friday, summer...
The food/service is 5*!! Great selection of wine too. You're going to pay for the food and service though. A bit over priced and that's the only reason I'm...

Was here for a work Christmas party. The ambiance is good, good setting for a nice event. The preparation and organization for our event was decent but left something to be desired. Food was a bit above average but I expected better for the price.
Rating may be different if I go here on a date night as this may improve the overall experience. As for now overall it’s a decent place.

They've recently opened a wine bar next to the restaurant where you can order from the restaurant menu. Very nice if you want to have an appetizer with a glass of wine.  Shared a pizza and a salad on the patio. The patio faces the Lakeshore which can get a lot of traffic but the plants are lovely.

Service was so slow, 30 mins for an app to arrive and another 45 for dinner.  When we asked for bread the waitress acted like she was doing us a favour.  Then when the meal arrives our meat is overcooked and tough.  They again acted like they did us a favour taking it off the bill.  We sent it back after one bite! My fish dish was tasty though.  1 star for that.
Amazing Italian food at its best. Lovely family atmosphere and very friendly staff. As a fellow neighbour I'll come back again. The portions were a bit small and prices above average.
Terrible. Overpriced and tiny portions

Convenient, affordable parking is available across the street, below City Hall.

reviews.text: This was the perfect place for an afternoon snack and drinks after a lot of walking around town.  We had a seat at the bar and began to look over the beer...
Went here for winterlicious with a large group (16+ people). Waiter was extremely rude and looked pissed the whole time (we were very civilized the whole...

Made reservation for this place for 8:15. 

8:15 - checked in, told hostess I reserved a spot for 8:15. Hostess tells me it'll be a 15 min wait because...

I visited Quinn's with a number of colleagues for a business lunch last week. The menu was varied ( I had expected mostly steak ) and everyone in my group found something to their taste. We had two people who required special dietary considerations and they too were very satisfied with their options. My lunch was delicious; the flavours and combinations extraordinary. I was most impressed with our Server. She was knowledgeable, efficient and very pleasant. I would definitely return.
One of the best prime ribs I have ever had.  Amazing end cut!  The service and staff were fantastic.  I am looking forward to trying the lamb when I visit next.

We went to Quinn's for dinner and it was a great experience. From the service from the waiter to the food it was absolutely fantastic. The food was delicious, especially the crab cakes which I constantly crave. The steak was cooked exactly how I asked which was a big thing for me as it's either cooked well or raw at some other places I visited. The chicken was delicious from the few bites I had. We did order virgin ceasars which were also great. The desserts were also on point here. The creme brulee was amazing I felt like I should have ordered another. The pecan brownie I think it was was also great. They didn't cheap out on the desserts and were absolutely worth it.

Good times and delicious food. I had the lobster mac and I wouldn't change anything about it. The rest of the table had steak and the surf and turf, empty plates at the end so that must be a good sign. The service was a bit slow, for a New Years Eve dinner they should have been better prepared. The ambiance is fantastic to share a few drinks with friends or family. I like this restaurant because it's easy to book a table and the food is really good, considering the location it has attractive menu prices.
What an awesome restaurant. The decor is beautiful and the meals were served quick and were delicious and exactly how we all ordered them. Will return next time in Toronto.

reviews.text: Delicious, fresh and surprisingly unique food in a great location! I was very happy to find a neat blend of Dutch, Pan-Asian and Aussie style food. You wouldn't think there's a mix there but I had a hard time choosing what to eat it all seemed so good. Also, I had the kangaroo burgers which were delectable!!!

I loved this place! Very different and unique menu, which is difficult in this day and age. I loved the Dutch-Asian-Aussie combo cuisine and loved the kangaroo burgers! Service was fast and effecient and the food was fresh, hot and delicious!

Don't hesitate to give it a visit!

This place was delicious!  The menu has Indian and Dutch influences.  The food was fresh and the drinks (I had the Momosa) were refreshing.  They have high tea for two from 3-5 every day.  I'm hoping I have time to go back!

I am a frequent patron and I often bring clients and friends.  The food and service are consistently excellent. The menu is creative and has more than sufficient breadth to satisfy any customer. Dining is always an excellent experience.
Awesome food. Great service. Owner is friendly and professional. Super recommended :)
I came upon the Real Mo-Mo's after some research ahead of my trip to Toronto and I was impressed. If you like Dutch food, this should already be on your...

The mo-mosas hit the spot. 
For apps we had the bitterballen...

lic_profile: Located at one of Toronto's busiest intersections at Yonge and Gerrard, REDS Midtown Tavern offers an upbeat social dining experience. The spacious restaurant features two levels and a unique bar area with exposed brick creating a warm and fun atmosphere. The chef-inspired menu is paired with an extensive beer and wine list, not to mention the intriguing gin and cocktail menus.  All catered for you to unwind, relax and stay a while.

reviews.text: I ordered the Goat Cheese & Beet Salad to start ($16.45). Our server was kind enough to inform us the salad is mostly arugula in the middle and the goat...
YUM! I stopped into Reds Midtown Tavern with a friend while I was staying in Toronto. It was a Friday night at about 6:30pm and we were surprised to see...
Went here because I really wanted the two bite butter tarts. I had them at the square one location and figured since I was down in the city I would fulfill...

Classy place and excellent food. However the service at the bar was very slow as they only have one bartender working at all times. This results in long wait times just to place an order. I saw a customer at the bar leave after not being served for 10 minutes. The bar is fairly long and can seat up to at least 30 people. If you want to maintain good reputation then you need to staff more than one bartender, especially on a weekend afternoon.

The atmosphere is nice with cozy lighting and a variety of seating options, from hightops to booths. Service was good. The music was a little too loud for my liking and made conversation across the table a little tough at times. I was surprised there were TV's in this place, did not seem like the right fit given the rest of the atmosphere. Mixed drinks were okay - the old fashioned was far too sweet for my liking. A decent value.

Went here for food with partner and parents, lots of choice on the menu and some good deals as well, great value for money. Everything was super tasty, the chicken and roast potatoes I had were cooked to perfection and the seasoning was super tasty. Chocolate chess pie dessert was again amazing, and we also had a glass of sangria which was perfect. Staff were really friendly and welcoming, they even brought my mum some extra raita as she underestimated the spiciness of her curry. Seriously one of the nicest meals out I've ever had, would definitely recommend this to anyone visiting Toronto.

No thanks!
I mentioned to the waitress that I'm gluten free and asked if I could substitute the Yorkshire pudding that comes with the prime rib, for fries. The waitress said no and didn't care to offer anything else. She wasn't friendly.
My brother and I both ordered our steaks medium. They both were undercooked and we had to send them back. The music was so loud that we struggled to hear eachother across the table and our ears are still ringing. We couldn't wait to leave.
Wow, this is a great place. Fabulous service from Aaron! Great flavourful steaks, cooked just as requested. We will come back. Highly recommended!🤣

Genuine service is both intuitive and thoughtful. Knowledgeable staff deliver a hospitality experience using the finest that Spanish, Italian, French, Greek and Canadian cuisine offers in food and drink.

reviews.text:
My friend and I had the lamb burger today. Unfortunately they were out of french fries so we stuck with a side salad. It was very basic and relatively flavorless and tasted like they had used only olive oil as a dressing. No salt and pepper on the table.

The Lamberger came and it was really nicely seasoned, but the soft flavored cheese and a dull flavored caramelized onions didn’t contribute anything to the burger. The bun was Beautiful to look at, but far too thick and difficult to eat for the size of the burger, and was also kind of crumbly and felt like it was baked yesterday instead of being fresh. The atmosphere was great and it’s a busy spot for lunch, but at least today’s selection was not anything spectacular.

Some tables around us had the flat bread served and they smelled and looked amazing so I would definitely try that if you’re a first timer. Sandwiches and flat breads or even advertise on the glass outside even though that is only four items on the entire menu. I didn’t see any sandwiches anywhere on the menu which is unusual if it’s advertised on the front windows.

I probably won’t be back because there are too many wonderful restaurants in the city to try one a second time after a mediocre dining experience.

It's a beautiful spot for sure. The decor and setup is lovely. Points for a beautiful, bright atmosphere.

The service has always been quite good so I can't complain there.

That said, while quite tasty, the food portions are very small across the board. 

Also, for a place with a dedicated cafe attached to it the coffee/espresso is terrible. Even the servers warn against it.

We went for Mother's Day brunch a party of  seven, prior to reserving we had asked specifically if they have vegan options, they ensured us that yes indeed they have vegan options and therefore we proceeded with our reservation. Only two of our party we're vegans, I was shocked at how little the options were for  $60 a person brunch, the selection was very limited. The beef option was completely rare and if you did not like rare meat, too bad for you, t they said sorry there's nothing I can do. I ordered eggs Benedict and asked the server to please request for the egg to b e prepared  medium her response was yes that's how they're all made, the egg came approximately 40 minutes later and they were barely cooked. The worst part was that there was really no vegan options at all. The waitress stated that she would charge only $35 for the vegan people at our table. Our bill came she charged us full price and said sorry there's nothing I can do. Terrible service not that great food not worth going at all. Too many great food options between Burlington and Oakville to waste our time here. You can go to the water Street cooker for $35 and have 10 times more options and much better service. This place will not last long!

Hands down the best brunch I’ve ever had. Food was incredible, service was amazing and the restaurant in itself is beautiful. Very clean and organized. We were treated to a fabulous time, definitely coming back with friends and family. All together we had the Marinated Salmon Toast with Avocado, the Steak and Eggs, the Croissant Croquet Madame, Blueberry Pancakes and Banana Bread French Toast. Would highly recommend all of them!

Came for the Monday $2 any drink (espresso based) special and left with a flat white and a beef sandwich.  A beautiful but overly priced restaurant/menu.

The sandwich was crafted well, a bit over salted with the finishing salt though.  The flat white was strong and could use a bit more micro foaming technique.

All in all I would come back for the coffee.

There are tables that surrounds the restaurant on the outside for those grabbing from the quick-to-go counter.  This is nice since it is a much more toned down relaxed environment than the beautifully designed upscale on the inside.

More sustainable methods should be considered since their bins are always overflowing and well, looks really bad with all the paper cups, plastic lids, stir sticks etc that are clearly going to the landfill.

Would love to come for dinner but the menu and the price, to me doesn't seem worth it.  Just my two cents.

4.5/5 for my experience planning a major event and for bakery food!

After getting feedback from past formal events, one organizer recommended that we look...

Under the guidance of Executive Chef Gino Marchetti, the menu highlights fresh, seasonal ingredients in delicious and authentic Italian dishes. Whether it's an intimate dining experience for two or a family gathering to celebrate life's milestones, the staff at Ristorante Boccaccio take pleasure in ensuring that your experience extends beyond dining.

Not too bad hidden gem in an unusual spot. It's a good place for business lunch

I have been coming 4 times and was told different excuses about why they cant serve us. 4 times!  They are rasists im sure now. Please lets stop this guys.

The dining room was white linen and very somber.  The maitre d was quite brusque and impatient in explaining the menu.  The other staff were more friendly.  My friend and I shared the artichokes which were very nice although canned.  I had the gnocchi which was so so and the sauce very acidic and needed salt.  I had to ask for for more water.  Overall mediocre.

The restaurant was completely empty when I arrived, and remained empty until the end of our meal, when one other party arrived. 

The restaurant itself was...

lic_dinnermenu: A variety of appetizers and salads served buffet style, including smoked salmon, mussels, mango salad, avocado salad, kale salad, octopus salad and many more.
A succulent variety of meat specially prepared and precisely cut to perfection., including assorted cuts of  pork and chicken, a variety of angus beef, and the famous pichanna.
Flip the red/green card on your table to green signaling the meat cutters to begin serving you. The red signals the servers to give you a break.
Served with a variety of side dishes including grilled vegetables, potatoes, and rice and beans.
lic_profile: Rodeo Brazilian Steakhouse offers a unique dining experience that includes an amazing assortment of prepared fresh daily salads on their appetizer table and a wide assortment of perfectly cooked and seasoned meat served Brazilian-style on large skewers. Enjoy an old Brazilian tradition in Toronto surrounded by bosa nova sounds while sipping on delicious lime caipirinhas.

reviews.text:
My family took me here for my birthday on May 19th and we really enjoyed our time here 
Our server Sunni was SO nice and really bonded with you by...
This is the second Brazilian bbq I've been to and I have to say both my S.O. and I agree that this place is better than the more well known Brazilian bbq...

This review is tough for me to write because I have mixed feelings about this place.

Here's why. I took my friend here for her birthday on a Friday because...

Flawless experience. As a Brazilian, that was pretty much what I would expect from any great Brazilian stakehouse. The food was 100% authentic and of high quality. The service was a big surprise to me due to how good it was. The music was enjoyable and the amenity was very comfortable. I'm definitely coming back.

Meats and salads were so fresh and tasty. Servers were so friendly and professional. We enjoyed the live music and dance show. Absolutely perfect. Cant wait to go again. Best Brazilian restaurant in the city!
Only been here once but the experience left a lasting impression. Great place for a special occasion. The food service is top notch.

This place in unreal! The food here is absolutely delicious, the servers walk around with various meats on swords and cut it for you at the table! They have a live band that and dancers that are there every Friday and Saturday night - not something you see anywhere else! Definitely somewhere to go for a fun night out that's different from your typical Toronto night-life experience.

Unbelievable,  we had a supprised Birthday Party Saturday night and it was a blast, the management and especially Susanna was superb in helping us planning and executing the perfect night. Our party of 24 had a great time, great value for your money too, highly recommended.

At Ruth's Chris, your steak is carefully selected from the finest USDA Prime beef available and served with gracious hospitality.

reviews.text: This is probably the BEST steakhouse i have ever been to.  I have seen a lot of good reviews about Ruth's Chris, and when i heard we having dinner there i...

Ruth Chris is where we go if we want to spoil ourselves with a top quality steak: custom-aged USDA Prime Midwestern beef, to be exact.

AMBIANCE: 
We were...

Ruth's Chris is located below the ground level at the south east corner of Adelaide W and University Ave at the Hilton Hotel.

I like Ruth's.  The last time...

Great service here and they were very accommodating for our large party of 14 people. The waiter was helpful and had great menu recommendations. The steak here is definitely different from other places. The quality and the way each dish is prepared is unique and something I can appreciate. This is a high cost restaurant so if you do come here plan to spend around 100$ per person factoring into account tax and tip. I ordered the New York steak and it was the best I've ever had. Asked for it well done and it came medium. They put it back on the grill and within minutes it came out perfectly well done. Excellent service and would recommend to anyone looking for a fancy dinner.

The food is amazing, but the service is like no other! The servers are genuinely kind, super helpful and patient. Let’s not forget very well versed in the menu.

The food was delicious! Everything from the steak cooked to perfection, with the perfect amount of blue cheese crust, and the sides just melt in your mouth too. Everything from the bacon Brussels sprouts, to the cheesy scalloped potatoes or the mushrooms and Demi glaze that is just.... drool worthy really!

Had a great time. Quite the experience and will definitely be back soon!

Well worth the cost! Located beneath the Toronto Hilton, this location is very easy to find or instruct a taxi to get to. Close to Osgoode TTC subway station so you can always take public transit instead. Parking is very expensive as you must park in the Hilton underground parking lot or walk quite a distance to the nearest Green P. The food here is delicious! The steaks are cooked perfectly or they'll fire up a brand new one for you! The sides are delicious and the service is excellent. If you haven't been here, try it once. I promise you'll be back!

Amazing steak house, made perfectly per your liking. If its your first time the servers make sure you have a full experience of the atmosphere and food. 
Ps. Their plates are super hot as they are heated on 500 degrees temperature right to your table

Had a wonderful anniversary dinner at the Ruth's Chris. Food was delicious, portions were big and the over all experience was just fantastic. Our server was such a sweetheart and brought us complimentary cake to celebrate our anniversary...

lic_profile: R&D is a bold and modern restaurant in the heart of Toronto’s iconic Chinatown. Buzzing with youthful energy and 90’s R&B, the space features graffitied walls, funky lighting, and double-height ceilings. The eclectic menu offers a variety of modern Asian sharing plates, each with their own playful flare, as well as an extensive and spirited cocktail list.

reviews.text:
Great Atmosphere and Wonderful Food! 

My partner and I wanted to try R&D ever since we found out they serve Peking duck. We made reservations for Friday...
We have been looking forward for some time to try R&D Restaurant in Toronto.   After all, it's not everyday one eats food prepared by a MasterChef Canada...
Got the sweet and sour pork which was yummy but didn't significantly wow me. It was a plate full of meat! I was hoping to pair the sweet and sour pork with...
The duck is to die for! At first the food were pretty good, and then the duck came and changed how I view this place! It was juicy, thic, skin crispy... amazing! Service was also nice and tentative.

Wish I had more stars to give! The servers are lovely, the open kitchen allows the chefs to strike up conversations with guests and make sure theyre enjoying their food (has happened to me twice so far). 

Considering how nice the location is and how incredibly well made the meals are, this place could charge double what they currently are, and I'd pay it without blinking

We went as a group of 10 on New Years Eve for my birthday. We had one server Arthur, who was super attentive and fun! On such a busy night with a big party, I was so impressed with the level of service. The food was incredible, we got 2 ducks. It was by far the most delicious duck I’ve ever had. The Boa is basically like eating a fluffy cloud. Another dish we enjoyed was the octopus which was tender on the inside and crispy on the outside, not at all rubbery. The cocktails  were very good too! Our table tried them all and we loved each of them. Aside from the food and service the actual restaurant has a great vibe!

Best Duck Ever!!!! Okay I got that out of my system.  Now the review.  We went there for my wife's birthday (also New year's eve).  Arthur was our waiter. His attentiveness made the evening and our experience so great.  Drinks are really good.  We had a big group so everyone ordered something different from their special cocktail menu and everyone loved their cocktail. Food is fantastic here.  The duck is so amazing.  I was surprised when they came to explain how they prepare the duck, but once I took my first bite I understood why they need to explain.  The duck here is a must!!! If you try anything it should be it.  I really liked their BAO (the house special one) and fried rice.  I only took picture of the duck (don't worry more to come soon).  I would highly recommend this place.

Great spot, cool interior / decor. Our server was friendly, knowledgeable and made appreciate food suggestions. They had a great drink special from 5-7 pm and each drink was delicious! Great spot for taking advantage of the drink special. Bathrooms are cool, great wall art for those Toronto bloggers, or just anyone wanting to get a cool picture. 

My only suggestion would be to dim the lights a little more it was somewhat bright.

reviews.text: Staff are very friendly and the food amazing, the service was very good. The prices are reasonable and the menu selection is very good. The lava cake was to die for. The place is very cozy and inviting. Great place for a intimate dinner or with friends. I will defiantly go again the next time I am downtown.

Amzing food! Amazing service! Went there for dinner and they were serving set dinner menu. I wanted to try their mushroom risotto which was not in the set menu. Upon requesting them, they were very kind to adjust and prepare risotto for us. Our server was a very pleasant and polite. I loved the food. Delicious risotto. The shrimp coconut was very good too.

Went there today at lunchtime. The waiter took my good order and left before I could add anything (I wanted a drink other than water). Then, 15 minutes later came back to "confirm" my order... Which was incorrect. So...he didn't even put my order in yet. I was on a time limit so once the food finally arrived, I had to rush to finish it. I ordered the avocado chicken club. The chicken was a very charred "flavour", otherwise flavourless, and very dry. The waiter didn't bother checking in with me at any point. So, I didn't leave a tip as I was generally very unsatisfied. I didn't hear him "greet" anyone else like he did me as I was leaving either. I suppose he was upset I didn't leave a tip because he kept wishing me a "great day" quite loudly more than once. Lol Anyways, $17 wasted.

Long standing church street spot. Nice wines and good food. Always a good set menu as an option and not too pricey.   Service has always been friendly and attentive without ever being too much when I have visited and the food has always been delicious and fresh
Great prices, good tasting food. At training so quick lunch was important. Friendly, attentive service.
Sambucas is great. Winterlicious, summerlicious, and any day in between! You truly get the most bag for your buck here so you don't ever feel like you've...

Last dinner for summerlicious for 2017.
Enjoyed the atmosphere for the restaurant. Service was great.

Got a plate of mussels, steak & lobster, and a...
With Summerlicious prix fixe meals, I never expect anything above decent.  What I've always gotten in the past were dishes that were "child-size", albeit...

lic_profile: Set in an array of Victorian row houses, Sassafraz is located in the heart of historic Yorkville. Sassafraz has "seen it all" from the early hippie movement of the 60's to the lack of movement that comes from too much Bordeaux. Sassafraz specializes in market-driven, French inspired Canadian cuisine. Dine in their elegant dining room featuring a living wall and waterfall or in their more casual cafe bar.

reviews.text: We went to Sassafraz for lunch today and it was generally not a great experience.  I asked for a bottle of sparkling water and waited 10 minutes for it to arrive.  I thought it was a bit flat but when I spoke to the waiter, he said that this type of water was not as fizzy as Perrier and I could have soda water instead.  That seemed reasonable but then it took another 10 minutes to get soda water.  I ordered a salad with chicken and the chicken was  RAW.  I took a bit and it was cold so I cut another piece and it was raw inside.  I sent it back and then told them to cancel the order as my husband was going to be done eating by the time the new meal arrived and also because I was a little turned off by the RAW chicken.  At some point, the manager came out and apologized and said she would comp the meal.  I thought this meant the whole meal since all I had was flat, sparkling water and a glass of soda but instead, we got the bill for our appetizer and my husband's salad.  I thought the waiter made a mistake so after my husband paid, I asked the manager for clarification, did she really only mean to comp my water?  Her reply was yes, she was comping my "meal".  I told her I was disappointed in the whole experience and she said she would take very good care of me next time.  I am not sure there will be a next time.  I understand that kitchens make mistakes, that servers can be slow, but the manager should have handled it better in my opinion.  It was almost insulting to be comped for the water!

Love this place. Food is great, service is amazing. We sat at the bar and the two guys bar tending were awesome. Really friendly staff and very professional. There are no bad seats in the restaurant either. Everywhere is great but especially love the couches.

I am being generous with the two stars and that is only because the decor and the service were great. Other than that, the food was terrible. We went for Father's Day and were looking forward to delicious food. This wasn't the case. My mother ordered their meatballs as her starter (she received 3 tiny meatballs in what seemed like bottled sauce), my husband ordered samosas as his main (3 tiny samosas that tasted like they were previously frozen) arrrived at the table. Our fries were salty (everyone at the table complained how salty their fries tasted). The ceasar salad was pretty good and had anchovies on it. Overall this restaurant is definitely not worth the value for your money.
Their main dish was nice but didn't like how sour the salad taste. They could have asked us if we wanted vinegar on the salad or not. Other than that it was a nice place
Great place for a romantic dinner. Service and staff were amazing , food was plenty and good. Very relaxing and calming atmosphere
Two weddings and a dinner, that's what it took for me to finally pen a review for this iconic Yorkville restaurant. The was a dinner many years ago, and...

Good place for a date night.  Located at Yorkville, this restaurant has an easygoing atmosphere.  Service was attentive...really attentive.  

We got two...
Sunday Brunch should be special, classy and trendy. That's exactly what brunch at sassafraz entails. The lavish resturant is located in the heart of...

reviews.text: This place was recommended to us by another local bar as a great place to eat.  We were specifically told to try the meatballs.  Boy, am I glad we listened...

Come here every so often, mostly for the fresh mozzarella and fresh pasta, it's surprisingly competent for a chain restaurant.

Order the truffle mozzarella...

Our meal was surprisingly very good!!! I had the pasta sorrentina regular size, which is enough for two people!   
We were here during dinner time on a...

First time ... we enjoyed ourselves immensely.   Staff friendly and helpful.  Management flowed seamlessly with staff and helped where they were needed. The food was enjoyable and tasty.  Great lively atmosphere.   We are looking forward to our second visit.
Amazing!! I sat at the bar, my server was sooo attentive, he informed me on menu, food and drink specials. He went out of his way to dim the lights for me, since I complained they were too bright

Instantly became one of my favourite restaurants since the first time I went a few years ago. Wonderful atmosphere, friendly staff and exceptional food quality. The mozzarella ball is a must! Very reliable choice and often my default go to option when I can't decide where to eat. All around great vibes, whether you're feeling a classy date night or casual dinner with friends.
Fast service. Incredible flavors. Fresh made pizza that NAILS IT! Gotta cut it with some pizza scissors! So many great flavors. Meatballs the size of a softball- YUM.

Decent prices, large portions, delicious food. The patio area is decent in the summer. This restaurant is quite close to the financial district, University and the hospitals, therefore frequented mostly by the after work crowd from the above establishments. Recommend the pastas which are large enough to be a meal even without appetizers or desserts. They do have lunch portions for those that are watching their carb intake.

reviews.text:
Got veal schnitzel and was yummy.
Mash potatoes were really creamy and tasty as well. The bread roll and compound butter that came with it was also good. 
The coleslaw that came was blah but it is rare that I like coleslaw from most places anyway. 
I wish I didn't put any lemon on top of the schnitzel as the cranberry sauce tart enough. That was my bad. 
Wish the portion was little bigger but still happy. 
The servers were really good which isn't a note I always make. The interior was really nice was well, clean, classic.

I was part of a large group attending for a birthday. The food was good and the portions were generous. The server was very attentive and helpful. 

While it is not fully wheelchair accessible, there are no steps or lips at the entrance door. There is a large single-user restroom on the main floor, though it does not have an automatic opener. This restaurant is accessible for the ambulatory disabled and may be usable by some wheelchair users. 

My wife has several food allergies so it was important we find out what ingredients may be in the food and what oil is used to prepare it. Our server was very helpful in answering our questions, getting full details from the kitchen. While our choices were limited by this we were very grateful that they took the matter so seriously.

The meal and service impressed me and I certainly recommend Schnitzel Hub.

P. S. A nice selection of beers too.

Had the pleasure of eating here today and i have to say i was thoroughly impressed. Cant wait to come back ! Im not sure why some reviewers claim this place to be expensive... it is VERY reasonably priced.
The sausages meal is excellent. I recommend a side of their home fries instead, though. Beer is good, but expensive.
Everything from the service to the decor to the food is great. One on my favourite restaurants in Toronto
Came here last night for Winterlicious 2018. After doing another winterlicious restaurant a few days ago, my expectations were set so high for this place,...
We came here for $38 Summerlicious menu as we were starving in this area of the city.  I grabbed the gravlax carpaccio, veal jaeger schnitzel and we split...
Good selection of beer, but the quality of food does not match the price tag.  The food does not taste at all like it does in the home country.  The...

reviews.text: Great place for having good conversation but agree with most that the food is only average.  In fact, I enjoyed my appertizer (grilled calamari) a lot more...
Went for winterlicious dinner. Food was very sub par especially considering the price. I wish I was exaggerating in saying I'd rather go to McDonald's. Not...
My colleagues and I were hosting visiting delegates from Hong Kong and decided to make reservations here for lunch. Its proximity to the university and...

My guest and I accidentally arrived to the restaurant very late due to a misunderstanding (probably an hour or so before closing), but the service was absolutely fantastic and I never felt rushed throughout the meal. Our dinners tasted wonderful, and the calamari was easily one of the best I've ever tried. The restaurant is also beautifully decorated to the point I'd probably return just to eat a meal in their lower lounge area. I also saw that they're apart of Summerlicious this year, so I'm hoping to return for an earlier dinner next time!

Both times we were there - for dinner and then for breakfast while we stayed at the hotel - it was not busy at all. Lovely environment. Perfect lighting and interesting features to draw the eye. The dinner food was great. The breakfast was pretty ordinary (and hence very overpriced). While we enjoyed it and the convenience of it being right in the hotel (so we didn't have to leave the building at -17°C ) I would not choose to go there for the restaurant itself.
Kids and I really like this place for weekend breakfast and brunch
Has a cheap feel to it. Breakfast was horrible. Even the basic egg Benedict was messed up. Fruits were not fresh. Worst hotel and restaurant I have been to by far.

Pleasantly surprised how high quality the diner was. Servers were all wonderful.
Actually enjoyed my dessert which is rare for me.

lic_profile: Smith provides a cozy, casually elegant and intimate dining experience for those seeking high quality food in a comfortable and approachable environment. A fusion of southern comfort food and French countryside cooking results in a menu well equipped to satisfy. "Dishes range from colourful and carefully crafted salads to hefty side-stretchers that leave any and everyone beaming with fulfilled satisfaction before they even reach the famous Smith desserts that only further the bliss."  Smith also serves a range of cocktails and a selection of carefully chosen wines and beers.

reviews.text:
Food: 4/5

Service: 4.5/5

Atmosphere: 4.5/5 

Went here for brunch on a Sunday with a few other friends and we waited for about 15 minutes. We were seated...
I had high expectations for Smith and wasn't disappointed. My party of three made a reservation for Sunday morning brunch a few days in advance. I highly...

This place has two floors in a beautiful building. This place is a bit of a treat though, as it's $$. 

The service is great and patient as well. I came...

This place has 3 floors, and a patio for nice summer days. I really liked the decor and the mirrors on the highest floor made the place look a lot bigger than it is. I ordered the pancakes ($15) and a white tea ($4) from their weekend brunch menu. The pancakes had a really nice blueberry cream & maple cream cheese sauce on it, but I thought they didn't have enough for all of the 3 pancakes. I also only ate one and a half pancakes, since they are pretty dense and filling. I was hoping for a lighter, fluffier pancake. Overall, pretty good! I will probably come back next time to try something else.

Smith is very busy on weekends! We tried to make a reservation at 11am on a Sunday a few days before, but the only slot they had available was 1pm. For reservations, they will only take you to your table if the whole party is there (which is understandable). Even though my friends were 15-20 minutes late, they were very accommodating, and I appreciate that. Very organized despite all the people waiting to eat here.

The Smith is an amazing place for a boozy weekend brunch! The drinks are delicious, very well made, and, not to forget, strong. The food is delectable, typically British. The atmosphere is chic but comfortably chill as well. The service is fast and the servers are friendly and warm. The washrooms are beautiful, and not a second thought.

Perfection. Out of the way of the mess Toronto has become, but not far at all from the action. Decor is to die for; their overflowing collection of design awards is obviously well deserved. The food is elevated yet unpretentious, unique but not outlandish. Go for the exquisite prosciutto wrapped seared yellow fin tuna while your date enjoys a classic fish and chips with a special Smith twist. From entrance to exit, every detail of this restaurant is thoughtful and it truly translates into the guest experience. 

Their front of house staff are all absurdly attractive, too.

The menu is the perfect size to me. Very nice atmosphere, a bit eclectic and cozy. Friendly staff and knowledgeable of their products. Food was good. The grilled sandwich with tomato bisque on the side was delicious. Will definitely be returning once back in Toronto.
Very nice brunch. The potatoes side for their benedict eggs was not perfect. The avocado toast was very well done. Nice atmosphere. Also nice for drinks

lic_profile: Recently relocated to College Street, Southern Accent continues to charm with southern hospitality and proudly serve the tastes of New Orleans with its spicy blend of Cajun, Creole and soul cuisine.

reviews.text: I am absolutely in love with this place.  My boyfriend surprised me by taking me here last Thursday and everything was so great. when walking in to the venue, it had such an intimate vibe.  Very welcoming and the art work in there is amazing.  You really feel that New Orleans Bourbon Vibe.   The food was so tasty.  the blackened Lamb was so tender and that creole flavour was superb.  We had a waitress by the name of Jade which made us feel so comfortable and explained the menu to us in such knowledge which was awesome. Out of 10, Jade gets a 10.  I believe we have found our new spot. We will be visiting again very shorty.  I Highly recommend this restaurant!!

Amazing food/drink menu . One of my favorite spots in the city!  Great staff . Food is top notch. Very affordable. 
Thanks again guys! Keep up the good work!

Honestly one of the best restaurants in the city. Their brunch is incredible and so unique. Large portions, amazing flavour in everything, and the staff are so friendly and accommodating.

Service is very quick. Music is great. The decor is very charming and cozy.

Come eat here. You won't be disappointed.

I went here for a first date with someone I met online. I picked it by googling "Southern food Toronto " and it was the first result. It was risky, but it paid off completely.

I arrived early and was greeted by who I can only assume was my guardian angel, my server, Mark. I would wrote an Ode to Mark were I a more creative person. I found out later it was only his third shift as a server at Southern Accent. How? he was incredible. He recommended our drinks, they were great, he recommend our appetizer, the calamari which was delicious and we trusted him so much by the end of it, we asked him to choose our main courses. He chose the blackened lamb and jambalaya. They were perfect. The blackened lamb is the best lamb I have ever had in my life. I have to say this place was phenomenal but the service is really what put it over the top. I am going to create an App for Mark to make all of my life decisions from now on, because God knows it would be better than any choice I would make. Come for the food, stay for the service!

I would give 5 stars to this place. 
I was walking on College looking for a place to eat and came in to Southern Accent. 
The restaurant is very cozy.
Nice and cool atmosphere. 
Romantic table sets.
Food: Healthy made with quality ingredients. 
Wine: Portuguese red wine was very good. 
Price: Good prices.

Must try: Jerk Wings

Came here when they were doing a $5/lb jerk wings and $10 bourbon sour and really enjoyed the food and the atmosphere.

The jerk wings...

Came for Winterlicious. Everything was okay, but it didn't live up to the hype. 

Food 3/5:  For my app I had the oyster rockefeller, which was a bit too...
First time visiting this restaurant and went with the Winterlicious special. First impressions: Limited lighting to take nice photos. Washroom has...

reviews.text: The food that I got was phenomenally made (Baja fish tacos with a little lime for zest!) but the service was on the poorer side. I definitely would rate...
Came here on a weekday after work with some friends and was surprised by how nice the place was! They have three types of tacos on their menu and we got one...
I was a bit surprised by this place. I came here after work on a Tuesday, just after 5 probably, on a Tuesday. I've walked by this place in the summer and...
Amazing venue! Booked it for a private party and staff were incredibly accommodating. Drinks were amazing and the space was perfect!
Drinks were great. Food looker like it came from the frozen food section of your local grocery store. Server couldn't be found

This place was quite disappointing, they label themselves as a great cocktail spot with a tapas style menu. Neither of these statements hold true. Upon entering it felt more like an overplayed Mexican restaurant which would have been great had that been the experience we were seeking. Horrible mislabeled. The service was okay, food mediocre, the waitress seemed annoyed as she took my order and even became argumentative when I asked why the margarita didn’t contain Cointreau or tripple sec. Will not be back, there are many better actual cocktail bars in the city.
Great place downtown for after work drinks and appetizers. Loved the patio. Great for people watching.

The ambiance was nice, typical of a financial district resto-bar. The food was ok; not bad but nothing special. The fish in the fish tacos was over fried. It was a decent experience. I wouldn't oppose to coming back if a friend suggested it, but I wouldn't voluntarily pick this place.

lic_profile: The Spice Route's mixture of eclectic Asian decor, mesmerizing music and distinctive cuisine is the soul of this spot. The decor is relaxing and indulging. The service is meticulous, yet unpretentious. The refined culinary approach offers something to satisfy everyone.

reviews.text: was there this weekend and had a bottle girl believe her name is Christina/Christine she was by far one of the best staff I have came across in a while. She was attentive, professional, and had great customer service skills.

The journey was long and arduous. We were heavily laden with goods and sundries bound for the far East, thirsty and desperately tired as we made our way through spice route. 

Our thirst was limitless as we sheltered ourselves from the storm outside, our dreams of idly whittling away the night distant memories as we pushed ourselves onward. 

The sound was deafening, and bodies hot as we made our way through the route, holding on to the meagre bottles which were both our lifelines and our only escape from the terrors of this spring night.

Our determination was an aegis, a bulwark against hopelessness as we found meaning,  purpose, and drunken cheer along this long, winding road.

As the storm grew in strength, I became separated from my companions, and my memories of that night are hazy. Surely we made it out, but what became of them? I don't know.

Scattered images from that night rise through the haze of my broken mind like torches through a dense fog. Faint traces of music remain with me. The roaring of the storm, a backdrop to a crushing throng of bodies, flashes through my mind like lightning. Images come unbidden, tracing out in faint lines the singularity of our purpose.

Our resolve saw us through the night, and towards our destination. Most of us, at least. Surely what they say is true: the spice route is not for the faint of heart.

Don’t waste your time, or money. Restaurant is very cold. Food is flavourless and cold. It tasted like cheap microwave dinners. Wait service was so-so. Inflated prices, lack of adequate heating, food temperatures were wrong. 

You have to book earlier in the evening if you prefer to have conversations with your dinner mates. The place turns into a club later, and they start to blare music to get the dinner patrons to leave. What exactly is this place supposed to be? Seriously, just go somewhere else.

Great place to have a birthday party, only $500 food and drink minimum for an amazingly decorated room with the biggest booth in Toronto. DJ and dancing happens after dinner which is awesome. Our server (Kat?) was amazingggg and a great time was had by all. My issues are with Soy, the events person, who gave me so much misinformation. Told me the apps had 6-7 pieces in each when there was actually 4 in most. This may not sound like a big deal but when pre-planning apps for 20 people you need to know. Also said that they could only do one bill which was fine but that the server could tell people who drank what and they could pay individually. Um no, the server said that's just not possible, especially with the mandatory service charge. The only thing you can do is split the bill 20 ways which is not a problem, I just would have liked to alert people ahead of time, esp. those who barely drank. Also she indicated the cake could only be cut in max.16 pieces. So not true, it was huge, easily cut in 20, if not more. Depends how detail oriented you are I guess, but planning the perfect party is an art.

THEY STEAL YOUR PHONES HERE, DO NOT GO HERE. REPEAT DO NOT GO HERE!! The bartender is 100% part of  it on Friday Nights, along with the manger as they were both super sketchy and rude. I hope people see this to avoid a HORRIBLE place like this as it is not fair for a phone to be STOLEN LIKE THAT.

Came here on a Friday night with my friend. 
The server was very kind and accomodating. 
We ordered a bunch of things to share which includes the pork...
Bring your parka! We went for NYE and it was absolutely freezing in the restaurant, almost every person there wore their coats for their entire meal....
One of my favourite spots in the city, if you are in Toronto and looking to have a nice dinner at a beautiful decorated little Asian world with some nicely...

reviews.text: What a treat STK was! Matt, the manager and his staff were super friendly and accommodating. We changed our reservation last minute and still got a great...
Upon entering, you'll be greeting with black and white modern decor and a BIG group of girls at the front desk. It seems like they just stand there and...
Just had a birthday event here tonight and it was definitely a good time. Our party came late and they were very accommodating. We ordered WagYu beef burger...

My expectation was really high as it is a high end steak house, but it ended up as a very bad experience. We went there on my birthday and wrote on the reservation that the dinner was for birthday celebration. The service was on average overall, except the server knew it was my birthday (he said happy birthday after we paid) and other tables around got a special birthday treat from STK - NOT ME. We paid as much or more than the other table, but we had nothing. Can your restaurant treat people fairly? A reservation is special for someone at that day, but just to see others be very happy about their special treatment, BECAUSE YOU DO NOT DESERVE IT? The menu has nothing special and the price is clear over-rated. I will never go there again and pay for the high tips for nothing.

I went to STK a few days ago and I was quite disappointed with the service and quality. We were a party of 10 people, the service was slow and not to the standard I expect for a place like STK. Also, if my bill is going to be $100 the food to be at par. I ordered a medium steak and it came out well done. I was not the only person at my table that received their steak overcooked. I would not recommend this restaurant for dinner but if you looking for  a night out and possibly having some drinks, this place has a good vibe/atmosphere for a Saturday night.

It was my first time going to STK and it was Fabulous! The wait time for a table was 20 minutes, which was understandable on a Friday night. Daniel the bartender greeted us with a warm welcome and made sure our bar experience was excellent! Bryce was our waiter and treated us with the upmost respect and service. Great overall experience!!

Like so many others, had a birthday here recently. It's a nice looking venue with a really fun atmosphere but the service isn't great. We arrived a few minutes early for our reservation (which was not at peak hours) and still waited 45 minutes. I read other reviews here about them comping some people to make up for it - but not us. We were finally seated and our server didn't know anything about the menu, drinks, or prices. So she just went back and forth asking her colleagues.

After many trips back and forth to find that they didn't have the bottle we wanted and to get answers, we were able to order and then wait another 45 minutes until our food actually arrived. Thankfully it was very well done but by that time we would have eaten anything because we were starving.

Everything is wildly overpriced and management knows they have a trendy venue so they really don't care about making things right. There'll be plenty of other people to spend huge amounts of money there if you're unhappy. The venue itself is nice and the food is good (more stars to the chefs) but everything else is garbage and way overpriced. Either way, there are nicer venues and better quality steak houses near by so there's really no point to coming here.

My experience was amazing! The food, service and staff were absolutely wonderful! I was celebrating a special night and they made my night even more special with a surprise tasty dessert and fireworks.  They even gave me a great bottle of prosecco to enjoy and to congratulate me! The ambiance and overall experience was more than I expected. Special thank-you to Eric and Bryce!:)

lic_profile: Husband and wife team, Chef Rony Goraichy and Diana Sideris, are the heart of Tabülè. Located in the heart of midtown Toronto, Tabülè offers a cozy ambience with refined yet comforting takes on the exotic flavours of the Middle East. Using the freshest quality ingredients, Goraichy's interpretation of traditional dishes has resulted in a menu bursting with robust flavour to delight the senses. Tabülè also offers vegan and gluten free menu options, and desserts made in house.  The drink menu includes a variety of wine, exotic martinis, fresh juices and loose leaf teas.

reviews.text:
Went here for my birthday, I had a large group and although they were very busy, they accommodated us right away. 

I ordered the Kefta dinner which came...
Food is just ok. The atmosphere and interior design is almost non existant. I mean if it was not for the few pictures on the walls you will not know you are...

Great food but okay service. Our server only came back once to refill our water; these little things mean a lot to me. 

The cocktail was out of ths world!...

Great food! Try their hummus with grilled meat! It's so good with warn pita! Service was a bit slow but the food is well worth it. Lentil soup is also fantastic. Went during a weekend dinner time so it was a bit loud with some children. Overall great experience
Great vegan options. True quality comfort food! Everything seems to be house made and fresh, even the gluten free flatbread. The staff is always friendly. A solid staple in the neighbourhood.

I placed an order including several items it amounted to 85.00 I tipped the driver 15.00. My order of garlic shrimp was 14.50 and I received 5 shrimps called to ask why and between the rep who answered my call and the manager I was given a "so what" reply.  I encourage you to shop around for more customer respected establishments before ordering from this disgraceful place. Who clearly feel like u should just suck it up when unhappy with being ripped off on an item. No credit offered much less a kind attitude towards patrons. I'm extremely disappointed and will not be treated like this. Meaning I'll take it to all social media platforms to encourage people to perhaps ask prior to placing an order what to expect in any item ordered. Never will I ever order or eat there again.

Went with the family after the auto show just over a week ago. It has a nice low light vibe. The restaurant seems small at first when you walk in but on the other side of the wall there is more seating available. I really appreciated this place for having gluten free and vegan options. Meat was well prepared as was appetizers. The vegan Lebanese pudding was the highlight of the small, sweet and creamy!
Excellent service. Very knowledgeable staff on the menu. Accompanied even though we had a party of 5 and came without a reservation. Overall it was a great and tasty experience ! Thank you.

reviews.text:
My mother loves this place so I took her there again for mother's day.
They have a great selection of Tapas and live flamenco show which is always a...
Tonight I had the great pleasure to sample this establishment. My son had been there before and told me it was a wonderful place but it took me sometime...
This is my second time here due to their Winterlicious menu that was attractive. The decor speaks Spain and they have Flamenco dances during certain days....

Service was amazing! Adrian was a server during a busy day with the world cup gave of Spain vs Portugal. As someone who's been a waiter for 10 years I was very impressed how he managed to expertly serve all guest with only the bartenders help while having a great attitude. I can't stress how impressed I was. Bartender was also nice and the beer was good. Food was decent for the cost.

Tonight I had the great pleasure to sample this establishment. My son had been there before and told me it was a wonderful place but it took me sometime before I actually managed to visit.

 I loved the decor with the terracotta tiles the moment you walk in..... it's very Mediterranean. Small tables are strewn throughout the restaurant which kind of match with the small plates that they offer. 

I had a house Chardonnay to start which was very bold and yet sweet and I gave myself over to the suggestions of the wonderful young waiter and said "what do you think I should try"?????. 

The end result was six different tasting plates that were just delicious most especially the honey bacon wrapped figs. The stuffed peppers with goat cheese was scrumptious. Mushrooms, steak on top of a bed of crispy fries and olives topped everything off beautifully. 

The only downside to the visit was a very noisy table in the corner who clearly didn't understand that this was a specialized venue with an incredible Flamenco show, not to be missed. And certainly not to be talked over. 

Thankfully the waiter advised the table to try and dial it down just a touch so the rest of us could enjoy our Spanish flare for the evening. 

I thoroughly enjoyed it and would definitely go again

Hopefully next time you hire somebody at your place you will be able to pay his money!!! Almost one month and half waiting for it. What a shame, but it's fine at least this time you could buy quality products. 
In fact, I'm not a liar I'm a fair person who more than three times went to your place and you couldn't even take the time to talk to me properly. I can't imagine how many other people really have gotten disappointed about the way you make them feel. It's not my fault if you want still working in this business or not, but I really hope one day you have some respect for the profession as well as for your loyal employees that you like or not still keep going your restaurant, despite how you treat them. Be seriously thankful I didn't go to The Minister of Labour and I'm just reporting fairly this case at Google. By the way do not tell me how my skills are when you can't even handle more than 3 orders at the same time, and about the contract; I really wish we had one to show everyone who is the real liar as you say. Don't cook for living , live for cooking. I Wish you the best with your new employees.

Very disappointed with the service at this restaurant. I found the waiter tardy and very rude. They will also pressure you to order more than you are prepared to I suppose in an effort to solicit a higher bill. When I politely declined the server literally kicked my bag as he left our table intentionally or not I don't know. I find this brazen attitude so skanky and I will never be back. I honestly hope your business goes under sooner rather than later to be replaced with a more deserving venue. I simply went next door to Rodeo and was much more satisfied with how we were received, as well as the decor and overall atmosphere. Don't waste your time with these miserable burros.

I went there during "Summerlicious" so maybe I took different menu compare with normal one. The course is all great and sangria is also nice. The server who study English from Spain, she is really nice and friendly. She really took care about our table to let us eat meal with joy. We had a wonderful night in here.
