reviews.text:
You're in luck if you want some authentic northern, western Chinese food!!! 

1) food: I highly recommend the cold noodles (y'all know what I'm talking...
I love the food here, and found the servers to be very friendly too - more so than your average Asian place that's for sure. It's has a spacious feel...
It's been a few months since I've been here and I would give this place 3.5-4/5. They specialize in a lot of lamb dishes and they have a lunch special here!...

Very good NW Chinese cuisine. You better like cumin and the smell of spices when you step into this place. People come here for the lamb and it is very good BBQ lamb - tender with just the right amount of cumin. The Fried tofu skewers and BBQ squid are good too. The beef wrap was fragrant and tasty, every table while we were there ordered it together with the lamb. 

The wintermelon soup was also satisfying although the yang chow fried rice was just ok. Good service run by a family. Pricing is reasonable. Free parking. Adds another element to Scarborough's burgeoning ethnic food scene.

I am Canadian and I've been all over China

This restaurant serves real Chinese food.

Spicy, savory, good value

Try everything on the menu... you will find many favorites.

5 stars

I love skewers, and this place has some of the best ones in the city.  Lamb kebabs and beef kebabs were very good , and chunky pieces as well. The grilled tofu skewer was very good since it was spiced perfectly, definitely a must have item

After just moving back to Toronto with my wife, having lived in Shanghai for the last 8 years we were worried that We might not be able to find good Northwestern Chinese food in Toronto.  That was before we found this restaurant.  Northwestern Chinese food is different than most other Chinese food, heavily influenced by Middle Eastern cuisine, think lots of BBQ lamb, skewers, cumin spicing, etc.  The food here is authentic and holds up well to the standard in China.  We'll definitely be back.

The place was pretty empty when we went at around 4pm on a weekday, understandable. Food came out pretty fast and the staff was nice. The grilled lamb chop was excellent, crispy on the outside and a succulent inside. We also ordered a bowl of lamb pulled noodles, but that was quite disappointing, so I wouldn't recommend that. But the lamb skewers and green onion pancakes we ordered were all really good. The price is on par with what you are paying for, so $$/$$$ in terms of affordability.

lic_profile: The Beech Tree features cuisine originally inspired by traditional country cooking, but with a modern and refined edge.

reviews.text: The Beech Tree is the best food in Toronto matched with incredible service. My husband and I went to the Beech Tree for a three course Valentine's Day meal. Each course was presented beautifully and the taste was indescribably delicious. Despite the restaurant being extremely busy, our server provided exceptional service and made sure we never had to wait for anything. The washroom is outdated. However, everything else was perfect. It is the best restaurant in Toronto.

The food was awesome and innovative when my wife and I were last there over 2 years ago.  The menu is small but changes often.  It is pricey food but worth the cost if you like fancy fare.  This may have changed but if it is the same reservations are required and it's worth a visit.

Little hidden gem in the "upper Beaches". I can't say enough about how good the food is.  Great atmosphere, kid friendly and delicious. If you are looking for a nice night out... You won't be disappointed. Ask for Helder.
Cozy dining spot in the upper beaches. Always excellent food with a rotating seasonal menu. Delicious cocktails as well.
Good menu and not too pricey.  Best to order the appetizers and share.
I heard that this place was good, and had been trying to find a time. Tinight was the night, everything was perfect, ambiance was was and cozy, friendly,...
Everyone else enjoyed their meals, but I had a difficult time finding something that could accommodate my allergies. One of our party enjoyed the burger and...

Maureen B.
Second go at The Beech Tree after a mixed feeling the first time around. Confirmed that the portion sizes are ridiculously small for the price!...

reviews.text: If the gorgeous patio complete with BOOTHS isn't enough to love about this gem, consider the Happy Hour from 3-6 Mon-Fri featuring $5 pints and bar rail a...
Visited this establishment for the first time on Friday evening around 8 pm when it was still light out. Ate outside on a rather nice patio, which even has...

Updating my review as we revisited. 
We sat next to the table Edward Blake wrote the first prospectus on, apparently. The front foldout of the menu has a...

A welcoming pub with a large patio out front. Service was very friendly and mindful while keeping an appropriate distance. Drink choices were extensive with quick pours. A nice selection of small shareables as well as extensive mains options. Despite it's location along Jarvis - which unfortunately many motorists treat like a raceway - the patio is still intimate and quiet.

Will come again!

Absolutely amazing meal, super friendly service. This was our first time eating poutine and also the best we've had yet! Great drinks selection and thankfully a kids menu! Dinners were wonderful. Definitely recommend for couples or family!

Great steak pie. I switched the mash potatoes to fries...I am sure the mash would have been good but the fries were great. Good selection of beers. Friendly and efficient staff. I would go back when I visit Toronto again.
Absolutely love this place.   Great neighborhood bar with excellent food and service.   I always feel welcome here.

I frequent this place in the summer. Great patio. Lots of sin and the mature trees offer a break from the sun.  Food is always good. The service has improved 100% . Did have a bad experience in the past but have them a second chance and  they have been way better sonce. 
I quite enjoy this place for a quick bite

lic_profile: The Carbon Bar offers southern-inspired fare and cocktails in a casual space inspired by the storied past of a rock 'n' roll discotheque, an upstart TV station and media giant's studio. It's the place where fun loving aficionados, gourmands and bon vivants meet to share snacks, plates and platters delivered with impeccable hospitality.

reviews.text: The food was really good, a surprising gem that was not expected in the church and queen area. The restaurant was also very spacious, and the decor created...
I've been waiting to finally try this place! Came here last night on a Friday night with a group of friends. Service is friendly, helpful, knowledgable, and...

Ideal place to enjoy BBQ cuisine.
Service is really good, the menu is offering many options. Food is amazing. Don't hesitate to ask for...

Very nice bar that's open late. Kitchen closes at 1am. The liquor and beer selection is vast and very well selected. The food is absolutely amazing. Certainly an upscale bar with fantastic eats st a very reasonable price. 5 stars, have and will continue to recommend.

Great BBQ and cocktails. The space is really big and great to do gatherings. 

My friends and I order the meat platter as the main with brisket, fried chicken and ribs. 

The brisket was my favorite while the fried chicken was a little bland. 

Cocktails are amazing. Raised by the wolves is a must try!

Went for brunch. Was fun. Nice atmosphere; good menu. Chicken and waffles were top class. Pancakes *looked* like the bomb, but only ranked "good" - were a bit thick/heavy. Would go back, and would definitely try their smoked stuff at dinner.

Fantastic evening for my wife’s birthday tonight.  The staff was very friendly and accommodating to guests with dietary restrictions despite having a large party on the set menu.  Everyone loved the atmosphere and was blown away by the food.  The snacks and appetizers were inventive and delicious, the octopus was cooked extraordinarily well,

Amazing brunch and one of the best beef briskets I’ve ever had! All the dishes were so flavorful, the service was excellent and it was a very good atmosphere with lots of natural lighting. I’ll definitely be back!

reviews.text: Definitely on the higher spectrum of the $$$ range. The roof level seating and outside patio have beautiful views and the staff were quick and very...

The food objectively is below average but the prices are substantially above average.

Ordered two martinis to find out that they were $29 each. 

Ordered...

Four hours and a mediocre dinner later, I am very unsatisfied. 

No joke, our dinner here lasted FOUR HOURS. This is never acceptable, but when your guests...

Very nice and cosy place. Unbelievable food. We order the seafood platter. Everything was perfect. Oysters were excellent. Lobster was very tender , amazing tuna. Everything was just melting in your mouth. The fish tacos were amazing. Customer service was perfect. Very polite and pleasant.

Service is excellent. Honestly, these guys are very honest about the menu. I hadn't been there before and had not tried oysters. The guy gave me two oysters for free just to introduce me and the waiter steered me away from the stuff that he knew I wouldn't like and suggested things I would like. The lobster roll was the highlight. However, the tuna nachos were also very good. I would steer clear from the tacos. While they weren't bad, I was not really impressed by it. The atmosphere is amazing, great for intimate dates or for dinners with parties of four. Be warned that it's best to make reservations. The place is packed most days. We managed to find space by the bar even without reservations. All in all, experience was great. If you're in the mood for quality seafood and oysters, this is the place you want to go.
We hosted our corporate event here for 60 people. It was great! Food was great and sizeable for passed canapes. The service was amazing, super nice and accommodating staff. Would highly recommend.

NOTE ABOUT ALL REVIEWS ON GOOGLE: THERE ARE 2 RESTAURANTS HERE WITH THE SAME NAME. The upstairs is a classy quiet fine dining restaurant. That's where people are referring to with the surf and turf and the other heavier foods. The downstairs is basically an upscale lounge with almost entirely seafood on their menu. 

We had meant to go upstairs but since we didnt know we ended up booking downstairs. The reservation asks if you're celebrating something you might as well put you're getting married there cause no-one is reading it. Also they do NOT honor their reservations. We had reservations at 8, and were told to wait maybe 30 minutes or longer by the bar. Then i saw there are at least 2 other couples with the same instructions for an 8pm table. So basically they don't care. Then i saw a couple walk in and say they have no reservations and they were also told to wait 30 minutes!!! Unbelievable. 

Neither the food nor the service is comparable to restaurants of the same price range. It's a nice atmosphere but that's not so difficult to find in Toronto these days. Try elsewhere.

I am due for another visit but I have been here a couple times and have left like this place made the best experience My Dad, Myself and our group of friends have ever. Service, Quality and overall Restaurant is completely worth the decision. 

Always recommend going upstairs for first timers 

Patio during season is an amazing experience, make sure to call for reservations. Location of the patio also provides a unique touch to Torontos Core and really brings out the citys liveliness.

Will be coming back to finish my review

lic_profile: The Fifth’s boutique restaurant offers a rooftop patio, romantic ambience and delicious cooking. The Dining Room is an intimate space with fire-side sofas and eclectic décor while the Terrace is a rooftop oasis with spectacular views of downtown Toronto. Headed by Executive French Chef JP Challet and Chef Robert Toppan, the accomplished culinary team creates a modern cuisine to reflect today’s tastes and respect vegetarian and gluten-free diets. This summer, enjoy alfresco dining with Mediterranean inspired foods, wines and fresh flavours from the French Riviera to the Amalfi Coast.

reviews.text: Some friends brought me to The Fifth & Terrace for my birthday and to say I was blown away was an understatement. I love that it is tucked away in the...
I came here for a special celebration. Our server was fantastic, and even gave me and my partner two glasses of champagne to start. I ordered the Sicilian...
I'm soooooo impressed with customer service, decore and food. Just WOW!!!! Amazing amazing amazing!!!!!

I went here with my boyfriend and we loved every moment of our night, from the charming freight elevator to our helpful waiter, it made a simple dinner out feel like we were celebrating something special. I had the charred octopus from the Sicilian inspired menu and there are no words to describe how delicious it was. I have never experienced such a flavourful plate. I finished my meal with their lemon tart which was the perfect ratio of sweet and tangy. 10 out of 10, and would definitely recommend this place !

My boyfriend and I came here for our anniversary date night. The entrance is very cool looking and I loved the elevator up. The restaurant area is lovely and we had a table by the fireplace. Our waiter, Andre, suggested a great wine pairing, all the staff were very attentive and friendly, and all our courses were delivered with perfect timing. We had the tasting menu - our favourites were the black cod, polka dot salad, and hazelnut semifreddo. Chef Rob even gave us a special anniversary congratulations with our dessert! The food and atmosphere was wonderful for our special night and we will definitely be back in the future.

Over priced, for mediocre food. The sweet potato chips were soggy when asked to get it replaced it was replaced with an other batch of soggy sweet potato chips.  Lobster risotto was literally tasteless. Black cod was undercooked. Carpaccio was so so. The only good thing was the bread. Definitely will not return.
I've been here a couple times and LOVE it. It's all about the elevator, until you get to see the rooftop... a MUST experience in TO
Food and ambiance was great. So was the service until the waiter disappeared after our meal. We had to go to the bar to get our bill and pay for it.  Otherwise, I think this is a great venue.

DELIVERY REVIEW: via UberEATS

Some wins and some misses here. Service aside (since I ordered delivery), I think there are tastier Indian places for better...

Lovely authentic Indian food. In Toronto, there are a lot of places to choose from. For us, this place stood out for the authentic taste (versus the usual lots of gravy and chilly), and also the staff. Super courteous. We chose to walk over and opted for takeaway, though once were there, we were wondering why we chose not to eat at the restaurant itself. Bedford road has a lovely air to it and this restaurant is nestled in a beautiful street nearby.

Very nice food, food, ambience and service. We ordered 2 dishes and both tasted very nice with proper flavors and spices. The only complaint is the Tandoori Momos very not hot.. It might have tasted much much better if they were warm.

Years ago this place was pretty good, today not so much. Portion sizes have decreased significantly. Food quality has also suffered, dishes are now as oily as your common shopping mall food court spot. If you live downtown there are better indian options to be had.
Visited for a private birthday function. They had a private room with private buffet. Food was very good, most people loved the kulfi! Overall the food was fresh and tasted great.

Nice place, good service, and they make the food quickly. 

Unfortunately the food is pricey and tastes just like any other Indian restaurant in the city. Portions could be bigger too.

With the quality of food you're getting, plus the small portions and above average prices, you're better off going to a smaller Indian restaurant in Scarborough that can offer the exact same taste but at a cheaper price.

This place makes sense if you're in the area and have money to burn or have a date to impress.

lic_profile: The Monkey Bar offers a contemporary bistro menu, inviting atmosphere and friendly, knowledgeable service. All food is prepared in-house, from the sourdough bread to the hand-cranked ice cream, using organic, sustainable and local ingredients whenever possible. Complement your dining experience by ordering from the seasonal cocktail menu, the broad list of premium vodka and single malt scotch, or the extensive list of new and old world wines available by the glass, half litre, and bottle. Upscale cuisine at affordable prices.

reviews.text: The food was fantastic besides being rushed through the courses. There was definitely pressure to eat within our allotted time before the table would be given up to the next guests and the next reservation. The courses came a little too quickly and didn't allow us to chat properly. Appetizer, main, and desert were rushed through in less than an hour. If it wasn't for the quality of the food - which was again very good, I would have thought that I was at a pickle barrel. Otherwise, it's difficult to get a read on this place as there is no real atmosphere - there are all different types of cuisine served: Asian, Italian, French and the decor is quite bland.

Very good.  very very good. The calamari is incredibly tender. The ricotta "pillows" aka ravioli were most excellent. The ribs and lamb as reported by younger family members as totally, completely good. F-I-L.at 95 years old ate everything on his plate. Really nice wine choices. I was impressed with our wait staff..Desert ? i know I ate it all..but cant remember anything except I wanted to lick my plate.  
Go...go...totally satisfied..

Wonderful meal. The owners know how to treat their customers and the chef produced another great dinner. A great place to go for any occasion or just a night out with friends. You will not be disappointed.

Amazing calamari, Lamb, salad, bread, Eton mess
Excellent martini, 
Lovely staff,
Overall a great experience.

 However, unfortunately I would not recommend the duck, it was dry, stringy, almost a duck jerky AND I left my plate virtually untouched, yet none of the staff asked me if everything was ok as sat and watched the rest of my table enjoy their meals. I didn’t want to create a scene by saying anything and was expecting one of the staff to intuit the situation.  

Oh well. Duck should be moist and rich and flavourful, if the Monkey’s staff read this... loose the duck!
Absolutely amazing experience! Incredible service and food. Got the beef short ribs, and my wife had a steak. Absolutely incredible, will be back!

One of the worst pub food I've ever had. Ordered four different take out items and they all sucked.

I ordered nachos, tacos, and two different spaghettis.

The only reason they get 2 stars is because the food was edible, just. Considering the downtown location and inflated prices, I would have expected some form of respectful and attentive service. They were out of 1/2 of the 'craft' beers on the menu, drinks that were ordered were wrong, had to flag our server every time we needed anything. Generally we are pretty low-key, easy-going guests having worked in hospitality for many years but this was an experience lacking in just about every basic point of service. Oh, and the washrooms were beyond filthy.

This location is around the corner from my office so I've been here a few times with work colleagues. Great and friendly staff, good food and decent prices for drinks. That being said, the nachos we got the last time we were there last Sunday were dry and didn't have enough cheese, the other snacks we had were pretty decent and the sangria was really good. We'll be back.
Basic place for a basic after work drink.  Nothing special.  Service was good.  Beer could have been colder.
The food was good, however the drinks are horrible. The bartender is very amateurish.
Nothing spectacular . Food is alright. Location is small. And the karaoke nights is too close to the bar. So you hear all the bad singers. Wouldn't recommend a date night here.

lic_profile: The Queen and Beaver promises to be a proper neighbourhood pub, with fantastic food, served alongside a good pint, a classic cocktail or an excellent glass of wine. They have taken classic British dishes that have stood the test of time and added lots of love, making everything from scratch - from housemade breads and ice creams, to sausages and pies.
lic_lunchmenu: With Spring Ramp Oil, Toasted Sesame & Yogurt Dressing

reviews.text: Pub food with a menu that’s a cut above, a carefully crafted  selection of beer and wine, and excellent service. What else can you ask for? I’ve been in Toronto for just a tad over three weeks and I’ve eaten here three times, and was impressed with each of the entrees ordered. Friends who I can here with the first time (one local and one from afar) were both impressed too. One feature of this restaurant is pretty unique: high end Monitor Audio speakers grace the dining room with high fidelity music that is not played too loud. This is a pub that both foodies and audiophiles will appreciate.

Great English pub in the heart of downtown. Lots of seating is available and this is a perfect place to watch a football match. This is a Manchester United pub so for all fans of the red devils come and enjoy a snack and some fine English ales on match day. The menu is traditional English pub food and it feels like and upscale pub. Prices are fair and this could be one of the finest pubs around town.

Beautiful pub that looks like it actually belongs in London, as In the London I left behind in 2003.  The fish and chips were deciduous and the service was genuinely friendly from fellow British expats.  The pub itself is really comfortable, with a choice of 2 floors and an outside patio. 

I will definitely be back anytime I'm In Toronto.  I cannot recommend this place highly enough.  Thank you Queen & Beaver for easing my homesickness!

Located on a quiet back street with outside seating which was great for the time of year. It was 26 degrees in June. Food menu was not huge but food was delicious and reasonably priced. Service was quick and attentive despite being very busy. There is an upstairs terrace as well as a downstairs however they had to operate a queuing system the upstairs one was so popular so expect to have to wait a little on summer, the wait didn't appear to be that bad though and staff were quick to make space available. There is a big screen TV that shows sports in the bar area upstairs as well

Great service.  I was visiting Toronto for work and I was eating alone.  The Manager offered me a newspaper to read, and remembered me when I came back the next day.  Also, don't be afraid to head up to the second floor bar area.  

The bartender was helpful and energetic, the waitstaff was quick and always ready to serve.  The food was fantastic.  I had the hand-chopped burger the first night and the fish and chips the second night.  Both were tasty and hit the spot.

If you're in the neighbourhood, stop by for a pint or some food.
As a Brit living in the US I have been to my fair share of "British " pubs in the US and found the vast majority to be rather far away from the real thing -...

reviews.text: Went for winterlicious and even so, there is a lot of care going into their food. The food, although seems simple, tastes amazing and there is nothing bland about it. No choice is a bad choice. It is a very small cozy restaurant with a warm welcoming feeling to it. The staff are extremely friendly and food comes out at a good time. There is also a good selection of unique drinks here.

A favorite - shakshouka for brunch is the bomb, steak frites are the bomb, cocktails are delicious, service is great and super friendly, the place is cozy and cute but a little small to maneuver around. The washrooms are a little smelly
This one has become my favourite brunch place in Toronto. Service was great too! Highly recommend
I had brunch with my girlfriend. Great taste, and some neat options that you can't find everywhere like fried chicken and waffles. Recommend if you're in the area.

Went for lunch. My arugular salad tasted very very good. Colleague's fries was yum! A lot of Ontario wine list. Some are from really nice small production wineries. Price is fair. Service was quick, server was friendly. Perfect for lunch on a workday.

Just inhaled one of the best Lox & Cream chee plates in town on the patio here
Its a hidden Toronto gem & they have a nice cider selection too!
Was excited to try it for winterlicious because it was featured on diners drive ins and dives. Fun diner interior, friendly staff, but food fell short. We...

Headed to Shore Club for their weekly happy hour featuring wine, rail drinks, and buck a shuck, as well as $2 shrimp!
This cool bar section of the...

Elegant Dining Club atmosphere. Food and choice of beverages was excellent, service was also very good. Good for small groups or just a couple. A very pleasant fine dining experience. We just walked in but I guess in the Spring and Summer you would need to get a reservation.

Nice ambiance and decor. Staff were very attentive and professional. I took my gf for her birthday and they were great at going out of their way to make her feel special.  Steak was great but would be nice if a side was included.
Atmosphere was nice. Steak wasn't prepared correctly, they were inconsistent. Sides were large but nothing extraordinary

Very good happy hour. Mostly attentive service (the only miss: I ordered a bottle twice, but she kept confusing it as an order for the table, when I meant it for myself haha). Considering we were a group of 12, though, service was good overall. I noticed they also had other large tables, so I'm confident in saying they can manage larger parties and maintain quality service.

Pleasantly surprised at how good the food was and that it wasn't another overpriced restaurant in the financial district. Had the seared tuna which was amazing along with Brussels sprouts, baked beets and mashed potato sides. My dining companions each had a steak and no food was left on any of our plates. Cozy, more upscale atmosphere but had efficient and down to earth service.

reviews.text: I couldn't decide whether to give three or four stars. The food was great! I had a crab cake, the couscous salad, the chickpea stew and baklava for desert....
Before visiting The Sultan's Tent and Moroccan Café for the very first time, I'd never had the opportunity to try Moroccan food.  Walking into The Sultan's...
The only saving grace for this restaurant is the BEAUTIFUL atmosphere and the belly dancing show. Otherwise the food portions for the appetizers were tiny...

I was with my friend here last Sunday.  Both of us are highly enjoyed our dining experience.  The decor was beautiful and made me feel like I was in Morocco.  My friend and I both ordered the lamb shanks –they were very tender and delicious.  My friend never tried the lamb before and was surprised to find out how delicious the lamb was.  The belly dancer was skilled and interacted with the guests frequently.  I got persuaded to try a little belly dancing and had a lot of fun.  I even got a certificate for my dancing ^-^.  My server Mamun was excellent.  The price is a little high but you are paying for the entire dining experience, not just the food so I think it's worth it.  Definitely recommend! 5/5.

Living in Toronto is a pleasure. Don’t need to travel to experience different ethnic food such delicious Moroccan dishes. Decor is beautiful, lots of traditions and history, feels you are in Casa Blanca at fascinating times, just like a movie scene. Belly dancers provide great atmosphere and ambiance. Magnificent.
Food is excellent. Flavourful and mouthwatering dishes cooked to perfection. Lamb was delicious. It’s so elegantly plated it looked like artwork. Desserts look like culinary masterpieces. Top notch service. Beautiful evening in fabulous ambiance you don’t want to end and will remember for a long time.

Booked a reservation for our anniversary and was very impressed with how accommodating the staff was. It was my first time so I was unsure what to expect. I was very impressed with our server(Mamun) as well as the hostess and wait staff. The were very efficient, professional and super friendly. The belly dancers were amazing and so sweet when interacting with the patrons. We got little diplomas for going up and joining them, it was great. 
They only reason I give it a 4 star is for the menu food/price. I understand the prix fixe menu for the show times and if you stick to the inclusive items you can get away with not blowing your budget but I found the up price items a little expensive. I had the fish and have to say I was expecting a little better. It was not horrible by any means but not the best I've had. My partner had the lamb and seemed to really enjoy it. Dessert and tea was delicious. 
I would return but will try to stick to the inclusive menu items next time.  Above all the service and show made this evening great.

I was here last night for a family friends birthday. I did enjoy the venue the only reason I give it 4 stars and not 5 is because I felt it was a bit expensive if you decided to order a few things off the fix price menu. I found the belly dancing show to be quite a lot of fun the only thing though is I wish it was a bit longer maybe 45 minutes to an hour instead of 30. I definitely will come back to this establishment with my friends. I would not even mind hiring one of the dancers for a future party or an event so will get their info next time.

I love this place! The atmosphere is distinctly morrocan. The mint tea is served in beautiful Moroccan style teapots and the food is great. I had the braised lamb and its spiced well and flavorful. The belly dancers are also fun and high energy. It's a worthwhile experience

lic_profile: Located in the historic landmark building at 5 St. Joseph Street, The Wickson Social is a great local restaurant and bar. The old warehouse has been transformed into a welcoming and convivial gathering place offering a fantastic selection of local craft beers, authentic wines and thoughtful cocktails, backed up by a seasonal, contemporary menu.

reviews.text: Came here for a Saturday morning brunch and it wasn't busy at all. This place is huge and I imagine gets super busy in the evenings. The spirits selection...
3.5 stars... I definitely think this is a great place for a first date brunch or meet up with friends.  The atmosphere is really nice and no one can say...

Had dinner here with a couple friends for winterlicious! Overall had a nice evening with some pros and cons:

Pros:
-Awesome beer list
-Really nice...
We are able to book a table for 7 people in Wednesday night. The food is okay, except the lamb. Good location... Be careful with parking. I got a parking ticket after 10pm as permit needed.

Beautiful architecture and great ambiance inside. If you have a large group there are two options you can have a large private room in the back where you have your own bar (there is a minimum spend requirement) and there's also another space that can comfortably accommodate 10 people that is slightly separated into the room of the restaurant and not too loud. They advertise that their menu changes frequently which provides good variety, they have a wide range of different cocktails, appetizers and entrees ranging around $10-25/plate. I loved what I had that night which was the lamb shank and the cider steamed mussels. Reservations recommended.

Nice upscale neighbourhood pub. Great food and lively atmosphere. Had the Lentil chili with wild rice and it was really nice. My dining companions had the fish and chips and the hamburger and fries. Everything was good and with a nice portion of what looked like home cooked fries. Had a nice citrusy IPA on tap. Food prices range from mid-teens to mid-twenties.

We were a big group (7) and they accommodated us really comfortably. Three doors is delicious, with a good portion size for the price, and the beer and wine selection is really really good. A hidden gem!
Chill place in a quiet side street Especially nice in summer as you can sit on the patio. Great selection of beers and spirits. More on the pricey side though.

lic_profile: Thoroughbred Food and Drink offers life's simple pleasures. As a contemporary Canadian restaurant Thoroughbred celebrates the diversity of our country and honours the flavours of our youth. Executive Chef Ariel Coplan takes a journey through seasonal cooking, working with purpose and passion. The beverage program is bespoke and matches the food instinctively.

reviews.text:
We got the Valentine's Day special menu. They have two options $55/$65. We got 65 because I just wanted to try everything haha. 

The restaurant is kind of...

The service here was great - which is why I'm giving them 2 stars. The food was terrible.  

My bf and I both ordered the steak.  It comes with barley.  The...

Tiny gem downtown. Because it is fairly small, it's better to come early or make a reservation if coming with a larger group of people.

Thoroughbred's...

Absolute gem of a restaurant on Richmond Street. Couldn't decide on where to eat after a Blue Jays game and on our way back to our hotel near Dundas Square found Thoroughbred on Google Maps. At first we weren't quite sure what to think of it by simply looking at the front but boy were we happy we went inside. Simple menu of no more than 15 dishes with an extensive (and tasty) cocktail and alcohol menu. Highly recommend the gnocchi, have not had any gnocchi as soft and delicious before.

I liked this place but I can't say I loved it. The food portions are good but I feel like there is a little too much going on in each dish and in a way that, to me, felt like the taste of the main ingredient of the dish was being masked a bit. Again it was still good but I can't say it wowed me. The service was great. The portions were good. The place was dark though. One of those places that make aging eyes bust out the cell to light up the menu.

My husband and I are regulars and we love it. The staff is always attentive, the food is always fabulous and there is always something delicious on tap. They go out of their way to try and explore new drinks - definitely worth chatting with the bartender for a bottle recommendation on those fancy nights:) We get their cocktails also and are never disappointed. We can honestly say we have never had a dish there we didn't like. They also accommodate tons of diet restrictions making it easy to go there with a group of people  - if it's complicated we let them know ahead of time just as a courtesy. Wonderful wonderful place. :)

One of my favourite restaurants in Toronto. Food is absolutely impeccable -- always perfectly cooked, creatively presented, and of course, delicious. Service has always been great too. Highly recommend getting the tasting menu, which is amazing value for money. Atmosphere is cozy and romantic, but my only small complaint would be that its a little cold inside in the winter and they could turn the heat up higher. I did bring it up on my last visit and it got warmer but not as warm as I'd like. Will definitely come back here again!!

We were there on Valentine's day, and were surprised that you couldn't order of the regular menu. Would have loved a warning when we reserved a table a couple days before. The chef had some creative dishes and flavors, but the over-done BBQ roasted beef ribs in the entree, mediocre ginger bread with green apple sorbet and an odd, gelatinous cream on top of an okay white blondie didn't meet the expectations I had for the night. Not sure if I'd go back, likely not given the number of options to choose from in Toronto.

reviews.text:
Lovely environment | Great service | Bite size appetizers | Small entrees | 3oz wines | Ritz Carlton

Came here for dinner with a girlfriend on a weeknight,...
I came here for Saturday brunch for my birthday with my close friends and family. It's located inside the Ritz Carlton on the upper main floor. There's a...
We came here for my birthday dinner and I have say the service was truly exceptional - service that one would expect at a restaurant located in the Ritz...

I recently attended Saturday brunch at TOCA for my friend's bridal shower. We were a party of 9 and ordered drinks, food and dessert. We were blown away by the quality of food (including portion size) as well as the delightful and helpful serving staff. We were able to bring our own cake and the TOCA staff assisted us with refrigerating it, cutting, serving and storing it while we had an afternoon at the spa. the decor is modern and inviting and the cheese cave is just an added bonus!
This was our first time here. The food was good but not outstanding. The service was excellent. The wine selection is great. Overall, it was a nice night out. Although be aware it will not be cheap.

We stopped at this restaurant during a blizzard in mid April. We were warmly welcomed and the atmosphere was inviting. The food came out in a timely fashion and was freshly prepared and delicious. Our waiter was courteous and attentive. Certainly would return when in Toronto again.

A little disappointed to be honest. Great ambiance. Great service...but I found the meal highly salty even the salad. I'd go again as the location and ambiance were really nice, so I'm wondering was it just an off day!. But at those prices for me its a real treat can I really afford for them to have two off days!....hummm I'm still deciding!

Great place for all you can eat brunch. Food selection is great and servicers are always around and very friendly. Food is costly but have to consider where it is. Also saw a celebrity there the last time I went. You need to go on a empty stomach to get your moneys worst. Would try it again.

reviews.text: Very good ambience and views. Food isn't quite up to par. Found serving sizes to be a bit small (especially the dessert) and wasn't all that impressed with the steak and pasta dishes which we ordered. Service is great! For a classy restaurant I think they have to (and will) touch up on what gets served!

Service was horrible, food was mediocre at best. Waaaaaay overpriced! 
It took forever to have water at our table, appropriate utensils were missing for our dinners, deserts tasted like they came frozen from a low end grocery store and our waiter went missing. It wasn't even busy. I have no idea why we never saw our server or never advised that he was leaving (I made this assumption because where else did he go?). 
It took almost 45 minutes to get our bill ... we asked 3 times and our server was never to be seen. I would absolutely not recommend this location nor will I ever go back. $250 wasted on this establishment!

the view is unique..
we eat pasta and an Amazing dessert..
we spent a couple of great hours in this restaurant and we'll be back for sure !!! Very Nice ,-)

the best view ever..!
good food, friendly people and service..!!
we will be back for sure ;-)
the Italian chef PINO, is very friendly.. and his talent is great !!
the place is good for lunch, dinner.. but also for a coffe or a drink during the day.. fantastic view !!!
;-)
Antonio

The view was great...the restaurant was not turning for the 360 view anymore. The food was average, but overly priced. Unless you stayed at Westin and are short on time, there are better alternatives around.

Really surprised about the night view and decoration
I just love how they put the tables beside the window
Food is okay, but would recommend their tiramisu

I don't even know what to begin with. 
This place is a SCAM.
- The view: Forget about the amazing view that you see on their website, this is a FRAUD. The...

A very disappointing night, but we made the best of it and enjoyed some fine company and good cheer together.

My review is quite delayed, though I have...

reviews.text: I go here during winterlicious/sunmerlicious, and am always satisfied with the food and service. I always sit by the windows because I like being near the sunlight. Nice interior and decor.

Best restaurant in North York. They have a good buffet  around Chistmas time with reasonable price. We had the best turkey dinner on Christmas day in the year we had the massive ice storm. Unforgettable taste.  Don't miss summerlicious and winterlicious there.
Awful. Cheap place. Charging $2.50 for condiments for poor quality food
I only go to Trio during Summer/Winterlicious when they have great menu. Other than that their food is forgettable.
Went there for winterlicious with a dozen friends. Salad was good. Chicken was dry and tough. Apple crumble was suppose to be hot but it was cold. Had to pay tax on the gratuities.
We live like 5 mins down the street and never knew that this hidden gem exist. Tonight we came here for Winterlicious. 5 adults and 2 children- a party of...
We went to the Trio Restaurant for Saturday dinner. Trio Restaurant is located in the Novotel hotel. The dining room is beautifully decorated. The...

Came here for winterlicous yesterday.   Menu sounded good and parking at the hotel after 6pm is only $5.  

We had a party of 11 tonight and were ready to...

reviews.text:
Decent for a hotel bar/restaurant but not over the top. I only came in for desert so I may update this review in the next few days after a dinner. 
The...
I love this restaurant :) My husband and I come here on special occasions from time to time, and recently I also did a menu tasting for my dad's birthday....

We live in the city about 10 minutes away and wanted a nice break after a long work day and walking home after work. 

The vibe of this lobby lounge is...

Service needs to be better. Host needs to be more attentive of guests coming in and servers need to be attentive when they need to order. 

 June 29th 2018- Revisited this place. Food got a lot better! Service was good on Friday night. Plate of food looked great! Did a 5 course meal and every plate was delicious. Live singer was great.

Atmosphere was awkward. May need to revisit. No signs of this place still and no one knows of this restaurant. Over shadowed by Ruth Chris' steakhouse. Need more exposure cause food was great.

I was there for winterlicious, the food was in good quality and the dishes are creative on taste, not just the look! I love this place because it is good for couple , as well as family friendly. Our server was very attentive and smart. He was so busy to run around the place, but never forget our request or our need. He also did aware of our office lunch hour and did his best to make it faster for us, so we could go on time. A wonderful dinning experience I had so far at restaurants.

Best Rose ever, however we did a group dinner and the chef tried a little too hard, beet meringue in the salad, smoked salmon skin on crispy baguettes and other food combos looked pretty but did not taste good.  It probably would have been better in the restaurant if I could have chosen different courses.

Very poor service. They advertise a Nutcracker menu but seem surprised when you arrive pre or post show. The menu for that isn't great. I've eaten there 4 times because I enjoyed the food. However the last time we waited over an hour for our food...at 3 in the afternoon. It was impossible to flag down a server. The restaurant was not full and there were 5 staff running around but not really serving. It was very disappointing. Although the food is good I won't be going back. The poor service ruins the meal.

I Haven't enjoyed a breakfast like this in a very long time. Breakfast included with the room was only the cold stuff, paid extra $5 for access of all the buffet. 
Atmosphere is great. Will definitely eat there again when in Toronto.

lic_profile: Open since 2002, Chef/owner Alida Solomon serves traditional, authentic Tuscan cuisine, prepared using only fresh ingredients from local farmers.  Everything on the seasonal menu is made in house, including all pastas and desserts.  Tuscan and other Italian wines are featured. Tutti Matti was ranked the 11th best restaurant in Joanne Kates' top 100 Toronto Restaurants in 2014.

rare roast beef, boston bib lettuce pesto , deep fried,  arugula, toasted country

reviews.text: I’ve only been here 2 times with a family who have enjoyed the food here for many occasions - there’s a reason they come back. The service goes above and beyond. There’s options for vegetarian people - not so sure about the vegans or gluten-free people, but I’m sure they’d try to make it work. Everything is fresh and beautifully presented. It offers an intimate and cozy atmosphere. Be prepared to pay a bit more for quality here. Definitely try the desserts.

My girlfriend and I, along with another couple, had an absolutely fantastic dining experience at Tutti Matti. We originally thought that a 9 pm reservation might be a little late but the restaurant was still very busy and there was a great ambiance amongst the crowd.
I will keep it short and sweet about the food. EVERY SINGLE THING we had was perfectly cooked and absolutely delicious!!
I will say this.. GET THE SHORT RIBS!!! 
Our lovely server Holland couldn't stop raving about them so naturally we had to try them. Hands down the best short rib I have ever had.
There is an excellent selection of Italian wines that chef has taken the time to accurately pair with the seasonal ingredients being used in the dishes. Very close attention to detail in this restaurant and it shows. 
I highly recommend this place and I cannot wait to go back!

Food was tasty however in restaurant made  noodles were a bit thick and the Lamb was Very fatty. 40% of the volume (it was big however) was straight fat. Service was good and prompt. Two of us dined for 125. Shared a salad. Each had a main course and a glass of wine and one cup of tea.. Will pass for a while and perhaps try again.  Maybe the late dinner shift is when the kitchen is more on their game.

Amazing wine pairing recommended by the chef ! The place is cozy and well decorated, not too loud. The menu is simple but dishes are efficient, very good and so Italian. It does the job ! Very nice place to have Italian downtown.
Good wine selection, the osso buco is to die for.
I came here for a birthday dinner (my birthday), and it was the perfect place. With relatively short notice, we were able to get a cozy little table for two...
I came here for summerlicious dinner on a Friday and got a really nice table in front of the open window. The ambiance of the restaurant is more upscale...
This place was pretty tasty. Not my favorite Italian spot but any place with handmade pasta is a place I seek out. The menu said it was family style but all...

lic_profile: UFFICIO’s eclectic pescatarian menu with a decidedly Italian flare has earned the 36-seat restaurant rave reviews from media, industry insiders and a growing legion of regulars, as well as a coveted spot on Joanne Kate's Top 100 of 2016. Executive Chef Ivana Raca's team transforms fresh seafood and house-made pasta into unforgettable, mouth-watering meals in a bustling open kitchen. With a hip yet comfortable design, creative menu offerings, an extensive wine selection and inventive cocktail list, UFFICIO has brought together all the necessary ingredients for an unforgettable dining experience.

reviews.text:
Ufficio is goals. Period. 
The décor, the booths, the menu, the vibe, there is nothing it can't do. Giving me all the nautical chic vibes. 
One of my most...
A rather unprepossessing sort of place, with a very long bar near the front and shallow width for the tables. The ambience is very laid-back, with brick...
Definitely one of the most awesome meals I've had.  Love this pescatarian restaurant that opened on Toronto's west end.  Five star because it is simply...

Amazing dinner at Ufficio. Everything was perfect from cocktails to meal. Griffin- the bartender- was knowledgeable, friendly & engaging. The food (we shared multiple dishes... the Burratta, shrimp, pasta & crab feature) were all to die for. 

12/10 for every step of service start to finish. Will most definitely be back.... and will most likely make this a must stop on our restaurant list. Thank you!!

Relatively small restaurant but can accommodate large parties if you make reservations well in advance. I made a reservation for 7:30pm for 9 people. However, upon arriving at the restaurant, we still had to wait for 20 minutes before we got seated which was tough because there isn’t really standing space in the restaurant and we had to constantly move out of the way of severs and customers.

Pretty good food, specializing in seafood and vegetarian dishes. Service was good for the most part expect it too the server close to 30 minutes to split the bill. Overall, I would recommend it for large parties but leave plenty of time if you need separate bills.

Amazing! Everything from the service, cocktails, atmosphere and each of the 4 dishes my boyfriend and I shared were delicious. Great service paired this great food is hard to find in the city. They've only been around for 2 years but have really done well to perfect the guest experience. Highly recommend.

Dining at Ufficio was a spectacular experience! The food, starting with the  gorgeous New Brunswick oysters and generous accompanying mignonette and fresh horseradish, followed by  the amazing shaved asparagus and king mushroom salad then the puttanesca spaghetti and the delicious pan-seared arctic char and finally the rich, smooth cappuccino---every component was perfect! The wine options and cocktail choices have something for every taste. The restaurant is visually beautiful--the soft candle lighting at the bar and all of the decorative touches are very warm and welcoming. The wait staff are energetic, charming, attentive and along with the chef and assistants, visible at work in the open kitchen, all emanate a wonderful positive energy.  It all makes for a memorable and delicious experience!

Delicious meal; So many dishes we wanted to try. We also had carnivores sitting at the table and they enjoyed everything so although it is pescatarian it is a fit for everyone! Fish lasagna was to die for (I'm still thinking about that amazing sauce). Only downside was we were sitting right beside the door (during winter) and everything someone entered/exited we were hit with a gust of freezing cold wind. I gave in and wore my winter coat for the last portion of the meal as I was frozen ❄️

It's the kind of place where comfort rules and your table is your own little escape.  It's a place where you can be yourself, relax, laugh with friends and enjoy great food!  It's the union of a casual restaurant and a lively neighbourhood gathering spot. Common dining, done uncommonly well.  Sit back, enjoy and let the hospitality at Union Social make your restaurant decision a simple one.

reviews.text: Tasty food. Decent number of beers on tap. Cocktail flavour was bland. Great plate presentation. Friendly staff, even with the computers down! Large space. Choice of music and decor reminded me of Calgary.
Great spot to chill with friends. Everyone there is friendly and in high spirits. Foods good reasonable price. Good for dates and social gatherings.
Great burgers, excellent Spicy Caesar. Lots of staff to serve you well. Except for the manager who sprayed the table to clean it without removing S&P.

I ordered their chicken noodle menu, I was expecting for a full flavor of spices but unfortunately it’s alright not to crave for. I was hoping they have the stir fried noodles instead of this version.
Good selection of food, fast service and excellent choice of beers on tap.
We've been to Union Social Eatery a few times over the past while and it's pretty good.  The positives are a good atmosphere, friendly staff and pretty good...

Um...just no...
Being gluten sensitive and from NYC, i found this place to have a great gluten sensitive menu, however, when it came to the actual food, it...

reviews.text: In searching for a venue to host my company's Holiday party, a friend recommended Vagabondo. Their online Group menus and offerings looked attractive and...
My coworker and I were looking for a dinner joint a few weeks before Christmas. We hadn't made a reservation anywhere, so as we walked south from work, we...

I came for Winterlicious on a Monday night.
Server was not especially attentive and I got the vibe that we were judged for ordering only the Winterlicious...

Meh?

This place tries to be classy and falls short.  When we first arrived the waitstaff was borderline harassing us to give our food and drink order.  Once we did, we rarely saw them again.  Had to get up and ask for service.  Food was delivered with no napkins or cutlery.  Water jug was not refilled, empty plates and glasses not taken unless requested.

Styrofoam take out containers, notes taped to the wall above the phone and clutter in the corners.

The three stars was for the food.  The hot peppers in oil were good, the pizza was okay if not a little too oily and the chicken breast moist.

This restaurant is a lovely hidden gem tucked away on Wellington just across from Berczy Park. The space is huge and the atmosphere relaxing. In terms of food, expect huge portions (and to be contentedly full for days), as well as impeccable flavour. This food is SO GOOD. The service was also amazing. The host went out of her way to make us feel at home and satisfied. I can't wait to come back here again for that amazing risotto!

The food was good, but the service was beyond lousy.  There was no host to seat us when we arrived.  Our waiter disappeared after our food was served.  We waited over 40 minutes for our check before We ended up flagging  down a different waiter to get our check.  After paying, on our way out the waiter who disappears shows up accusing us of not paying.

I love this place.  The food and staff are excellent.  Everything is always very fresh.  It's a great place right off the core where you can actually hear your dinner/lunch companion(s) speak.   The summer patio is an added bonus.  Do yourself a favour and head over.

I've eaten in at many Italian restaurants in Toronto and have to say that this is one of my favorites.  It has a very extensive menu at very reasonable prices.  The portions are generous.  And it is situated in one of the most picturesque parts of Toronto.  The outdoor patio in the summer is extremely comfortable.

lic_profile: Contemporary, chic and offering an intimate community vibe, Veloute Bistro is located in the heart of the Beach. Veloute follows the terroir farm-to-table slow food movement using locally sourced ingredients. Having achieved the level of Saucier and French cuisine at the Paris Marriott Hotel Champs-Elysees, Chef Fawzi Kotb's menu is designed to inspire and challenge the most discerning palate. Sommelier Alise Matos can help you select from the extensive wine list for the perfect complement to every dish.  Alternatively, feel free to bring your own bottle.

reviews.text: My boyfriend and I have dined here multiple times due to its excellent service and atmosphere, we always return every year. Our first encounter was for...
Went here on a Friday night. There's total of 11 tables and 8 tables were occupied. There's only 2 servers and the service was a bit slow. After we looked...

4.5 stars 

Came here yesterday for dinner, and boy did it NOT disappoint. We decided to come here for the Summerlicious menu (which I believe majority of...

Outstanding. Flawless service wasn't overbearing. Chef Fawzi and his team took the extra effort to make our anniversary one to remember. I'm especially impressed by their lineup of non-alcoholic cocktails outside of the usual water, pop and juice. My wife had one of the best red wines she's ever had. Everything was made from scratch; our food was expertly prepared and it showed Chef's dedication to his art. We will be recommending this to our friends and family for their special occasions wholeheartedly.

Not only delicious but also very different!

It was such a great experience to have a professional chef make your very special dish.
Good food and good service, pricey but hands down the best restaurant in the Beaches

Went there today with my wife for dinner (Winterlicious) and we had a great experience. The food was delicious and the service was amazing. 

I would highly recommend this restaurant to any one. Make sure you try the beer and goat cheese appetizer - it was so good!

My dear family took thier mother, my wife of 55 years out for Mother’s Day dinner to this restaurant in beaches. There were seven of us. The owners Elise and chef Fawzi greeted us warmly and introduced us to the the staff. Our beverage order was taken promptly. (Much needed after a 3 hours on the QEW/Gardner) Followed by a varied selection of appetizers and mains. Without a doubt the meals and service to my family is worthy of the 5 Stars+++
Note: after the meal chef Fawzi personally brought out chocolate covered strawberries to all the Mother’s in the restaurant. 
Thank you for the very special evening. 
Until we meet again
Philip and Mary

The "hidden" Elm Street location features a beautiful 60-seat outdoor patio and large dining rooms in the historic part of the YWCA building.  Highly passionate about good food and quality ingredients, Via Mercanti has been ranked on Joanne Kates' top 100 list, won Best in Chow's hit show "Pizza Wars" and been featured on "You Gotta Eat Here!"

reviews.text: Delicious gem in the heart of the city. Authentic Italian made pizza by Italian staff. It looks like a regular North American bar, but don't be fooled. One of the best patios in the city with some of the best and authentic food! Best to go on the weekend. They are empty as it's geared towards office lunch patrons during the week (when they're supposedly very swamped).
The patio is the cutest. The service is amazing and the food is beyond words. Homemade pasta, amazing charcuterie board and a gelato bar! Would definitely recommend it!

Good pizza in downtown Toronto. Neapolitan restaurant cozy but accomodating we had no reservations and we where seated during there busy lunch. Mozerella balls where very good and pizza was good. I got stuffed crust which had salami and goat cheese nice spice and something different. Worth a try. Good job

Great spot for pizza, very friendly staff. Fourth stop if you're in the area.
Add to bufalina when I was there, and I would have it again.
Delicious meal and great service. The lasagna, best I’ve ever eaten!

hidden and hard to see off the main streets...but their pizza is amazing!! i had the margherita and a spicy salami garlic cheese one.. 
the wait staff are...

reviews.text: I came here for Winterlicious with my cousin and had a wonderful dining experience. Giving 5 stars because not only was the food absolutely delicious, but...
We loved this place (5th time) but last week was just a horrible experience. We ordered two veal specials, the fish special, what was supposed to be Boar...
This was my second visit here. The first was during last years Winterlicious Festival and the second was last night for a birthday dinner. Our waiter was...

Came in for a nice dinner, big disappointment. Ordered a 1 app and 2 dinners. The tiger shrimp app was very very good, could of been a bit larger but overall great. My girlfriend ordered flaked cod, could tell it was warmed in the microwave as some pieces were cold while some hot, I ordered a rib eye and let me tell you I got it raw. Ordered it medium rare, the middle was raw. I tried to find a waiter but they were all busy or minding customers that were spending more. ( mind you they weren’t even half full), I mean of the waiters was drinking with customers, what the hell man. I normally don’t complain but food took to long, couldn’t get a hold of the waiter and I was so hungry I decided not to make a big deal. Spent 50+ on just myself, while I don’t mind the price it certainly does not merit the service provided. Go somewhere else, or else wait for a long long time.

I found this restaurant on Google took my girlfriend and was very happy with our choices that we selected. The lobster salad and grilled sardines was our starters was delicious. We ordered our main courses and ate it like tapas wow very surprised how amazing The shrimp and scallops were also the tuna steak. Our server recommended our wine for pairing for each dish and that didn't disappoint either. We both wish we lived in the city  but live in Niagara falls but will be back soon.

It’s like a Portuguese person dream dinner. Delicious fish, fair prices and a large eating area that is open concept. Via Norte accommodated my gluten free & vegan wife with options, simple but something that most other restaurants do not offer.
Tiger shrimp and scallops special was divine and prepared to perfection. Service was great. Owners both made the experience with their personable touch. Thank you!
Excellent food and table service.  Would highly  reccommend.  Waiter informed us that the owner is also the chef! 👌

reviews.text: Outstanding experience. The food and service were both excellent. If I had to find a fault it's all the choice... Great menu and many specials. I had the beet salad and lobster risotto... Both were great.

Great hospitality. This place really knows how to pay attention to details. My husband and I walked in and he forgot to get coat check, the manager asked if he could take his jacket and when were were leaving his jacket was with mine on the same hanger.  Servers were fantastic. I was at the bar for a short while and contemplating between two wines and the bartender immediately brought me both to taste test prior to making my choice. Table sever has good product knowledge, made the birthday girl feel special and was attentive to my husband's water glass once he realized how much he drinks. The food was exactly what you expect from a restaurant of that quality. Portion sizes were perfect if not generous. Timing of apps to main course was very good. Would recommend and I would come back again, even though we are from out of town.
Service and food are outstanding.  Staple items include patata pizza, margarita pizza, calamari/shrimps and salad with goat cheese.  Just come here the end!

My husband and I came here for our one year anniversary. The food was very good. The portions were small but filling. I always wanted to try winterlicious so I was happy.The wine was amazing. We loved the pianist. The restaurant was upscale, fancy and romantic. The service was good but I expected a little something extra as I did mention our anniversary  when I booked.

Came here with my elderly grandfather & cousins for a nice meal but unfortunately our waiter was insanely creepy. He was a middle aged bald man who was mumbling constantly but for some reason thought it was funny. My poor grandfather couldn't hear a word he was saying. Im not sure if he was an actor who was trying to be funny...but it really rubbed all of us the wrong way. Just be normal dude. Also, we ordered some ice-cream/gelato at the end our meal and it took over 30 minutes to come. We were all a little pissed off by the time we left & I don't think we will return. The food was decent...3.5/5 but service a big 0/5
In this neighborhood, this is the best I have tried -- and it was great. We went for my son's birthday. The atmosphere was formal but not overly so. When we...

This was a birthday party that was upstairs in the restaurant.

From the vineyards of Mendoza to the sights and sounds of Buenos Aires, Rosario, Northern & Southern Argentina, these atmospheric ingredients are what make for a true Argentiean experience. This is VOS, an example that goes beyond taste.

I went on a busy Saturday night. 
Food 100%
Service 98%
Waiters very friendly and fast.
The only problem is that they kept mixing the orders or bringing the...

We celebrated our father’s birthday Saturday night and as soon as you walk into the restaurant you are greeted by many friendly faces! :) the atmosphere itself is very inviting, very romantic. We had a private room downstairs which was really nice, the waiters where attentive on drink refills, they cleaned the table right away after each entree. Great service!! The music was amazing, such beautiful tango and Argentine folklore. But what really stood out was how AMAZING the
Food was!!😱 it was by far the best Argentinian cuisine we’ve ever had in Toronto.(we’ve tried a few) the food was so incredible that before we left my husband went to the kitchen to shake the chefs hand.🙌🏽👏🏽 It’s rare when he does that so I can say with much confidence that Vos restaurant  definitely delivers and we will for sure be coming back!!!👌🏽

Fantastic charcoal grilled food. Would recommend the chicken as it was very tender and well flavoured. 🐔 The sausage and calamari was also excellent. Definitely would recommend. Great ambiance and interior decor. The owner and waiters are very friendly.
Fantastic menu. Inviting atmosphere. Well-paced service. Attentive and knowledgeable staff. Delicious plates - octopus is a must try! A true taste of Argentina, I’ll be back.

Had a reservation for four on Saturday night. When we arrived at 7:30 the place was quite empty but by 8pm it was packed. Pleasant ambiance. Not so loud so as to prevent conversation. Friendly staff. The empanadas were very good as was the octopus which we shared as an appetizer. The rib eye steaks were excellent...tender, seasoned well and cooked perfectly. Deserts we shared - crepes and creme caramel - were delicious. Definitely  worth a return visit

Food--phenomenal! Service--incredible! Atmosphere-outstanding! Meat was cooked to perfection. Empanadas are highly recommended. The drinks were out of this world. Overall, my family and I leave very impressed with this restaurant. It met beyond our expectations.

lic_profile: A modern saloon, Weslodge delivers an elegant but hearty menu, artfully authentic cocktails and a sophisticated yet relaxed atmosphere featuring cutting edge décor. Executive Chef Ben Heaton has developed a variety of innovative yet approachable dishes, executed with a high level of technique. Weslodge's libations are created by a team of pure spirit mixologists led by Elan Marks. House made ingredients elevate classic cocktails to retain their original integrity.

reviews.text: There are no shortage of restaurants in Toronto, as the city offers an impressive range of international foods without needing to travel abroad. You don't...

Weslodge is a western themed saloon restaurant with beautiful decor and delicious food! 
The appetizer menu has some interesting items. Their smoked trout...
Weslodge Saloon is a solid 4.5 star and everything down from the experience, vibe, food & service was top notch.  This restaurant is basically a can't miss...

Where do I begin? My cousin and I went for a celebratory dinner and even before we entered the restaurant, the location as well as the exterior of the restaurant was a little hint of how great the night was going to be. We were greeted and welcomed and brought to our table. The ambiance reminds me of a lounge/ cigar lounge sort of vibe with dimmed lights, candle lighting, a massive and beautiful bar and great music. We had some of the most amazing dishes I've ever had including bone marrow. My braised beef literally fell off the bone without my even trying to take it apart and my cousin was stuffed with his order of fish and chips. The drinks were delicious as well and fairly priced. All in all Weslodge is a killer joint and a great place for a boys night out, girls night out, somewhere to grab a quick bite, a celebratory dinner and even a romantic date night. Weslodge brings the A game.
Went to Weslodge during a snowstorm.  It may have been crappy outside but is was warm and welcoming inside.  Great food and fantastic atmosphere!  Will definitely go back when I'm back in the city.

We went there on a Monday evening and the restaurant was pretty empty. Ive been there other nights and it's  usually buzzing. The decor is very saloon like and the food is always good. The drinks are strong and the staff are friendly. The front door is extremely heavy to pull open in the winter - I almost walked away thinking it was closed! Luckily a waiter came and opened it for me, apparently they've been having door issues this winter. Otherwise everything is wonderful there.

I left my phone at the table after having went for a few drinks. My waiter found it after we left and gave it to the who I believe was the owner. When I realized I left it behind they were so kind and had kept it safe for me. What a trustworthy group of people!! Plus, they have an amazing drink menu!

Fabulous good quality food and nice bright and spacious restaurants. 
We had the beef hash, French toast were and house smoke trout benny for brunch  and they were all awesome! Favorite was the hash. Service is amazing though, the host and  severs were very friendly and knowledgeable about the menu  Made good recommendations that we thoroughly enjoyed.

reviews.text:
It was a ~Winterlicous kind of visit~!!!
Booking: 4/5-The Greeter was very friendly & accommodating! Was easily booked by calling rather than completing it...
I'm using my 100th Yelp review as a PSA for everyone to avoid this place. Honestly the fact that the food was edible is what gave this place 2 stars but the...
Came here for dinner and tried their winterlicious menu. It was quite busy on the first floor considering it was a weekday. We were brought up to the second...

Absolutely delicious. Highly recommend!

Came here for a date night and did not underwhelm!

Came again, Feb 14/18:

Tables were a bit cozy upstairs but we went on Valentine's Day so it might have just been a large number of 2 tops replacing usual furnishings.  Food was amazing and staff were great.  Thanks for a memorable evening!

Decent steakhouse. The Tomahawk steak was very tasty and great to share with a friend. The overall experience is not the best in the city as the atmosphere is not high end and the service reflects that. But you will get decent bang for your buck here as the food is satisfying. The rating here is a great indication of what you should expect from your visit.

I this isn't the first time or the last time that I have been to wildfires.  I have only ever been to this location but would imagine that the quality and service would be consistent. 

Steaks are always good and not too salty unlike many of the higher end steak houses I've been to. 

Overall the wine selection is good and they do have enough wines in the more affordable range that you don't have to feel embarrassed ordering here. 

Intimate setting and a great place for sate night.

Absolutely the best steak I have ever had in my entire life, completely worth the drive from Barrie in the middle of a snow storm. Months later I still talk about how good the experience was. I would gladly go back, and recommend it to anybody I know.

Really good service here and a great choice for private events (at least 2 private rooms I am aware of). Steak was adequate although I was not blown away, very fatty for the price. Limited parking next door after 5pm, but street parking available too. Overall would return without question.

lic_profile: Just a few steps away from bustling Yonge Street, Wish offers a cool, laid back bistro setting of whitewashed décor. Knowledgeable servers deliver elegant and formal service, while the menu highlights dishes that are friendly to all appetites with a nod to current food trends.

reviews.text:
I came here with a friend for brunch on Saturday morning. We didn't have a reservation and had to wait 40 mins for a table inside.
The place is very...
Came here twice for brunch. The most recent time, my sister and I ordered the omelette and the salmon burger, both were quite average. To me, the appeal of...
Perfect spot for dinner and brunch.  The decor feels cottage chic inspired and is thoughtfully decorated with gorgeous candles, water pitchers and serving...

I am shocked to see that this place received so many 1 star ratings. My boyfriend and I walked by this place without reading the reviews and I am so glad we did. Our waitress was so attentive that our glasses were always filled with water. The food and the service here are incredible. The decor is fresh and romantic. There were fresh roses in the bathroom, that's the level of detail that I adore. I will definitely be going back here.

Such a cute place! They have a very nice covered patio in the front. And then small seating inside. It's a great place for a casual brunch or a date. The decor really adds to the atmosphere. The food was delicious. We went for brunch and got the eggs in purgatory and grilled Nutella sandwiches. They were really delicious and just enough food for 2 of us.

First time here, place had a great atmosphere, nice outdoor seating area for a summer night. Unfortunately, my first impression quickly soured as my guest and I sat and waited for what felt like an eternity before getting any service of any kind. There were only 5 other tables seated in total, and 2 waiters. And considering how small the outdoor area was, it was pretty shocking. When a waiter finally came to our table, not even a "hi, how are you?" Or acknowledging our long wait time. 
He simply said, "did you decide?" 

That pretty much ruined what could have been an enjoyable relaxing evening. As for the cocktails, the beezy tasted like mouthwash, although my partner's drink was fine. the calamari was very tasty although the sauce was a bit sweet for my taste. 

Overall, atmosphere and outdoor seating is a plus, service was awful, drinks were hit and miss. 1/5 would not recommend to others.

My husband and I were passing by the restaurant and thought it was beautiful so we decided to get inside. We order two burgers and waited for 40 minutes. During those 40 minutes, none of the waiters acknowledge or let us know about waiting time. Once we've asked, a waiter with an attitude told us: well, we need to Cook the burger!. We were about to ask him if they had to kill the cow or smtg? The burgers were not bad, very overcooked, a bit burnt but generous portions. We won't be coming back nor we recommend it.

visited with reservations for a group of four around noon for sunday brunch. it took ~15 minutes to be seated but the place was absolutely packed and we were not in a rush. the main section of the restaurant was filled with people waiting to be seated standing in between occupied tables but luckily we were seated around the corner. we ordered the eggs in purgatory, weekend omelette, and carrot cake pancakes which took 15-20 minutes to arrive but everything was extremely fresh and exceeded our expectations.
overall, the service was sub-par and there was a lot of waiting involved but it was worth it for the excellent quality of food we received. i would not recommend coming here without a reservation or if you get huffy about long wait times.
